loans.name: Musruf

texts.en: Musruf C., 46, is a farmer who has a small herd of sheep. He has 40 sheep and runs this business for the last four years. The business is very profitable and generates a stable income for his family. Musruf is married and has four children. Sheep breeding is the only financial source for his family. He is not alone in his business, as his brother also helps him in looking after the animals. He sells sheep to the local butchers or as meat. The mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people and Musruf is going to expand his business and purchase more sheep. For this purpose, he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to buy 20 sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is 32 years old and is married. Alphonse is the leader of a five-member group loan. Each member runs a different business. He is 32 years old and is married. His wife does not work.

Alphonse sells different kinds of clothes. The hours of his business are from six in the morning until six in the evening. This is his third successful year in his clothes selling business.

Alphonse and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing a variety of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana ella tiene 54 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto de 11 años de edad el mismo que está en primer año de colegio.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de carcasas y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, a esta labor se dedica todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 13h00 ya que a esas hora tiene que darle de comer a su nieto, en las tardes se dedica a lavar ropa ajena para ganar algo extra de dinero ya que según nos dice la vida está muy difícil y solo con trabajo va a salir adelante. Sus `productos los va a comprar en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar carcasas y accesorios para teléfono. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a través de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su casa de cemento, ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas, and for its happy people.

This is where we find 54 year old Ana.  She is separated, but she had three children from this relationship.  All of the children are adults.  She lives with an 11 year old grandson, who is in his first year of middle school.

She sells cases and accessories for cell phones.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m., which is the time she has to feed her grandson.  In the afternoons she washes other people’s clothes in order to get some extra money.  According to what she tells us, life is very difficult – it is only through work that you will get ahead.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her products.

This loan is to buy telephone cases and accessories.  She has been in the communal bank for ten years.  She likes it for the help that she gets through the loans.  Her dream is to have her house made of cement because the one she has is made from cane.

loans.use: To buy telephone cases and accessories

loans.name: José

texts.es: El señor José E. G. cuenta con un negocio de la venta de abarrotes desde hace 15 años llamada “Miscelánea Florecita” este es su fuente de ingresos para el sostén de la familia. Para seguir teniendo más incremento en sus ventas necesita comprar más mercancía para tener diversidad en producto.
texts.en: José E. G. has had a business selling groceries for the past 15 years called “Miscelánea Florecita.” It is his source of income to provide for his family's sustenance. To continue increasing his sales he needs to purchase more merchandise in order to have a wider selection of products.

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Alventina

texts.en:
Alventina S. is from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 53 years old. Alventina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alventina owns & operates a business making & selling Filipino snacks & other delicacies like biko, suman, puto or rice cake & bibingka in the local community. Alventina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alventina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alventina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Alventina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs & rice for rice cakes. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Alventina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed, such as flour, eggs & rice for rice cakes.

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nargiza's Group

texts.en:
Nargiza S. is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, her husband went to work in Russia. Nargiza is bringing up her two-year-old daughter. Nargiza is engaged in farming. She cultivates potatoes and then sells some of the harvest each month, earning 4,000 KGS monthly. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase potato seeds. In the future, Nargiza wants to provide her daughter with a good education and make house repairs.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor B. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 50 years old. Nestor is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Nestor  raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and raising pigs for sale. He also harvests and sells rubber extracts. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nestor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase medication for his livestock. Nestor is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nestor from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson O. K. is 30 years old, married and a father of three school-going children. He has practised farming in Narok town for the last six years. His farm is in a productive area suitable for crop farming.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he plans to buy agricultural inputs and hire manpower to aid in land preparation. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build rental units.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and hire manpower to aid in land preparation.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and single. She lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Lucila is engaged in farming – she plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells sugar, vinegar and other kinds of products. Lucila does her best to support her family financially.
Lucila's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Larisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARÍA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Larisa; la socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes,colonias,cremas entre otros la socia es consultora de la línea de belleza Esika,la socia le gusta mucho esta negocio ya que le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, a la vez la socia trabaja en un colegio nacional ella es profesora del nivel secundario, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Larisa belongs to the communal bank "MARÍA ELENA MOYANO," located in the Cusco district of the province and department of Cusco. 

Larisa is 28 years old and is single.  She alternates her daily chores with her business selling beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, creams and other products.  She is a beauty consultant for the Esika brand.  She enjoys this business very much, since it brings her satisfaction both on an economic and personal level.  Larissa also works as a secondary school teacher in a public school.  She is a very cheerful person who has a strong desire to get ahead.

Larisa is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her beauty products business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan, and pledges to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business selling beauty products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old and is single. He is a taxi driver with 3 years experience. He transports people every day from 8am until 10pm and he employs one person to help him.

David has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his taxi. With the profit, he will build his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential material for his taxi.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is 33 years old and married to Zipporah who works as a livestock officer. He runs an internet cafe at Gitaru in Kikuyu. He has been in business for the last five years.

This is Charles’ second loan with KADET, and with it he plans to upgrade the equipment for his cafe. He hopes with his returns that he will be able to expand his business.

Charles hopes to open another branch in the next five years and to give his family a better life.

loans.use: Charles plans to upgrade his equipment in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Julia Celina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tuvo cinco  hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, sus otros  hijos ya son mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, un soltero y una hija que es madre soltera y que vive junto a su pequeño hijo. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que también se dedica a la limpieza de pescado. Ella realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y también al comercio del mismo, él además de pescar también compra a barcos pesqueros en alta mar, luego que comprar sus productos los lleva a tierra firme para venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta estas playas y en ciertas ocasiones también se desplaza hasta las empresas y entrega directamente sus productos. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que el esposo lleva más de 40 años dedicado a estas actividades ya que empezó desde muy joven.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y materiales de pesca como  combustible, redes, etc. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por las charlas.
 
Su sueño es tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo, we find a place known as the sandy ground.  Here, the members of the Miraflores Communal Bank meet every fifteen days.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy, and the warmth of its people.

In this locale, we meet Julia, who is 53 years old. She in a common-law relationship and has five children, but one of them died.  Her other children are adults and two of them still live at home.  One is unmarried and one daughter is a single mother and lives with her small son.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a great housewife who also cleans the fish.  She is taking the loan for her husband who is in the fishing business.  In addition to fishing, he also buys fish from the fishing boats at sea.  As soon as he buys his products, he takes them ashore and sells them to traders who come to these beaches.  Sometimes, he also travels to the companies and delivers his products directly.  

Our friend tells us that her husband has devoted more than 4 years to this business as he started very young.

This loan is to buy fish and fishing equipment such as fuel, nets, etc.  She has been with the communal bank from the start and enjoys the conversations.    Her dream is to have very good health.

loans.use: to buy fish and fishing equipment such as fuel, nets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a special spray-painting generator and a power generator, which will make it possible for him to offer high-quality work in a shorter period of time

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 15 years. He is 63 years old, married to Wanjiru, and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES. 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to plant potatoes in his farm, and so he will use the loan amount to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In future, Titus hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
Maria Lucinda tiene 31 años, es divorsicada vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, en tierras de los padres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos .Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval y tejer ropa de lana
texts.en:
Maria Lucinda is 31 years old and divorced.  She lives with her children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The members of the Bellavista community bank live in Papauco Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from our office.  The group has eleven members who farm, raise livestock and carry out other business activities.

María is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat and corn on her parents' land.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in the same town.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  Her dream is to own her own home.

María enjoys the Carnival fiestas and knitting clothes.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 35-year-old married man with three children. They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Julius' dream is to build a permanent commercial house.

He has been operating a food store for eight years now, and his major challenge is inadequate capital to expand his store. Julius needs the Kiva loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom and his wife, the parents of two children, both fish for a living, earning about $6 per day. Prom is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a new boat. He hopes to be able to send his children to university in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat.

loans.name: Benkola Iv Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de dix femmes mariées, les membres du groupe BENKOLA IV ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOU, la deuxième assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. FATOU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 F CFA environs  en fin de fin.
texts.en:
Made up of ten married women, the group called BENKOLA IV has an average age of 34 and on average, four children. They live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture,  Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso for the first time. 

With this loan, FATOU, seated second from the left, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.  

Their crops are sold in the marketplace of their own village and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. FATOU expects to make an average profit of 50,000 F CFA  more or less at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, farm inputs, and small equipment.

loans.name: Urpis  De  Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Esther está levantando la mano). 

La señora Esther nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y  tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente, Esther vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Esther es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, Esther se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que está ubicado en su domicilio en el populoso distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco. La pueden encontrar de lunes a viernes en su negocio. Esther los días sábados vende comida en el mercado ferial del baratillo de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Esther requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas de azúcar y bolsas de arroz. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Urpis  de  Confraternidad” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta de comestibles, venta de comida, venta de productos de ferretería, venta de ropa y venta de jugos. 
 
Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
(In the photo, Esther is the one raising her hand).

Mrs. Esther was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 50. Currently, she lives in the same city in which she was born and where she now works. Esther is a hard-working, enterprising and responsible mother, who is getting her children ahead. Esther sells food in her small store located in her home in the highly populated district of Santiago, Cusco. She can be found in her business from Monday to Friday. On Saturdays, Esther sells food at the flea market in Cusco. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Now, Esther needs this loan to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar and bags of rice.

The members of the "Urpis de Confraternidad" communal bank meet every thirty days in Cusco city. The communal bank is made up of people who are hard-working and enterprising, who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and to offer a better future to their children through their daily efforts. The other members have various businesses such as, for example, selling groceries, selling food, selling hardware products, selling clothing, and selling juice.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy place, as well as being a commercial area. It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar and bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell in her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He owns rental houses which earn him a living.  He also rears pigs to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business because he has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped him to improve his business.

Francis has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Dinah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells products like sugar, beans, and posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava; like porridge).

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale, and will help Dinah to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Dinah hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop.

Dinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, like soap, for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells aluminum pans, coal pots and charcoal in Elmina. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband with taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more pans to increase the variety of her stock. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to acquire other varieties of pans to expand her business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
Presentacion de 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Presentacion desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de más alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.  Presentacion es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  tener mejoras económicas que ofrecerles.
texts.en:
Presentacion is 52 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own house.  It only has electricity and is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For eight years Presentacion has been raising and selling farmyard animals (sheep, pigs and chickens).  His farmyard is located behind the house where he provides the animals with balanced feed, fodder and natural grain.  Once they reach optimum size he takes them to the markets in the area where he obtains a good profit to cover his household expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more balanced feed and pay for healthcare for his animals.  With the income he obtains he will pay back the loan and improve his children's lifestyle.  Presentacion is a hard worker and very responsible.  He greatest desire is to help his children get ahead and provide them with a stable income.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and pay for healthcare for his livestock.

loans.name: Maize Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maize Group in Western Kenya! Sarah is the facilitator of the Maize group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Sarah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sarah had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Sarah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sarah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Sarah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Maize group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida D. 63 años D. edad, enviudó hace 5 años. Ahora solo vive con 1 D. sus hijos D. 23 años, quién estudia  y trabaja. Ambos viven en una casa propia en el distrito D. Tarma. Alida es una mujer, que a pesar D. su edad no descuida el tema laboral. DesD. pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Ahora en sus terrenos agrícolas siembra arvejas, papas, habas, entre otras verduras. El tiempo y la soledad hicieron que empleé una modalidad D. trabajo más solidaria y equitativa, la que consiste en asociarse con otro agricultor, en ese caso ella dispone D. sus terrenos, las semillas y abonos, mientras que el segundo coloca la mano D. obra en todo el proceso D. siembra y las medicinas necesarias. D. esa manera, en la cosecha dividen la producción en dos partes iguales. Ambos obtienen buenos ingresos. A la vez, Alida cuenta con animales menores como: cuyes, carneros y chanchos, a los que engorda y después D. 3 meses venD.. Y como sus ganancias no son diarias, también se desempeña como vendedora D. productos D. belleza por catálogo, así también, en las mañanas cuida bebés, y los sábados y domingos lava ropa ajena. Con estos diferentes oficios, ésta entusiasta e incansable mujer pueD. asegurar que, podrá construir su casa con materiales más resistentes (ladrillos y cemento) y extender sus sembríos. Con su ayuda, Alida podrá acceder a su primer préstamo D. MFP, por tal motivo se muestra convencida D. que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero del préstamo, podrá obtener una bolsa D. 25 kilos D. semillas D. arvejas D. 580 soles, así como bolsas D. abonos naturales D. 120 soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Alida, age 63, was widowed five years ago.  She now lives with one of her children, age 23.  He goes to school and works.  They both live in her own house in the Tarma district.

Alida is a woman who, in spite of her age, does not neglect labor-related issues.  Ever since she was little her parents taught her to work the land.  She now has agricultural land where she grows peas, potatoes, and beans, among other vegetables.

Time and solituD. maD. her employ a more equitable and supportive way of working.  This consists of associating with another farmer.  In this case, she provides her land, the seeds, and the fertilizers.  The other farmer provides the labor for the whole planting process and the necessary medicines.  This way they diviD. the harvest production into two equal parts.  Both of them get good income.

At the same time, Alida has small animals like guinea pigs, sheep, and pigs.  She fattens them and sells them three month later.  As this is not a daily income, she also sells beauty products by catalog.  Additionally, she takes care of babies in the mornings, and she washes clothes for others on Saturdays and Sundays.  

With these different jobs she is an enthusiastic and tireless woman.  She is able to ensure that she will be able to build her house with sturdier material (bricks and cement) and expand her crops.

With your help Alida will be able to get her first loan from MFP.  She firmly believes that she will make her payments punctually.  She will use the loan to buy a 25 kilos bag of pea seeds for 580 soles and bags of natural fertilizers for 120 soles each.

loans.use: to buy 25 kilos of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Sivet (in the photo) lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She is a widow with two children. One of her children is a garment worker still living at home, and the other is married and lives outside the family home. 

Sivet is a farmer and also cuts grass to sell for cow feed when she is free. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $300 to buy a motorbike for her granddaughter to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her granddaughter to get work.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. For the past 6 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, maize, and other products for resale and will help Edward to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to start selling wholesale. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize, and other products for resale.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Don Pedro, habita en la ciudad de León tiene 38 años de edad, es casado tiene tres hijos todos están están estudiando el es carpintero lleva 8 años dedicándose a este negocio. Este a sido su primer negocio, lo inicio con capital propio antes trabajo en una empresa de fabricación de muebles de ahí adquirió experiencia e inicio la idea de poner su propio negocio de carpintería. El requiere el préstamo para compra de materia prima como pegamento, madera renovable, clavos, limas para elaborar muebles. Pues tiene varios pedidos y con la compra de este inventario de materia prima podrá culminar con sus pedidos y mejorar sus ingresos. En lo futuro le gustaría comprar maquinas y equipos que le ayuden a fabricar en menos tiempo muebles de fina calidad para dar a conocer sus trabajos humildes pero de muy buena calidad pues su objetivo principal son darle estudios universitarios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Pedro lives in the city of Leon, he is 38, married and has three children that are in school, he is a carpenter, has done this for eight years.  This is his first business, he started it with his own capital, before this he worked for a company making furniture where he gained experience and thought of opening his own carpentry shop.  He needs the loan to purchase raw materials such as glue, plywood, nails and sandpaper to make furniture, because he has several orders and by purchasing these raw materials he can complete the orders and have more income.  In the future he would like to buy machines and equipment that will save him time when making good quality furniture and this way get people talking about his simple but good quality furniture, his main goal is to put his children through university so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as glue, plywood, nails and sandpaper to make furniture

loans.name: Candida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cándida, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, aprovechando la temporada de diciembre y comprar mercadería queso, crema, cuajada y maíz de esa forma podrá mejorar en sus ingresos y podrá tener variedad para sus clientes.
Ella considera que los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque ella y su familia se mantiene en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cándida is requesting a new loan to invest in her business. She is taking advantage of the December season and buying merchandise like cheese, cream, curds, and corn. This way she can improve her income and will be able to have variety for her customers.

She believes that the previous loans helped her because she and her family have better conditions in life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curds, and corn.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr: Rosette vous remercie beaucoup pour le prêt que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Le crédit lui a permis de développer un peu l'activité, les articles ont augmenté en nombre et diversifiés, donc le fonds de roulement est un peu renforcé. Et pour pouvoir réaliser le rêve d'ouvrir un grand magasin, elle va encore continuer à investir davantage dans l'activité pour pouvoir augmenter le fonds, le chiffre d'affaire et les bénéfices. C'est la raison pour laquelle, elle renouvelle sa demande de crédit. Et elle espère de ce fait que vous aussi, vous allez encore l'aider.

loans.use: to purchase toys, cups, plates, hair straighteners and food processors

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.en:
I have been working for three years selling dairy products such as small cheeses, butter, cheese, also corn, beans and firewood. In my community I am one of the only people who sell these products, which are basics for daily consumption. I hope I can increase my earnings and help my children in their education at the university level.

Loan Use: Buying butter, cheese, small hard cheeses, beans, corn and firewood.

Tengo tres años de dedicarme a la venta de lacteos como quesillo, mantequilla, queso, maiz, frijoles y leña. En mi comunidad soy una de las pocas personas que venden estos productos y que son basicos para el consumo diario. Espero poder incrementar mis ingresos y poder apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios universitarios.

loans.use: Compra de Mantequilla, Queso, Quesillo, Frijoles, Maiz, y leña.

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en: Habibullah Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. This 30-year-old single man began his business since she was 16 years old. Because the family condition was very heavy. In the beginning of his business he sold bags. Having borrowed the loan $300 he has bought the 30 couple of shoes. Now he has rented the shoe shop and he needs a loan of $500 to expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.use: To expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Koy S. is 21 years old and lives with her parents and three siblings in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. helps her father and mother (pictured here because S. was unavailable) to run the family’s grocery shop, which they operate in their village.  They purchase items from the market, then resell them for a higher price in the village, which is more conveniently located.  The family can usually make about $3.50 per day from their grocery business.  S. hopes to use this loan to expand the family’s grocery business by purchasing more products to sell.

loans.use: To increase the size of the family’s grocery shop

loans.name: Ziyafat

texts.en:
Ziyafat is married and has 3 children. He is 37and lives inthe  Salyan region, Yenikand village. 
He has his own shop  where he sells decorations.
Ziyafat has been in this business for 4 years. 
Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy decorations more expand his business.

loans.use: To buy decorations

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
My husband works hard to send all five of our children to school. I help him when I can with his tailoring business. Last year we took a loan of $170 with which he purchased a sewing machine. Now he wants to hire some help so that he can take more orders and expand his business. With the increased income, we will not have to worry about our children’s education being interrupted. We need this loan to buy another machine and expand my husband’s business.

Sajida J., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and hire help

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wenen

texts.id:
Besides a tenant farmer, Wenen also help family finances by raising 4 fattening pigs. Wenen is persistent in her work. Every morning at 8:00AM Wenen feeds her pigs. Before feeding she bathe her pigs first, and also clean the stall. Evenings at 4:00 PM Wenen again feeds her pigs. Capital needed of Rp 1,300,000 (Us$143) are neede to buy pig feed and medicine. Profit could be as high as Rp200,000 ($22)/month. With that profit Wenen could help her husband to finance the family needs. Although the two children finished highschool, they are still unmarried, and live at home. Daily living expenses are about Rp20,000 (US$2.20). The house is built on own land, but the building is semi permanent. Wenen's hope is that with the expected capital received, her business could prosper, and a better family living.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani, Wenen juga membantu penghasilan keluarga dengan memelihara babi penggemukan sejumlah 4 ekor. Wenen sangat tekun dengan pekerjaannya. Setiap pagi pukul 8.00 Wenen memberi makan babinya. Sebelum diberi makan, babi-babinya dimandikan dahulu dan kandangnya juga dibersihkan. Pada sore hari jam 16.00 Wenen kembali memberi makan babinya. Modal yang dibutuhkan Rp. 1.300.000 untuk memelihara 4 ekor babi. Semua modal itu dipergunakan untuk membelikan pakan dan juga obat – obatan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 200.000.- perbulan. Dengan keuntungan yang diperoleh Wenen, bisa membantu suaminya untuk menghidupi keluarganya.Walaupun kedua anaknya sudah tamat sekolah SMA, namun mereka belum ada yang menikah, sehingga masih menjadi tanggungan keluarga . Biaya hidup sehari-hari yang diperlukan Rp. 20.000.- Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang semi permanen. Harapan Wenen dengan modal yang diperoleh usahanya menjadi maju dan kehidupan keluarga lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed and medicine

Membeli pakan babi dan obat -obatan

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es:
Alvaro is an enterprising man. He has been selling fruits, legumes and vegetables at the local market in Leon, Nicaragua, for the past four years. He purchases his products from wholesalers (farmers who come to the city) and then sells them to customers at the market.

He started the business with the severance pay from his previous job. He currently has a fixed post at the market but is still in the outdoors, displaying his products in baskets and protecting them from the elements.

Alvaro is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Previous loans have allowed him to improve and stock his business, helping him to benefit economically. He hopes to continue his good credit history and keep growing his business and moving his family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Alvaro es un señor emprendedor, lleva 4 años trabajando en la venta de frutas, verduras y legumbres para las personas que llegan al mercado La Terminal, en León. Le compra los tomates, las chiltomas, las cebollas, papas y otros a los mayoristas (pequeños finqueros que llegan a la ciudad a vender su producción). Luego esto lo vende a los clientes que visitan el mercado

El, para tener su negocio invirtió la liquidacion que le dieron en su trabajo anterior. Sus ventas las realiza actualmente en un puesto fijo, pero aun al aire libre, exponiendo sus productos en los canastos y le da toda la luz del sol y la lluvia.

Don Alvaro es un señor casado, tiene a sus esposa y tres hijos que mantener de los cuales todos ellos estan estudiando, uno de ellos en la primaria y dos en secundaria.Los créditos que ha tenido le permiten mejorar y surtir el negocio, ha mejorado economicamente y desea mantener su buen historial crediticio para seguir creciendo y salir adelante con su esposa e hijos.

loans.use: Purchase fresh products (fruits, legumes and vegetables) to sell.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy K. wants to build a permanent structure for her saloon and is requesting a loan to do so. With the loan, she also wants to increase her inventory by buying wigs and oils.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a permanent structure

loans.name: Keyli

texts.es:
Keyli belongs to a communal bank and lives in Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She's 44 years old and has three children, two who are grown and one who is still dependant on her. Her husband is a motorized rickshaw driver. With her initial loan Keyli decided to start her own sewing shop, which she currently runs out of her own home. She rises at 6 a.m. to make breakfast for her son and husband and then goes to work making the dresses her customers order.

With the $450 loan, which she plans to repay in five months, Keyli will purchase wood, nails, bars, cement, sand and other building supplies to make improvements on her shop.

Keyli is happy to belong to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos and of having started her own business. It makes her feel more independent, and she's grateful to all the people who always support her in reaching her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Keily pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora del Carmen, vive en el Psj La Lupuna Mz. G Lt. 9, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre de tres hijos, dos ya son independientes y uno aun depende de ella, su esposo es motocarrista. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, Keyli decide implementar su taller de costura. En la actualidad ella continúa con el taller de costura instalado en su propio domicilio, se levanta a las 6 a.m. para hacer el desayuno de su hijo y su esposo y luego se dedica a coser las prendas que le encargan sus clientes. Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,300 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ella comprará maderas, clavos, listones, calaminas, cemento, arena, ripio, etc. para arreglar el ambiente donde funciona su taller. Keyli está feliz por pertenecer a Manuela Ramos, de haber puesto su propio negocio y se siente más independiente y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que siempre la apoyaron para la realización de sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make improvements on sewing shop (wood, nails, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Assalé is 32 years old, married and has three (03) children. Her husband barely gets by and has an irregular income. She buys sandals in the grand market in Lomé at wholesale prices, and then re-sells them at retail prices in the local market. She has been running this business for more than three years. The current loan will allow her to increase her stock in order to satisfy the demands of her clientele, and also to increase her income in order to continue contributing to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Yawa Assalé est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et est agée de 32ans.Son mari se débrouille et a un revenu irrégulier. Elle achète des sandalettes au grand marché de Lomé en demi-gros qu'elle revend en détail au marché local. Elle exercerce cette activité depuis plus de trois ans. Le présent emprunt lui permettra d'augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle et augmenter son revenu afin de continuer à aider les charges familiales

loans.use: To buy sandals in Lomé for resale in Adéta

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad A. is a 36-year-old farmer who keeps milk cows and sells milk to the local people. He started his business in 2005 and, since that time, many things have changed, and keeping just one cow is not enough to cover even the basic needs of his family. He applied for $1000 USD to purchase one cow for $700 USD and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Somoe

texts.en:
Somoe is 25 years old and is a single woman. Somoe started selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 3pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Miss Kafui A. was born on September 6, 1990 in Davié in Zio County. A trained hairdresser, she manages to contribute to her parents' living expenses thanks to the income from her trade. Single with no children, she was able to manage the previous loan she obtained appropriately.

At present, she is requesting a loan which she plans to use to purchase a hair dryer and other beauty salon supplies so as to increase her income and participate more in improving living conditions for her parents.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Kafui est née le 06 septembre 1990 à Davié dans la préfecture de Zio. Coiffeuse de profession, elle arrive à se prendre en charge contribuer aux charges de ses parents grâce aux revenus de son métier. Célibataire sans enfants, elle a su gérer le précédent crédit obtenu.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat de séchoir et d’autres matériels de coiffure afin d’augmenter ses revenus et participer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses parents.

loans.use:
Dryer and beauty salon supplies

Séchoir et matériels de coiffure

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mrs. Vin P. is a subsistence farmer in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is a 25 year old mother of two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Her husband, Mr. Ry Sao, is currently a farmer and firewood seller. Mrs. Vin P. does not have draft animals to plow her rice plantation since her cows are too small. For this reason, Mrs. Vin P. has decided to ask for a loan to exchange her small cows with big ones to be used as draft animals. Previously, Mrs. Vin P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow cart to transport fertilizers in order to improve the yield of her field.

loans.use: To exchange her small cows with big ones to be used as draft animals

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Hong, born in 1953, wants to borrow 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to raise chickens. She has a very difficult life because she is somehow the soL. bread winner in her family. Her husband is a veteran, and the war has stolen his eyes. He is now the president of the Blind Society in Dong Anh district, Hanoi. Mrs. Hong's husband and she now have to provide money for their child who is going to school for associate degree. Her family's average monthly income is around 3,500,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD). Mrs. Hong is a responsibL. person. Thus, she is voted to become the leader of her group, including

P. Thi Duy (born in 1970) with the loan amount of 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 220 USD) to invest in her restaurant.

N. Thi Tuyet (born in 1967) with the loan amount of 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to make iron nails.

N. Thi Tam (born in 1976) with the loan amount of 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to raise pigs.

D. Thi Nhung (born in 1978) with the loan amount of 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to invest in her gas sales business.

L. Van Binh (born in 1975) with the loan amount of 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to invest in her electronics repair store.

N. Thi Gai (born in 1952) with the loan amount of 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 220 USD) to sell rice.

N. Thi Tiem (born in 1945) with the loan amount of 636,000 VND (equivalent to 40 USD) to raise cattL..

N. Thu Ha (born in 1975) with the loan amount of 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to sell frozen food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva's Volunteer.

Tạ Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1953(Ms 03020011), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà. Gia đình cô rất vât vả vì kinh tế chủ yếu tập trung trên vai cô. Chồng cô là bộ đội phục viên, chiến tranh đã cướp đi đôi mắt của ông, nay ông là chủ tịch hội người mù huyên Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Hiên nay, vợ chồng cô chỉ phải nuôi 1 con đang học trung cấp.Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ. Cô là người có uy tín nên dược bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Phạm thị Duy, sinh năm 1970(Ms 03020014), mức vay: 3.604.000 để đầu tư cửa hàng ăn uống. Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, sinh năm 1967(Ms 03020007), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để kinh doanh làmđinh sắt. Nguyên Thị Tâm, sinh năm 1976(Ms 03020015), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđđể chăn nuôi lợn. Đỗ Thị Nhung, sinh năm 1978(Ms 03020013), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng bán ga. Lê văn Bình, sinh năm 1975(Ms 03020012), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng sửa chữa điện tử, điện lạnh. Nguyễn Thị Gái, sinh năm 1952(Ms 03020009). Mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để kinh doanh của hàng gạo. Nguyễn Thị Tiệm, sinh năm 1945(Ms 03020010), mức vay: 636.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thu Hà, sinh năm 1975(Ms 03020006), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để bán hàng đông lạnh

loans.use: raise cattle

loans.name: Jesuscristo Es La Puerto Group

texts.en:
Roselin P. dreams of expanding her small business and turning it into a store with a variety of different clothes. She lives today in San Pedro D. Macoris. Roselin P. is a woman with four children ages 11, 9, 7, and 5. She has two jobs each day she wakes up: one is to take care of her children and the other is to find a way to live comfortably with them in a small house of her own.

Rosalin belongs to an association in San Pedro D. Macoris called "Jesucristo". The fifteen members of this association are there for the same purpose: to make a better future for themselves and their loved ones. Roselin is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell, and thereby proviD. more benefits for the ones she loves.

Roselin and her story are typical of the "Jesucristo" Bank of Hope, 15 men and women who work hard to improve their lives with the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Roselin's--these fifteen members are able to manage with the help that you give our organization. Thank you!

loans.use: To invest in her business by purchasing more new and used clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Meach

texts.en: Mrs. Meach R. was born in 1956. She lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is attending school. Mrs. Meach R. is a farmer. The soil in her rice field is poor, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field in order to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura is a 33 year old mother of three children, ages 3, 5 and 7.  She started a small clothing store at the beginning of 2008.  It is open from 7 am to 9 pm and she has been earning $100 per month.

loans.use: To buy a wider range of clothing to improve her business

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Jacinta Del Socorro T. tiene la edad de 51 años,  su estado civil es soltera, ella tiene una hija a su cargo con la edad de 20 años que cursa recientemente contaduría pública, los deseos son de seguir con vida para luchar con la situación económica en la que estamos y apórtale ayuda en sus estudios a su hija, ya que con lo que su hija gana no es suficiente para pagar sus propios estudios, razón que impulsa a Doña Jacinta a seguir apoyándola en lo que mas se pueda, otros de sus propósitos es salir adelante con este negocio ya que este le ha generado  ingresos a su familia por lo que desea mantenerlo siempre activo, además esta el darle mejoras a su vivienda para proporcionar  un mejor porvenir a sus hijos.


Ella se dedica a la  actividad económica de mercadería en general como: perfumes, cremas y talco, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y pensó en la idea de ofrecerle a sus compañeros de trabajo algunos productos es entonces que decide comercializar la venta de cosméticos ya que le resultaría fácil la distribución de los productos que lo realiza por encargo por que además de esto ella tiene la profesión de maestra  y es así como logra incursionar  en este negocio y su hija quien mas tarde  le brinda  el apoyo para este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para ampliar de forma mas segura en sus productos y así ofrecer una variedad de productos y hacer las compras en las diferentes casas comerciales una de ellas es Avon por lo que le resulta mas factible la compra en mayores cantidades de productos y así obtener ingresos  favorables.
texts.en:
Ms Jacinta Del Socorro T. is 51 years old, single, and has a 20-year old daughter still dependent on her, who has recently studied public accounting. She wants to improve her financial situation and help her daughter pay for her studies as her daughter does not earn enough to pay for them. For this reason, Ms Jacinta helps her daughter as much as she can. Ms Jacinta also proposes to continue with the business as it is generating income for her family and she wants to be active and this allows her to improve her quality of life and provide a better future for her children. She sells a variety of merchandise, such as perfumes, creams and talc. She started this business to improve her standard of living and thought of selling to her colleagues. She decided to sell cosmetics as it would be easy for her to distribute the products because she is also a teacher. That is how she started her business, which her daughter will later help her with. The financing will give her working capital to extend the range and variety of products she offers, as well as different name brands, such as Avon, which she would be able to purchase in greater quantities, to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
A 39-year-old businesswoman from Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental is battling the odds with her bakery. Loreta A. is married to Bonifacio who is her greatest aid in their bakery business. They patiently send their 5 children to school. To support the needs of the family, they work hard to sustain their business. They also raise a ittle poultry and a few pigs in their own backyard for additional income. Loreta holds the belief that with a family helping one another, business will succeed. They have taught their children to cooperate and most especially to do well with their studies.

Recently, she has applied for her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. The amount will be used to purchase additional sacks of flour, quick dough and other baking ingredients.

The couple wish to employ baker and packers for their bakery. They feel that the Lord has blessed their business. They want to see their bakery to grow big, but nothing is more fulfilling than to see their children earn their diplomas.

loans.use: Purchase additional sacks of flour, quick dough and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Susi

texts.es: Susi tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella es enfermera técnica, pero el cuidado de sus hijos la obligó a dedicarse a su hogar, esto no limitó su capacidad de trabajar y contribuir en los gastos, es así que hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida dentro de su domicilio, no descuida su casa y mantiene su negocio propio. Gracias a esta actividad no deja de sentirse útil  para obtener dinero y por la gran concurrencia de personas por su zona, puede vender grandes cantidades de platos al día, lo dificultoso es la preparación de grandes cantidades de comida. Susy está en su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha está muy contenta de formar  parte de este banquito comunal y se  identifica como una persona responsable. Por las festividades tendrá que duplicar las cantidades de comida que prepara y atender algunos pedidos que tendrá, para satisfacer estos requerimientos invertirá la cantidad que solicita en diversos utensilios y víveres.
texts.en:
Susi is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She is a medical assistant but the care of her children obliges her to dedicate herself to the home. This has not limited her capacity to work and contribute towards household expenses. That is why, for the last three years, she has devoted herself to the sale of meals prepared at her house. Without neglecting her home, she is able to maintain her own business. Thanks to this activity she thinks she will always be able to support herself, and due to the large congregation of people in her area, she will be able to sell large quantities of her Dish of the Day. The most difficult aspect is the preparation of large quantities of food. Susi is in her seventh loan with MFP, and so far she is very content to be a part of this little communal bank and to be known as a responsible person. For the holidays, she will have to double the amount of food she prepares, and pay attention to her orders. In order to accomplish this she will invest the amount of her loan in various cooking utensils and groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de utensilios y víveres para la preparación de alimentos

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa U. is a rice vendor in the remote and mountainous area of Cabisera 27, Hacienda, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela.  She is married to Edwin and they have eight children: Edna – 24 years old, elementary graduate; Lorna – 23 years old, high school graduate; the twins Edwin and Francisco – 20 years old, high school graduates; Harold – 15 years old, currently in fourth year high school; Jennie Rose – 13 years old, second year high school; Herson – 10 years old, grade four and Erica – 8 years old, grade two elementary student. 

Jesusa and her husband are helping one another in making a living for their family.  Jesusa decided to request a loan of $225 for them to have additional capital that they can use in their rice vending business. They want to expand the business for it is their major source of income in sending their children to school and in helping them to cope up with their daily needs.  Through the business, they will also provide the necessary farm inputs needed in their farming activity.  Like any entrepreneur, Jesusa and her husband are working hard to reach their goals.

loans.use: For additional capital to be used in their rice vending business

loans.name: Comite La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado La Esperanza es un grupo que opera con la Fundación Paraguaya de Cooperación y Desarrollo hace más de 2 años. Es un grupo excelente, no incurrieron en atrasos en ninguno de los ciclos trascurridos.
Las integrantes del comité se dedican a diversas actividades comerciales como la venta de gallinas, tabaco, así también a la venta de insumos para el hogar.
Ellas trabajan activamente en su grupo realizando actividades para la recaudación de fondos.
El grupo ha demostrado la capacidad suficiente para considerarlo  muy solidario, responsable y activo.
El comité La Esperanza ante todo considera que el pago en forma puntual es un compromiso de reputación y cada integrante considera que el pago del crédito está por encima de otros gastos familiares.
Las integrantes se basan en el afecto y la preocupación por el otro.
texts.en:
The committee named "The Hope" is a group that has been operating with the Paraguay Foundation of Cooperation and Development for over 2 years. It is an excellent group that has not been affected by any of the recent business cycles. The committee members are dedicated to a variety of commercial activities, such as the sale of chickens, tobacco, as well as household supplies. They all actively participate in the activities of the group to earn and collect funds. The group has demonstrated the ability to be considered very supportive, responsible, and active. The Hope committee considers punctual payment of their credit to be important to their reputation and each member realizes that the repayment of their loan is the primary focus before payment of other family expenses. Group membership is based on the affect and concern each person has for one another.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tobacco, chickens, clothes, and basic household supplies such as: sugar, yerba mate (herbal tea), meat, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suriani

texts.id: Periode pinjaman I dengan DINARI dilalui oleh Ketut Suriani dengan hasil yang menggembirakan. Keuntungan dari penjualan babi peliharaannya setelah dipotong pokok pinjaman ke DINARI mencapai Rp.200.000,- per bulannya. Tentunya hasil ini membuat ekonomi keluarganya menjadi lebih baik dari sebelumnya karena hasil ini mampu menambah penghasilan suaminya untuk membiayai kebutuhan sehari-hari. Melihat ketekunan Ketut Suriani dalam memelihara babi maka DINARI pun kembali membantu dengan pinjaman periode II yang tentunya memang menjadi harapan Ketut Suriani. Pinjaman ke II ini mengalami peningkatan dari sebelumnya menjadi Rp.6000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan. Pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman dengan anggapan semua babi peliharaan sudah terjual. Ketut berencana akan membeli 8 ekor babi pada periode ini, dengan harga per ekor Rp.350.000,-. Beberapa diantaranya akan dipelihara hanya 3 bulan, sisanya baru akan dijadikan penggemukan selama 6 bulan. Uang pinjaman ini juga akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan. Tentunya Ketut berharap hasil yang didapatkan akan semakin bertambah sehingga mampu membuat ekonomi keluarga menjadi lebih baik lagi.
texts.en:
The period of loan I with Dinari had completed by Ketut Suriani yielding good results. Profit from sale of the reared pigs after deducting the loan from Dinari achieving Rp.200.000,- per month. Definitely this yield improved the economic condition of the family over prior condition as this yield increased to the husband’s income for covering daily expenses. Observing Ketut Suriani’s diligence in rearing pigs, Dinari is willing to again aid with loan for period II that certainly is hoped by Ketut Suriani. This loan II will naturally increase over the prior one to Rp.6.000.000,- with a maturity period of 6 months. Repayment will be at the end of the period with the assumption that all the pigs would have been sold. Ketut plan to purchase 8 pigs for this period, costing Rp.350.000,-. Several among then will be reared for 3 months, the balance will reared up to 6 months. The money from this loan will also be used to buy supplies for the 6 months during the rearing period. Definitely, Ketut hoped the yield achieved will continuously increase until is able to improve the famil’s economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria L. trabaja en el área rural D. La Paz es pequeña agricultora y productora D. leche D. vaca y comercializa queso D. vaca el esposo trabaja D. albañil, es su principal fuente D. ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. sus tres pequeños hijos.

Viven en la comunidad Caluyo - Batallas D. la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. una vaca lechera D. mediana calidad y mejorar su producción D. leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento D. pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria L. works in the rural area of La Paz. She is a small farmer and cow milk producer who sells cow milk cheese. Her husband works as a construction worker. It is her principal source of income with which she supports her three small children. They live in the community of Caluyo - Batallas in the Los Andes province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase an average quality milk cow, to improve her milk production and to improve her income. This is her third loan with Impro. The good payment history which she has demonstrated with our institution allows her access to another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVESTMENT CAPITAL

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita D. is married with three children. She is currently living at Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. Amelita engages in a food vending business where she sells food through peddling. Her direct customers are neighbors, school teachers, and students.

Amelita is already 50 years old. She wishes to build a simple food stall of her own. She is confident that she could serve and satisfy her customers well if she could build her food stall. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000.00 to materialize her plans.

loans.use: To build a food vending stall.

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Señor Edgar Velázquez tiene 27 años de edad y está casado con su señora quien tiene 32 años. Ambos son padres de una niña de 9 años de edad llamada Guadalupe, quien desea estudiar artística.

  El cliente trabaja en la terminal de ómnibus en donde vende pasajes para La Empresa de Transporte público San Luis S.A., y cuenta con 9 años de antigüedad. Su esposa es ama de casa.

 El préstamo solicitado será destinado para terminación de una vivienda que está construyendo, en donde tiene pensado en un futuro no muy lejano montar un negocio, consistente en una despensa y carnicería ya que cuenta con una ubicación estratégica.

Desea un país con mayores oportunidades para la gente que quiere trabajar.
texts.en:
Edgar Velásquez is 27, and his wife is 32. They have a 9 year old daughter, Guadalupe, who wants to study art. For 9 years he has worked as a ticket agent in the bus terminal for public transportation in San Luis S.A. His wife is a housewife. The loan is to finish the house he is building. In the near future he plans to install a store and butcher shop since they have a strategic location. He would like a country with greater opportunities for people who want to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on his house to be able to set up a store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
“Life is not a problem to be solved, but a gift to be enjoyed and experienced” is a simple quotation that Jocelyn G. shares. She believes that living life to the fullest will satisfy everyone’s daily existence - for life in earth is just temporary, she adds. For her, living life to the fullest means living with her family: thus, she works very hard for them. She is only 24 years old and happily married. She and her husband, Michael G., have two children.

By maintaining her street food-vending business, Jocelyn is able to help her husband afford their family a simple, contented standard of living. However, the couple works hard for the education of their two children, whom they hope to give a better future by sending them to school through college. Jocelyn has therefore requested a loan from Kiva lenders as capital assistance for managing her business well in order to earn a higher income. She is taking out a small loan in the amount of PHP 5,0000.

Jocelyn wants to expand her business and earn a higher daily income by operating a typical village store business where she can display her street food items and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To expand her food-vending business

loans.name: Henry Jose

texts.es: Henry José Gonzáles M. tiene la edad de 27 años. Es un hombre casado. Y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Y pesar que ha pasado por mucho no ha perdido las ganas de salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada y tortillas. Hace mas de 3 años que inicio este negocio, comenzó con la ayuda de su esposa ya que ella elaboraba las tortillas y el recorría  las calles a venderlas y los fines de semana se encarga de ofrecer la ropa usada a sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes. Henry es un hombre responsable por lo que para el es muy importante llevar el sustento diario para su familia. Los financiamientos han sido de buena ayuda pues todos han sido muy bien aprovechados. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para invertirlo en su negocio y así comprar leña, maíz y ropa. Los sueños de Henry son de seguir manteniendo esta única fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Henry José Gonzáles M. is 27, married, and raising two children. In spite of the fact that he has been through a lot, he has not lost the desire to get ahead. He sells used clothes and tortillas. He started his business over three years ago. He started with his wife’s help. She makes the tortillas, and he travels the streets selling them. On the week ends he sells used clothes to his friends, neighbors, and some customers. Henry is a responsible man, and it is very important to him to provide his family with their daily bread. The loans have been a good help, and he has used them very well. The loan he is asking for is to buy wood, corn, and clothes. Henry’s dream is to maintain this sole source of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is 48 years old and is married with seven children. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan of N20,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 53 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es mejorar la calidad de vida que actualmente lleva. Su actividad diaria comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana sale junto a su inseparable motocarro en busca de personas que necesiten de sus servicios de transporte. El es una persona muy carismática, lo cual ha hecho que los clientes no le falten y que su motocarro sea uno de los más solicitados de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con los pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que realizar jornadas de trabajo de casi 16 horas, lo cual para su edad es muy cansado y lo desgasta mucho. Para un futuro cercano espera poder comprar otro motocarro y así generarse mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querido, por la alegría que demuestra. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su motocarro, puesto que con el tiempo ha ido fallando y ya es hora de un mantenimiento.
texts.en:
53-year old Mario is a hardworking, cheerful man who lives in his own house with his family. What he would most like to do is improve the quality of his current life. Every day he starts work very early, at 6 am approximately, along with his motorcycle taxi which is never far from his side, looking for people who need his services. He is a very charismatic person so he never lacks for customers—his motorcycle taxi is one of the busiest in the neighbourhood. Most of all he enjoys chatting to the passengers and making their journey more pleasant. He has been doing this work for eight years; the most difficult part of his job are the long 16-hour days of work which at his age are very tiring and wear him out. One day soon he wants to be able to buy another motor taxi so he can earn more money. This is his second loan with Kiva partner, MFP; he has always repaid the instalments on time, as he doesn’t want to cause any problems in the community bank where he is much liked for his cheerfulness. With the 800 soles he will repair his current vehicle which has started to have a few problems and now requires some maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is married and has two children. She operates a cyber café in the town center of Nairobi. Her target market is walk-in clients and students. Before she started this business, Charity sold clothes in a market on the outskirts of Nairobi. Due to declining demand for clothes, she decided to open a cyber café in April of this year. The cyber-business has been good, and she has requested a loan of Ksh. 20,000 to redo the cabling and wiring in order to improve the ambiance of her business. With increased traffic, she hopes to relocate her business from the third floor to the more accessible ground floor.

loans.use: Improve wiring/cabling

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
