Jocelyn M. is 46 years old and is married to a fisherman. She has four children ranging in age from 15 to 24 years old. She joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2003, requesting a business loan because she has to augment her husband's sporadic income to be able to send all of their children to school until college. Her loan was used to finance her husband's livelihood of fishing. It has been nine years that this business has been Jocelyn's main source of income. She sells the fish her husband has caught every day in the market. Jocelyn has been able to have a hog fattening (pig raising) business from her profits. The profits she has with this business are twice as much as the capital. Income with this business is every four months and timely to support the semester tuition fees of her three children in college. 

With the loan she is applying for now, Jocelyn plans to expand the fishing business and also to finance her hog fattening business. She knows she can afford to pay larger amounts of weekly amortization in ASHI if her business grows. Another factor that influences her courage is her very supportive husband and cooperative children.

loans.use: Will be used to financing her fishing business. Small portion will also be used to finance her pig raising business.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita or Warly as she was popularly known in their rural village in Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is already a widow and have four children.  Despite of this, she works hard to earn a living and be able to survive poverty. Through her income from her general store, she was able to support the financial needs of her children. Warlita patiently maintains her store to be able to increase her daily income.  

To further maintain her business, she is now asking for a loan of Moreover, she is proposing to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8, 000 that will be utilized in her store. With the help of the loan, not only that she can provide the needs of her family but she can also provide the needs of her customers through her store by having additional merchandise.  She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends university while her husband is employed as a carpenter in a flour factory. Oyungerel and her family live together in their own little house. 

Oyungerel owns and operates a clothing business where she makes both European and Mongolian clothing. She started her clothing business in 2007 and, because the clothing has been so popular, has been able to hire two assistants. She would someday like to open her own store for her clothing. Oyungerel is requesting a 3,000,000 Tugrug (~2,100 USD) loan to purchase more fabrics and materials in order to expand her product range and attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials for clothing business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una mujer dinámica y muy impetuosa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 48 años y es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad,  se dedica a la venta de madera  en tablas y listones, para ello cuenta con un local donde exhibe la madera, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que realiza la misma actividad, pues ambos trabajan juntos en este negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas” desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo que recibió le permitió invertir en prendas de vestir, en la actualidad Aurora necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que le permitirá invertir en madera ya que ella compra en trozas y luego los convierte en tablas y listones para vender. La meta de Aurora es tener su propio local y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Aurora is a very dynamic and a very earnest woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Coronel Portillo province. She is 48 and has two grown children. She sells lumber (batten trim and paneling). To do so she has a place to display the lumber. She counts on support from her husband; he does the same work. They work together in this business. She has been part of the Las Dinámicas Communal Bank for two years. The first loan she received allowed her to invest in articles of clothing. Aurora currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy lumber. She buys it in pieces and later converts it into batten trim and paneling to sell. Aurora’s goal is to have her own place and to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale lumber

loans.name: Siyama

texts.en:
Siyama M. is currently in the business of selling maize and shorgum at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase peeled and dried cassava to sell.  Siyama is 32 years old and is married to a security guard. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for stocking more cereals to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education,human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase peeled and dried cassava to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es recientemente madre, vive con su pareja en la casa de sus padres. Ella y su pareja han iniciado un proyecto que les será muy provechoso en mediano plazo, consiste en la realización de un vivero de café. Los anhelos de esta pareja joven están centrados en este vivero, ya que ello será el inicio de un futuro prometedor. Pero mientras tanto, trabajan  como jornaleros, a ella le pagan 15 soles por todo el día y a su esposo 18 soles. 
Para Rosario no son pesadas las labores agrícolas, puesto que desde niña trabajó en ellas. 
Su mayor deseo es de  triunfar mediante sus cultivos de café, y sabe que lo logrará a base de mucho trabajo y la colaboración de su esposo.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la elaboración de su añorado vivero de café.
texts.en:
Rosario recently became a mother. She and her partner live in the house of her parents. Rosario and her partner have embarked on a project that will eventually be useful – they have started a coffee nursery. The aspirations of this young couple center on this project, so they hope it will be the start of a promising future. In the meantime, they work as farm laborers. Rosario is paid 15 soles each day while her husband receives 18 soles. Farm work is not difficult for Rosario since she has been doing it since she was a young girl. Her greatest desire is to become successful at growing coffee, but she knows that it will require a lot of hard work and cooperation from her husband. This is Rosario’s first loan with MFP. She is committed to making each of her payments on time. The money will be used for the development of her coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Development of a coffee nursery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This entrepreneur is 29 years old and single. He has 8 years of experience in his business and has one employee. This is the second loan that he has received from Al-Thiqa to enlarge his shop. He plans to use this loan to expand his shop and hire more employees to raise his income.

loans.use: To buy equipment and decorations for his barber shop

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ny M. is a group leader of four members who all live in Toek Klang village in Kandal province. He is 36 years old and the father of three children, two of whO. are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

My. Ny M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates both rice and vegetables. His wife, Mrs. Chhorn Chamroeun, is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Ny M. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. He will share this loan with the other members of his group.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita Q. is from the village of Taganas. She is 49 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita is just starting this business. 

In 2002, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Teresita's 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle to sell

loans.name: Yuliana Milagros

texts.es: La Sra Yuliana Milagros H. L. de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo menor. Ella se encuentra domiciliada en la casa de sus padres ubicada en el Caserio de Sacta. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial desde hace 2 años. Gracias a su empeño, esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su hijo, esta logrando adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda ya que en el terremoto del 2007 la casa de sus padres se vio efectada. Su sueño es construir la vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Yuliana Milagros H. L. is 30 years old and a single mother of one young boy. She lives in her parents' home in Caserio de Sacta. She has worked in the fields of an agricultural business for the past 2 years. Thanks to her hard work and efforts, she is able to support her son and provide for his needs. She is requesting the loan to improve her home which was damaged in the earthquake of 2007. Her dream is to rebuild the house to improve her standard of living. She is very grateful for the support she will receive through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Diego Alcalas

texts.es: El señor Diego tiene el negocio de venta de zapato en el mercado, el crédito lo utilizara para la inversión al negocio y a si poder incrementar su inventario y tener una mayor ganancia para darle a su familia lo que necesitan el señor Diego antes de tener el negocio era trabajador de otra tienda, y empezó su negocio con un crédito pequeño y a si poco a poco lo ha ido incrementando el es padre de dos niños y por ellos es todo el sacrificio que hace en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Diego sells shoes in the marketplace. He will use the money from this loan to invest in his business and increase his inventory. He wants to increase his income in order to better provide for his family who depend on him. Prior to starting this business, he used to work in a different store. He started his business with a small loan and he grew it little by little. He is the father of two children, for whom he sacrifices and works.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina O. tiene sembrado 3mnz de plátano  en su finca que está ubicada en Tonala-Pto. Morazán.
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para darle mantenimiento a la platanera como en compra de fungicidas, TPH, etc. Además va a comprar alambre y grapas para cercar la platanera para que el ganado no dañe el cultivo.  

Ella piensa que si le hace todos los mantenimientos necesarios a la platanera, podrá sacar buenos ingresos y así mejorar tanto su vida económica como familiar, aunque ella vive solo con su marido ya que todos sus hijos están grandes y son independientes.

Doña María ha tenido 11 créditos con la Institución los cuales los han pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma, y dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, ya que siempre le ha ayudado cuando ella más lo necesita.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Justina O. has planted 3 mnz of banana in her farm located in Tonala - Puerto Morazan. She will use this loan to maintain the banana plantation and to purchase fungicide, TPH, etc. She will also buy wire and staples to fence the plantation so that the cattle doesn't damage the harvest. She believes that if she performs all of the necessary maintenance for the banana plantation, she will earn enough income and in this way improve both her family life and her finances, although she lives only with her husband since all of her sons are grown-up and independent. Doña Maria has already had 11 loans with the institution, and they have always been paid on time, and she says she is very grateful with CEPRODEL, since she has always received help when she has most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of banana plantation

loans.name: Sikirat

texts.en: Sikirat is married to a civil servant and they are blessed with 5 children. Her children are doing well in their business, jobs and school and this gives her joy. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells motor spare parts and engine oil at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts and engine oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa S. is a 39-year-old married woman from Gaza. She is living with her husband and five children who have all entered school.

Salwa has been working in a grocery store with her husband since 2009. She is hoping that, through this loan, she will be able to buy new refrigerators for the store in order to keep all their dairy products fresh. This will bring in new customers and will increase their income.

loans.use: To buy new refrigerators for the store to keep their dairy products fresh

loans.name: Sonadores Con Propositos Group

texts.en:
Manuel is the coordinator of his group Mujeres Sonadores (Women who Dream), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo, where the economy is based around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple, rented structure with a long term partner and their child.

Manuel is excited to be taking his tenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to expand his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business running a colmado, or small general store, by purchasing cooking oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, and fish to sell in his shop. He will use the profits to invest in furniture for his home as well as saving towards purchasing a plot of land on which to build his own home. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, and fish.

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Siaka Samaké est un homme marié de 41 ans et père de 5 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le village de  N'tentoukoro, un village situé à 15 kilomètres de Ouelessebougou (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt Siaka abandonna les études pour les activités génératrices de revenus auprès d’un de ses ami. Il opta pour le créneau de l’alimentaire avec l’achat et la vente de céréales de différentes sortes.
Avec une expérience de 3 ans, Monsieur Siaka Samaké maîtrise bien son activité.
Afin d’obtenir un fonds de roulement considérable, il décida de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son troisième prêt individuel, pour acheter différentes variétés de céréales.
 Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants  Ouelessebougou et effectue sa vente à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  à Ouelessebougou et à N'tentoukoro à domicile à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Siaka Samaké is a 41-year-old married man and the father of five children.  He lives with his wife and children in the village of N'tentoukoro, located 15 km from Ouelessebougou (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Early on, he dropped out of school in favor of income-generating work with one of his friends.  He opted for a niche in foodstuffs, the buying and selling of grains of various kinds.  With three years of experience, he a good command of his business.  In order to obtain considerable working capital, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his third individual loan for buying differently varieties of grain.   He gets his supplies from the villages surrounding Ouelessebougou.  And he sells in Bamako (capital of Mali), in Ouelessebougou, and in N'tentoukoro out of his home.  His customer base is diverse and varied.  With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to expand his enterprise. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Lumipac. She is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the selling of assorted dry goods in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Adama Thiéwal

texts.fr: Adama Thiéwal DIALLO est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUDARA depuis 2006 elle a 7 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète des gousses d’arachide, les décortique, les grille au feu de bois avant de les amener au moulin pour la transformation en pate. Les différents marchés de sa zone lui servent de point d’écoulement de sa marchandise. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge les besoins de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Adama Thiéwal DIALLO is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 2006, has been granted six successive loans, and has had no problems reimbursing them. She manufactures and sells peanut paste. She buys raw peanuts, shells them, grills them over a wood fire, and takes them to the mill to be ground into paste. The various markets in her area serve as outlets for her merchandise. Her objective is to participate in managing her family’s needs, while bolstering her savings level.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Aïssatou Elhadj

texts.fr: Aïssatou ELHADJ D. est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis le 16 octobre 2008. Elle développe un petit commerce de sucre, de thé, de lait et d'autres condiments de cuisine. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter en quantité plus importantes ces produit énumérés en vue de réaliser plus de bénéfices. C'est depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois qu'elle a initié cette activité qu'elle voit se développer de cycle en cycle. Elle participe financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou ELHADJ D. is 37 years old and a married mother of one child in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BOYINGUEL since October 16, 2008. She is developing a small business involving sugar, tea, milk, and other kitchen condiments. With her new loan, she is going to buy larger amounts of these itemized products with the goal of making more profit. Aïssatou initiated this business since joining the Banc Villageois. She sees developing it from loan cycle to loan cycle. She takes part financially in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small-scale business for tea, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn P. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Genalyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling foods, snacks, educational products and also medicine in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon S. is from the village of Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Corazon is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding and for sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn E. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 36 years old. Amilyn is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Amilyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Amilyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Amilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Amilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Amilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Norn Chou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people from Tuol Krang village, Kandal province are applying for this village bank loan;  they will use their portions of the loan for different purposes.  

The members  have selected Mrs. Norn C. as the village bank president. Mrs. Norn C. is 50 years old and a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. She works as a farming laborer and she is also a pig breeder who can earn large amounts of money to support her family. Her problem is that her piglets are too small to sell, but she does not have enough money to support them. So to improve her pig-breeding business, Mrs. Norn C. is applying for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Alma's Group

texts.en:
Alma M. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. She is 45 years old. Alma is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase medication for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar es empleado y reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel donde vive junto a su esposa, él tiene 28 años de edad y trabaja en una empresa de mensajería desde hace 6 años como asistente de oficina, este es el único ingreso con el que cuenta su familia.
Oscar necesita mejorar su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero para realizarlo, por esta situación el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a mejorar las condiciones en la que se encuentra su vivienda, el desea mejorar y ampliar una parte de su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Sus proyecciones son reparar su vivienda y que está este en buenas condiciones, seguir trabajando para dar a su familia lo necesario y poder pagar este préstamo sin atrasos.
texts.en:
Oscar lives and works in El Transito, within the San Miguel department, along with his wife.  He is 28 years old and has been working as an office assistant for a messaging company for six years.  This is his family's only income.

Oscar needs to improve his home but doesn't have the money with which to do it, so he's seen fit to request a loan so that he can improve the living conditions of his home.  He wants to expand part of his house so that his family will be more comfortable.

He will repair his house so that it will be in better shape, continue to work so that he can provide for his family's needs, and to be able to repay this loan without falling behind.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita C. is from the village of Estrada. She is 46 years old. Rosalita is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalita owns and operates a general store. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be the first loan taken by Rosalita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nieves; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, que atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y fideos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the La Unión communal bank, located in the district of Cusco and also in the province and department of Cusco.

Nieves is 50 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business, which she attends to from 6am to 7pm to get her children ahead. She wants to expand her grocery store and she is requesting the loan to purchase products for her store like rice, sugar and pasta.

Nieves is grateful for everyone who is making this dream possible and promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To buy products for the grocery store such as rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Luz Divina 3 Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una de los miembros del Grupo Luz Divina 3; localizado en Los Alcarrizos ubicada al norte de la ciudad de Santo Domingo y es muy industrializada, y con una gran población que también dependen del las empresas y economía de la ciudad principal, en donde como muchas otras ciudades hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Esta asociada de Esperanza se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulatoria y con una pequeña tienda en su casa. Sonia es madre soltera de 1 hijo, con el cual vive y dedica su tiempo a criarle mientras trabaja. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil conseguir dinero y poder proveer lo necesario para su casa y poder ayudar a sus padres.

Sonia está muy emocionada de recibir su 3to. préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y así haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició al adquirir una ayuda de un familiar quien le ofreció la vender juntas ropa. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de diversas variedades de vestir, como pantalones, faldas, camisas, accesorios, etc. Esta Planeando utilizar sus ganancias para re-invertir en su negocio y así poder tener mas y mejores mercancías. Su sueño es poder tener una familia saludable y feliz.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of “Luz Divina 3” group which is located in Los Alcarrizos in the north of the city of Santo Domingo.  It is a very industrialized place with a large population which depends on the businesses and economy of the main city.  As in many other cities, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants.  Sonia works selling clothes in the streets and in a small store in her home.  Sonia is a single mother and has one child with whom she lives.  She devotes her time to raising him while she works.  She tells us that her biggest challenge is making enough money, being able to provide for her household and being able to help her parents.

Sonia is very excited to be receiving her 3rd loan from Esperanza Internacional after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and having taken a step further in growing her business.  She has had her business for around 2 years.  She started her business with the help of a family member who suggested they sell clothes together.  She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of a range of different clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, accessories, etc.  She is planning to use her profits to re-invest in her business, thereby enabling herself to have more and better merchandise.  Her dream is to be able to have a healthy and happy family.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio G. H. es de 32 años de edad conviviente hace años con la señora Leonarda Miranda Angulo tienen 3 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria, viven en Colomi calle López y López entre Aroma zona Barrientos área urbano, se dedican a la actividad agrícola, aparte tiene 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno que los tiene como de engorde; El señor Eleuterio G. y su esposa se alquilaban yunta cabezas de ganado vacuno para utilizar en las faenas agrícolas. 

Por esa razón se acercaron a consultarnos para sacar un préstamo para comprar dos cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta)  así poder economizar sus ingresos y aumentar su producción agrícola, por ultimo nos cuenta que a partir de ahora mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia hacia el futuro.
texts.en:
Eleuterio G. H. is 32 years old.  He has lived with his partner Leonarda Miranda Angulo for years and they have 3 dependent children who are studying in elementary school.  The family lives in Colomi, in Barrientos district, an urban area.  They are farmers and have 4 heads of cattle besides those which they keep in order to fatten.  Eleuterio G. and his wife hire out yoked cattle to use in farming work.

For this reason, they came to see us about taking out a loan to buy two heads of cattle (yoke) so that they could save up their income and increase their agricultural production.  Finally, Eleuterio G. tells us that, from now into the future, his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.en:
Yamileth is a 42-year-old mother of 2 who lives with her husband and 2 children in San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica. Yamileth is involved with various productive activities which permit her to provide for her family. Her main occupation is a transportation service for school children. 

Monday to Friday from 5:30 AM to 4:00 PM, Yamileth collects and drops off children in a mini school bus (more like a van) from 3 different schools. As a side job, she carries various types of merchandise in her van, which she sells to various clients she meets throughout the day.  Teachers, parents, and acquaintances purchase items such as tennis shoes, perfumes, and electronic equipment from Yamileth. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in additional merchandise (perfumes, tennis shoes, and others) in order to sell during the holiday season. In general, Yamileth prefers not to use loans, only when necessary. She says a main obstacle in her life is the high cost of maintaining her van.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Jenny Mercedes

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

En este lindo lugar encontramos a la señora Jenny, ella tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  6 hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor tiene 10 años y está en escuela. Su esposo fabrica ladrillos.

Ella es un ama de casa que junto a su esposo se dedican a fabricar ladrillos que son utilizados en el campo de la construcción, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8 h 00 hasta las 17 h 00, sus hijos trabajan con ellos a cambio de un sueldo semanal ya que ellos tienen sus propias familias. Fabrican los ladrillos y luego los entregan  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar sus productos. 

Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para la fabricación de los ladrillos como aserrín, leña, agua, entre otros. La señora fue socia fundadora del Banco comunal luego se retiro por un ciclo y regreso hace tres ciclos le  gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a entregar sus productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of Santa Martha Community Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city renowned for its diverse regional products, including the straw hats and shawls which are known throughout the country and beyond. 

It is in this beautiful place that we meet Jenny. Jenny is 49 years of age, married and has six children. Five of them are grown up and the youngest is 10 and at school. Her husband makes brick for a living. 

Jenny is a housewife and together with her husband she makes bricks that are then used for construction. They work from Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm. Their children work for them and are paid a weekly salary since they all have their own families. Once the bricks are made, they are sold to merchants who come to their house to purchase their products. 

This loan will be used to purchase materials to make bricks, including saw dust, wood and water, amongst others. Jenny was the founding member of the Community Bank, and though she left the bank during one loan cycle, she returned to the bank three loan cycles ago and has been with them since. Jenny likes the loans that are offered through the bank because their interest rates are low. Her dream is to have a car so that she can deliver her products to her clients.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make bricks, including water, saw dust, wood, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jessica, Tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su esposo trabaja en Manta en una fábrica. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la Fundación Espoir.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica en Manta pero también se dedica a la venta de yogurt, ella recibe el producto una vez por semana lo guarda y durante la semana se encarga de venderlo a sus clientes, nos cuenta que hay semanas que al siguiente dia ya no tiene nada ya que la mayoría ya los tiene encargado, este producto lo recibe desde Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar más yogurt y tener para surtir a sus clientes. Sus sueños son tener una empresa de fabricación y venta de yogurt.
texts.en:
The community bank named "For a New Dawn" meets every two weeks in Canton Montecristi, a region known for its rich pre-colonial heritage and for the nationally and internationally known artisans. This is where the famous straw hats originate.

Here we meet Jessica. She is 26 years old, she is married and she has two children from this relationship, aged 5 and 2. The eldest is in kindergarten. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.  She has been a member of the community bank for the past 4 loan cycles and she enjoys it for the additional benefits that are rendered by Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner). 

Our friend works in a factory in Manta but in addition, she also sells yogurt. She receives her product once per week and she resells during the week to her clients. She says that there are some weeks that she sells out the day after receiving a shipment because the majority of her clients place orders. She receives her products from Guayaquil. 

This loan will be used to purchase more yogurt in order to meet client demand. Her dreams are to have a production company to make and sell yogurt.

loans.use: To purchase yogurt.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Anju T.. She is married and has 3 children aged 30, 26 and 25. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for vegetable farming. In the future, Anju plans to lift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal) and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold at the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy materials to make traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Precy Jade

texts.en:
Ms. Precy Jade C. is from the village of Triunfo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old and single. She is still a student. In order to finish her studies, she is presently engaged in a buying & selling business for processed foods such as "longaniza" (sausage) & dried fish, since her parents lack financial means. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for almost two years already and earns approximately Php 3,000 a month from this business activity. 

In 2009, Precy Jade joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precy Jade is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, and she is now requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as her first loan, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to finish her studies and improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, possible product innovations, and business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory and working capital for her business

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia M. is from the village of Pob. Manukan. She is 55 years old. Constancia is married and has three children. To make a living, Constancia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Constancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constancia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Constancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 30 year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 7 and 5.

Melanie is engaged in farming. She grows rice that she sells to the market. Melanie works hard to keep her farm productive. She also grows pigs in her backyard. She said she has to earn better to sustain her children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina; la socia tiene 45 años de edad casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura sembrando papa,maiz,cebada entre otros esta actividad la socia lleva años realizando esta actividad ,a la vez la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos como tarwi y kinua ella compra en el distrito de Pisaq su mercadería para luego venderlo en el mercado de Huancaro en la feria sabatina que se realiza, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono y semillas para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". It is located in the community of Yuncaypata in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Agripina. She is 45 years old, married, and she has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her agriculture business, harvesting potatoes, corn, wheat and other products. She has many years in the business. She also buys and sells products such as tarwi beans and quinoa seeds. She makes her purchases in the district of Pisaq and she later resells them in the market in Huancaro at the fair they hold on Saturdays. She is a very happy person and she is very eager to keep working for the sake of her family.

She requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her fields.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Omer

texts.fr: Né le 03 décembre 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Omer vit depuis dix ans à Finagnon un quartier de Cotonou. Omer est marié à Aïtcha une revendeuse, et a sept enfants, tous scolarisés. Omer assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges de la maison. Omer a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour nourrir sa famille et satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens, Omer achète à Dantopka, marché international du Bénin, des cartons de poissons et d'ailerons qu'il revend à son domicile depuis cinq ans. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Omer de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Born on 3 December 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Omer has lived in Finagnon, an area of Cotonou, for ten years. He is married to Aïtcha, a retailer, and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Together with his wife, Omer takes care of the family's expenses. He ended his studies at the secondary level. For the past five years, in order to feed his family and meet his daily needs, Omer has been going to Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, to buy boxes of fish and poultry wings that he re-sells at his home. This first loan will definitely allow him to raise the level of his business and increase his clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy boxes of fish and poultry wings

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 26 years. He operates a barber shop in Gitaru trading center as his primary business, and has been doing so for the last ten years. Besides this he also operates an entertainment place with a pool table and other games. 

This is his second loan with KADET and he wants to use it to buy more furniture for the barber shop, and also to invest in the pool-table business.

He hopes and desires to own better business premises in seven years time.

loans.use: to buy funiture for his barber shop

loans.name: Marina Santos

texts.es:
Marina de 53 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es viuda y tiene una hija mayor de edad. Tiene una papelería.

Empezó con su negocio hace 11 años con muy poco dinero ya que por una o otra razón le pedían en el sector artículos de papelería, con el pasar del tiempo a tenido sus altas y bajas en el negocio, hace unos 3 años su conyugue la abandono y a causa de eso su negocio bajo parcialmente, hace 4 meses su conyugue regreso pero al siguiente día falleció de un infarto, despues de esa tragedia ella se a dedicado 100% a su negocio. Labora de 7H30 am a 10H00 pm con ayuda de su hija .

Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas productos para su negocio como cuadernos, bolígrafos, papelería para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere arreglar su casa para que sus nietos puedan vivir en un ambiente acogedor y tener el negocio mas grande para que rinda mas.
texts.en:
Marina is 53 years old and lives in Playas canton which is one of Ecuador's tourist spots.  It has a wide range of seafood.  Marina is a widow and has a grown-up daughter.  She owns a stationery store.

Marina started her business 11 years ago with very little money since, for one reason or another, people in her sector were requesting stationery products from her.  Over time, she has had her ups and downs in her business.  Some three years ago, her husband left her and, as a result, her business declined slightly.  Four months ago, her husband returned but the next day he died of a heart attack.  Following this tragedy, she has dedicated herself to her business 100%.  She works from 7.30am to 10.00pm, with the help of her daughter.

With this loan, Marina would like to buy more products for her business such as composition books, pens and stationery to increase her income.  In the future, she would like to fix up her home so that her grandchildren can live in a welcoming environment.  She would also like a bigger business that can make her more money.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, composition books, pens and stationery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old divorced woman living with her parents and one sibling. She is from Lebanon. She works at producing handicrafts, embroidery and all artistic work and she's a very talented woman. She works upon request of the clients who ask for speciA. orders. Her work is based at her home and she is well-known in her area. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a food stall, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the holiday season he experiences a high customer turn-up while during the months of January to May he experiences a low customer turn-up. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 he wants to purchase sacks of maize flour and sacks of beans. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize flour and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Yenis Gezabel

texts.en:
Yenis lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras where she runs a small pig farm as well as selling baked goods and soft drinks. She wakes each morning to tend to the pigs she raises as well as bake a local snack called "rosquilla" that is made from cornmeal. 

Yenis is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to purchase cornmeal, soft drinks, and pigs, all of which will be used in her eclectic business.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, yeast, soft drinks, and pigs.

loans.name: Celerino

texts.en:
Celerino is 48 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with four school-age dependents.

He is a farmer. He owns and operates a business venture in planting and harvesting. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income comes from planting and harvesting rice.  He has been engaged in this business for 20 years. Every quarter, he earns approximately 45,000 PHP (~$1050) from doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to pay for the labor costs of land preparation and rice planting. Celerino has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, he hopes to gain more income and purchase farm equipment.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost of land preparation and rice planting.

loans.name: Nazeh

texts.en: Nazeh, from Madab, Jordan, is 56 years old, married, and the father of three children. He has a shop selling vehicle accessories. He started his business years ago offering vehicle maintainace, then expanded it to selling vehicle accessories too. It is Nazeh's aspiration to expand his project to include mechanicA. work and he is looking to involve his sons to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle accessories

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. 

Majed has been an owner of a cafeteria since 2009, where he prepares all kinds of food and drinks. He has a lot of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local consumers, and his cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to renovate and fix his cafeteria's ceiling, doors, and floor. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his cafeteria’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: Zainab M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in the eastern city of Kenema. They have applied for a loan of 12,400,000 SLL from SMT, a partner of KIVA, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy goods or invest in something that their mere salaries alone cannot let them do.  At the end of each month, their school’s bursar deducts the repayment from their salaries and pays KIVA on these teachers’ behalf.

Zainab is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Pujenhun 50 years ago, Zainab is married and has 6 children, one of whom is in college.  The rest are no longer attending school. Zainab has requested this loan in order to invest it in a business.  She will buy local produce in large amounts for resale.

loans.use: to buy local produce for resale

loans.name: Máximo Israel

texts.es:
El Señor Máximo Israel se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su familia y ha logrado mantener en mejores condiciones de vida. Él se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajador y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 
 Actual mente ha acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para Reparar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales, tales como: Perlines y Hierro, y pago de Mono de obra para la Mejora del techo de su casa y así obtener mejores Condiciones en su familia. Con esto empezara a las mejoras de su vivienda
texts.en:
Sr. Máximo Israel is known for being a hardworking person who knows how to provide for the welfare of his family and has managed to maintain good living conditions.  Máximo is known as an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling him to earn the respect of many people in his town. 

He came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that he could make repairs to his home. The loan he requested will be used to buy construction materials such as crossbeams and iron.  He will also pay for labor so that he roof of his house can be repaired, thus providing better conditions for his family.  With this loan, the improvements to his home can begin.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor so that the roof of his house can be repaired.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is aged 49 and has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya for the last 10 years. He is married with six children four of whom are already schooling. He works as a security guard in the local market. His farm produces milk, sugarcane and eggs.

Alfred has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying more poultry and building a bigger and better poultry unit for the increased number. He adds that he has had good experience in the business and the loan will help improve his family's livelihood.

He reiterates that lack of finance coupled with animal diseases are the major challenges both in dairy and poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr: Elle est une commerçante qui va à l'étrangé pour se ravitaillé en marchandises. Habitant dans une ville proche de la capitale de Sénégal elle s'active dans dans ce secteur depuis plus de 15 ans. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement afin d'acheter des marchandises en Mauritanie et de l'aider dans la construction d'une boutique au marchée pour étre plus visible et plus accessible.
texts.en:
This lady is a merchant who travels abroad to purchase her merchandise. She lives in a city near the capital of Senegal. She has been engaged in her activity for over 15 years. 

This loan will strengthen her working capital to allow her to purchase merchandise in Mauritania and help her in setting up a shop at the market for better exposure.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and set up a shop

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella est une couturière de profession, elle vie dans une ville du Sénégal. Elle fait ce métier depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tissus comme (des basins, des sois, des lins) qu'elle va confectionner pour les revendre comme des habits de prêt à porter.  Une parti de ce crédit est utilisé pour l'achat d'un nouveau machine a coudre qui va lui permettre d'être plus efficace et plus rapide dans la confection. Elle veut aussi avec les profits qu'elle aura acheter d'autres machines pour mieux répondre à la demande
texts.en: Ndella is a dressmaker by profession.  She lives in a town in Senegal.  She has been in this profession for more than 15 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics such as damask, silk and linen which she will make up and sell as off-the-peg clothes.  Ndella will use some of her loan money to buy a new sewing machine which will enable her to make her clothes more efficiently and quickly.  She would also like to use the profits that she will make to buy other machines so that she can better respond to the demand that she has.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Calle Cordova (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Calle Córdova. Esta linda ciudad se la conoce por el nombre de la Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos.

Este es un grupo de personas decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, servicios, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ana tiene 37 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijas de 17, 12 y 8 años de edad  que estudia una en escuela y las dos mayores en colegio.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida desde hace varios años trabaja en una hostería de la ciudad, allí realiza trabajos de limpieza y otros arreglos del lugar, pero para ganar un dinero extra también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo el cual lo realiza puerta a puerta en sus ratos libres, tiene muchos clientes que le compran su mercadería además su hija mayor también le ayuda con sus ventas ya que les ofrece a sus compañeras de clases. Ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva dos años en esta actividad y le va bastante bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Es su primer crédito en el banco y espera seguir por mucho tiempo.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijas terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the “Calle Córdova” communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  This pretty city is known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds.”

This is a group of people that decided to join together into this communal bank which will be very useful because with the loans they will be able to improve their small businesses.  They carry out a variety of activities like general commerce, services and food sales, among other activities.

We met Ana, 37, here.  She’s a single mother of three daughters who are 17, 12 and 8 years old; the youngest goes to elementary school and the two oldest go to secondary school.

To earn a living she’s been working for several years in an inn in the city.  She does cleaning and other tasks there.  But to earn a little extra money she also sells all types of clothes door to door in her free time.  She has many customers that buy her merchandise and her oldest daughter also helps her out selling clothes to her classmates.  She sells on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She’s been in this business two years and does quite well.  

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  It’s her first loan in the communal bank and she hopes to continue for a long time.  Her dream is that her daughters finish their schooling and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Namboami Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namboami Group in Western Kenya! Musa is the facilitator of the Namboami group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Musa takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Musa had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Musa was only able to harvest four bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Musa and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Musa will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Namboami group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers, compost and remedies against insects.

loans.name: Temuujin

texts.en:
Temuujin, 31, makes and sells popcorn in his own small shop, which is called “Temuujin.” He has been running this business for the past four years and has gained a good deal of experience.  Temuujin lives with his two children and his wife in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Temuujin has permanent customers and they all feel happy about “Temuujin” popcorn.

Temuujin is requesting a loan to purchase new equipment for his popcorn shop. He needs to renovate his equipment in order to improve and expand, which will be very beneficial and important for the good future of his business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment to make popcorn

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama is a 55-year-old mother with 4 children.

Malama owns and operates a business venture,selling pancakes in her village.  She has two years of experience in this business. Malama needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase goods such as , flour,sugar , vegetable oil and pots.She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 35 Talas or US $15 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2010, Malama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Malama's second loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as , flour,sugar , vegetable oil and pots.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 33 years old, married and a father to two children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his second loan which he has planned to use to purchase farm inputs, i.e., fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education. He an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Kimyas

texts.en: Kimyas, 30, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Kimyas sells clothes, and her husband is a blacksmith. Kimyas is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more clothes to resell. In the future, Kimyas would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Brizonia Maria

texts.es:
Brizonia María tiene 26 años vive en unión libre tiene tre shijos, vive con la pareja y con los hijos de 5-3 y 1 años de edad en el Recinto Caimito Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Brizonia María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra semillas, insumos, fertilizantes  para la siembra del maíz,   El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño  es poder comprar un terreno y así  tener estabilidad económica   para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  pasar  con toda mi familia.
texts.en:
Brizonia María is 26 years old and has a partner and three children.  She lives with her partner and her children, who are five, three, and one year old, in the Caimito Precinct of the canton of Ventanas.

The La Verdad Nos Hara Libres Communal Bank is in the Caimito Precinct, which is in the canton of Ventanas.  This communal bank deals with short-cycle farming of the crops of corn and rice.

Brizonia María grows corn and rice for a living.  She does her buying and selling in Ventanas.

She requested this loan to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers to plant corn.  The loan helped her increase her income for her family's consumption.  Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land to give her family economic stability.

She likes to spend her free time with her entire family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers to plant corn

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 26 years old and earns a living by running a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has three children.
Lourdes has run her business for a year now. She sells items such as canned goods, detergent soap and noodles. She also sells baby's diapers and vitamins. Lourdes works hard to support her family.
Lourdes has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap and shampoo. She hopes to have a progressive business and successful children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El comité Santo Domingo  se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de San Pedro, ellas están en el primer ciclo, y quieren Salir adelante por medio del trabajo de todas ellas.
Ilse es lavandera y comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo, ya que  la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre le acercan mucho trabajo y de esa forma se gana la vida honradamente. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y algún día poder tener una gran lavandería y también poder dar trabajo a otros.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lavandinas, jabones, aromatizantes, suavizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee named “Santo Domingo” was formed by several neighbors from a community in the city of San Pedro.  They are participating in their first loan cycle.  All of them want to excel in their work.  

Ilse provides laundry services and says that she always has plenty of work.  Most of her neighbors always bring her work, so she is able to earn an honest living.  Her goal is to continue working and to someday have a large laundry establishment where she can provide jobs to others.  

Ilse is requesting a loan in order to buy cleaning agents, soaps, fragrances, softeners, and other supplies so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy cleaning agents, soaps, fragrances, softeners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of millet, maize, sorghum. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of millet, maize, sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timbers and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is a rice farmer in the small town of Salitre. He has been a farmer in Salitre his whole life. He and his wife, Luisa, are raising their 1 year old baby. Rodolfo hopes to invest his money in his land in order to improve his home. He is eager to make these improvements using concrete instead of wood which is vulnerable to heavy rains. On his farm, Rodolfo also has livestock, but he concentrates mostly on producing rice.

Rodolfo is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural area in the Province of Guayas which is known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants.
