The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to rice farming and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year during the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous area despite its rural location. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in the fact that many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention force.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worst when El Niño occurs, rice farmers lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Prepare his lands for rice farming

loans.name: Zehra

texts.en: Zehra is a local of the town of Beylagan. She sells fruit at the local market. This is the way she earns a living for her family of her and four children. She buys fruit from wholesalers and sells it at her place. Her place is on the fringes of the market and she wants to build a small booth. She is an active client of the Normicro Beylagan Branch. She has borrowed three loans of $400, $500 and 600$. Now she needs $900 to build a decent shop or booth.

loans.use: to build a small booth

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: DO NOT POST

loans.use: Surtir su negocio y mejorar la presentacion de sus productos

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
I am a mother of six, four boys and two girls. All of my children are in school. I’m a housewife and my husband works in a hotel as a part-time driver. He also owns a pickup and uses it for taking some boys and girls to school in the morning and in the afternoon.

We have yet to have a steady income because with each passing day, our daily expenses are increasing. Therefore, my husband and I have decided to go to Peshawar (a city known for its cheap products) and buy blankets and other seasonal cloth from there. He will sell these to shopkeepers in Lahore’s local market and he thinks that our new business will be successful. I need a loan to start our business.

With this increased income, we will be able to educate our children and this will ultimately help us to increase our living standard.

Abida B., Lahore.

loans.use: Start a cloth-selling business

loans.name: Xi

texts.en: The father works as a day laborer while his wife sells bananas at the small market. Their two children, 7 and 10 years old, are in school (3rd and 5th class). One of them gets our project scholarship. Their average income is $12.50 per month/ person. They want to borrow $75 to raise chickens to get more income so that their children can continue school.  They will pay it back within 4 months.

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Adria Iris

texts.es:
Adria Iris, 45 years old, with little education and 4 children who depend on her, is a very optimistic and dynamic lady. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. Her parents taught her to make bread as a very small girl and, before she married, she used to make a living selling bread. Then she realized that her neighbors needed other things that they couldn't get so she decided to open a small general store with an initial loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$101), borrowed through the Mujeres Trabajadores ("Working Women") community bank. Adria now also sells food; that's to say, she provides meals to teachers that work in the area.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.900 (900 Peruvian soles or about US$302), to be repaid in 4 months, Adria will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, pasta, etc. to stock her store. The rest of the loan will be used to buy basic supplies for the prepared meals that she sells.

Adria dreams of leaving something for her still-young children, a house for each one, perhaps, and also of seeing them start professional careers, something that will be up to one of them to do to be able to help the rest.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Adria Iris a sus 45 años de edad, con grado de instrucción 3º grado de primaria y con 4 hijos que dependen de ella, es una señora muy optimista y dinámica, vive en el barrio Milán en el Distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco. Departamento de La Libertad. Desde muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres el negocio de la preparación de pan, posteriormente, antes que se case se dedicó a la venta del mismo. Luego se dio cuenta que sus vecinos tenían otras necesidades no satisfechas, es así que, gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $101) que obtuvo en su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, abrió una pequeña bodega. Actualmente la señora Adria también vende comida, es decir, da pensión a todos los profesores que trabajan en la zona.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 900.00 soles (aproximadamente $302), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, etc., con esto podrá surtir su bodega. Otra parte será utilizada en la copra de insumos para la preparación de los alimentos que vende a sus pensionistas.

Ella sueña con dejarles algo a sus niños que están aun pequeños, quizás una casa a cada uno y también sueña con verlos profesionales aunque sea a uno de ellos para que pueda ayudar al resto.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Edith Kato's Group

texts.en:
Edith K. is requesting a loan in order to buy more stock of charcoal and thereby boost her business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda
BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.
The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.
 In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her business volume

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Mrs. Ek S., 39, is a mother of seven children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell pork and chicken at a busy market, earning collectively between $8 to $10/day in revenue. One of her children works grinding rice crops and typically earns $50 each month and the rest of are students. Mrs. Ek S. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business and to renovate her house to protect it from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and renovate her house to protect against flooding

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia earns a living selling perfumes and beauty products in offices, homes and businesses in the area of Villa Fátima of the city of La Paz. Her husband is a salaried public transportation driver. Their home is located in the area of Las Delicias, Ladera Norte of the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that she requests a loan. Thanks to her record, she is classified as a "cliente 1" which means that she follows the terms of the loan and pays it accordingly.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics and an assortment of beauty products). Her work experience as a merchant and her credit record qualify her to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Delia trabaja como promotora de perfumes, se dedica a ofrecer sus productos en las oficinas, domicilios y negocios particulares por la zona de Villa Fátima de la Ciudad de La Paz, su esposo es chofer asalariado del transporte público.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Las Delicias Ladera Norte de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (Perfumes, cosméticos, y todo tipo de productos de belleza). Su trabajo y su historial crediticio le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como comerciante.

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Qojali

texts.en: Qojali A. is a 56-year-old farmer who breeds calves for meat production and sells them to the local bazaar traders. He is married and has five children. He started his business in 1997. Now he would like to improve the conditions of his family by developing his business and purchasing more calves. He applied for $1200 USD to purchase three calves for about $400 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Inès

texts.fr:
Born September 10, 1977 in Cotonou, Inès Y. is single and lives with her parents. She sells hair extensions, cosmetics, prepaid telephone cards for various GSM cellular phone networks in Benin and other products near her home in Awassa, a working-class neighborhood in Cotonou. Selling telephone cards and other products is becoming increasingly expensive, and she does not have the financial means to purchase these items. She is thus requesting this loan to meet her customers’ demand and expand her business to selling other types of goods.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 septembre 1977 à COTONOU, Y. Inès est une femme célibataire vivant avec ses parents. Elle exerce la vente des mèches, des produits de beauté, des cartes de recharge des différents réseaux de téléphonie mobile de type GSM implantés au BENIN et autres à AWASSA un quartier populaire de COTONOU près de son domicile. La vente des cartes de recharges et autres devenant de plus en plus excessive et ne disposant pas de moyens financiers pour l’achat desdits produits, elle sollicite alors ce prêt afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle et élargir son secteur d’activité vers d’autres types de produits.

loans.use: Purchase of one bale of hair extensions and various cosmetic products

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 42, joined TYM fund in 2002. She has 3 children, 2 are attending higher education. Like many other women in the region, she uses her loans to invest in raising livestock. At first she raised pigs. The money was decent but it was difficult to make the weekly payment because there was no cash flow. So she switched to raising ducks and fish farming. She has successes, her income has increased to 1200 USD a year. Today she has a paddle of 400 egg laying ducks. She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy more ducks to breed and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 42 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị đang học phổ thông và cao đẳng. Cũng như nhiều người dân trong vùng chị Hiền sử dụng đồng vốn chủ yếu vào dự án chăn nuôi. Ban đầu chị đầu tư nuôi lợn. Thu nhập cũng khá nhưng vì không có nghề phụ nên việc hoàn trả tuần hơi khó khăn. Sang vòng vốn sau chị chuyển sang nuôi vịt đẻ và thả cá. Công việc thuận lợi, một năm bình quân chị thu khoảng 1200USD. Hiện tại chị Hiền đang có một đàn vịt đẻ 400 con. Chị vừa đề nghị xin vay 1000USD để mua thêm vịt giống và thức ăn tổng hợp.

loans.use: Buy ducks

loans.name: Umedahon

texts.ru:
Umedahon K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, is single and has a high school education. Umedahon lives with her elderly parents and this is why she needs to support her family. Umedahon has a sales location at a local market in Tursun-zoda. She sells children’s clothing and has been in this business for 8 years. Umedahon would like to increase her product assortment and needs money to do this. She has decided to take out a loan for a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодирова Умедахон жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 26 лет , незамужем .Образование среднее. Умедахон живет с престарелыми родителями.Поэтому содержать свою семью приходится ей самой. Клиентка имеет торговую точку на местном рынке города Турсунзаде.Она торгует детской одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом более 8 лет. Сейчас Умедахон хочет пополнить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Для чего ей необходимы деньги .Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 32-years-old and a mother of three children. The children are currently in school. Selling used clothing is a very big market in Ghana because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Ophelia.

Ophelia wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade. She is member of the group called “Ebe ba mu” (It has shall come to pass). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira belongs to the Esmeralda ("Emerald") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin. She operates a food-selling business from a stand that she rents in the town of Tarapoto. Her customers are local workers who come to the town for various reasons each day. She started the business after a friend encouraged her to do so. She used to work as a street vendor, selling "anticuchos" (a kebab-like food made with meat and potatoes) and other regional dishes, something that was especially hard work because of all the things she had to haul back and forth every day. Because of the efforts that she's put in, the quality and variety of her food and the good service that she provides, the business is going very well and she has a good customer base who can be sure that she will treat them well.

With this loan of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the ingredients that she needs to make her food: sugar, sacks of rice, cooking oil, pasta, and the other things that she buys daily such as chicken, beef, pork, fish, vegetables, platanos and eggs. She will also buy supplies such as plates, cups, glasses, jars, etc. because she wants to provide good service and a nice presentation for her customers.

Yadira, 52, lives with her son. She works every day. Her goal is to set up a large restaurant because she loves to cook and she expects to meet her goal in the very near future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yadira pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Bda. de Shilcayo, su casa esta ubicada en el Jr: 1º de Abril No 324 en el mismo distrito, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que ella alquila a la municipalidad de Tarapoto, sus clientes son los trabajadores de este lugar y personas que diariamente acuden a la municipalidad por diversas razones. Se inicia en el negocio por la iniciativa de una amiga que le invitó a vender en este lugar, ella antes vendía anticuchos y comida regional en la calle, y tenia que estar trasladando sus cosas todos los días y era muy sacrificado, con las ganas que le pone, la calidad y variedad de sus comidas y su buena atención, le va muy bien, tiene buenos clientes a quienes atiende con un trato amable y carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito de S/.1500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos, y demás insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, verduras, plátanos, huevos, etc. También implementará en vajilla como platos de diversos tamaños (extendidos, soperas), tazas, vasos, jarritas, quiere dar una buena atención y presentación de sus platos a sus clientes.

La señora Yadira tiene 52 años, vive con su hijo, ella trabaja diariamente, su meta es poner un restaurante grande por que a ella le encanta cocinar, espera realizarlo muy rápido.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Y., 24, sells fruit in the market, while her husband, Mr. Reab Samat, is a blacksmith as well as a musician for a radio station and a French school in Orchar Commune Battambang Province. Phan has two young children at home. Phan buys fruit from farmers and sells it in the town market, earning US $2.00 per day. Phan and her husband discussed how to expand his business. Phan decided to request a loan of US $800 to build a blacksmith shop and to buy charcoal to use for it. This will increase her family's income because her husband's work is the main source of income in the family.

loans.use: To build a blacksmith shop and to buy charcoal to use in it

loans.name: Meang

texts.en: Meang S., 38, lives about 124 miles from the capital city of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Living in the Kampong Cham, she typically makes $7 USD each day selling bananas. Her husband is a horse-cart driver and makes $8 USD in revenues. This couple has five children, three of whom are students and the other two are garment factory workers. Mrs. Meang would like to take out a loan of US$800 to rent the banana farm to bear the fruits. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To rent the banana farm

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en:
Tari Mai M. lives in Thecho, lalitpur. She has one son who attends in primary school. Both Mrs M. and her husband are make religious statues. They have almost 10 years of experience in this work. They make various types of religious statues according to the order of their customers. They also get orders from statue dealers. 
The statue making business is a profitable businesses if one has capital but due to lack of money, they cannot invest funds in their business. So Mrs. M. requests a $400 loan to invest in their business. With these amount they are going to buy raw materials like bronze plates, wax etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz H. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He supports his family by raising cattle, which he sells to a butcher shop in the local market after fattening them to the desired size over the course of six or eight months.

Eyvaz recently realized that his business has the potential for significant growth, so he has decided to purchase four more calves. In order to achieve this goal, which will allow him to earn more profit and better support his family, Eyvaz is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 33 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại  công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Liên là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng trọt với thu nhập  5.000.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị  còn có thêm  nguồn thu từ lương làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị Liên mong muốn được vay thêm 20.000.000 đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua thêm lợn về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 33 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2000. Currently, the businesses that bring the main sources of income for Mrs. L.'s family are raising pigs and farming, with a monthly income of VND5,000,000. In addition, her family also has income from the wage for temporary work from her husband, so the economic situation of her family is getting increasingly stable.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND20,000,000. She will use one part of the loan to buy more pigs to raise, and she will use the remaining part of the loan to renovate the pig barns.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more pigs and renovate barns

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Тохиров Садулло житель города Душанбе.Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Возраст 53 год. Работает водителем в строительной организации.Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы провести свадьбу своей дочери. Погашать кредит будет из своей заработной платы в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadullo T. is 53 years old. He lives in Dushanbe. He is married and has six children. Sadullo works as a driver for a construction company. He is applying for a loan that would allow him to cover the cost of his daughter's wedding. He plans to pay off the loan from his salary within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the cost of his daughter's wedding

loans.name: Linaria

texts.es: Linaria a sus 55 años, está casada con su esposo Ricardo D. 58 años y tiene 2 hijos, Joel D. 20 y Jordan D. 14 años, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante y darle una buena vida a su familia. Linaria tiene una tienda D. ropa en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado Importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), la cual es muy concurrida, ya que tiene las prendas más novedosas del mercado y sus precios son muy cómodos. A Linaria le gusta mucho su negocio, puesto que se divierte combinado ropa y vistiendo a los maniquíes, los cuales siempre lucen muy bien vestidos, piensa hacer crecer su tienda, incrementando la cantidad D. mercadería que venD., aunque sabe que eso le costará un mayor esfuerzo a la hora D. conseguir y transportar la ropa, ella tiene 26 años D. experiencia y siente que ya es hora D. crecer y mejorar su vida. Es el quinto préstamo D. Linaria con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que siente que tiene que dar el ejemplo en su banco comunal, del cual es una D. las fundadoras. Con el dinero solicitado planea incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio, para lo cual comprará más ropa para vender.
texts.en:
Linaria is 55 years old. She is married to Ricardo, aged 58, and they have two sons: Joel, 20, and Jordan, 14. She lives in the home which her parents left her and she wants very much to improve her situation and give her family a good life. Linaria owns a clothing store in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her store is always bustling as she has the latest clothing, ahead of all others in the market, and her prices are good. Linaria enjoys her work very much, as she enjoys combining the clothing and dressing the mannequins, which always look very well dressed. She wants to increase her store, increase the amount of merchandise she sells although she knows this will require a great effort on her part both to source the clothing and to transport it. She has 26 years of experience and feels that now is the right time to expand and improve her life. This is Linaria's fifth loan with MFP; she has always been very responsible in her repayments as she feels she must be a good example to others in her community bank, of which she is one of the founding members. She will use this loan to increase the merchandise of her store by buying more clothing to retail.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing to retail

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida A. is a scrap buyer. She goes out to the nearby village and buys used bottles, papers, plastics, metals, iron roofs, and other scrap materials. She sells all of them to a main buyer, and she earns enough money for her family's needs. She is 53 years old and has 7 children. She started her business in 1998 using her small savings of Php 2,000. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more scrap materials to sell. She believes that her loan will bring her better profit because the more scrap materials she buys, the more income she gets.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own businesses. They not only provide credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well to help their clients' businesses to grow.

loans.use: To buy more scrap materials to re-sell

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Señor David E. tiene 45 años de edad y está casado con la señora Digna Roman 43 años. Ambos son padres de tres hijos, 2 varones y una mujer.

El cliente por mucho tiempo fue empleado de un aserradero. Luego decidió iniciar su propia microempresa y ayudado con un pequeño ahorro compró muebles de carpinterias de la zona para volver a venderlos a mueblerias más grandes de otras ciudades.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de muebles en oferta ya que tiene muchos pedidos, y tiene proyectado para más adelante la compra de un camión para transportar sus productos en mayor cantidad.

Desea un pais con mayor oportunidad para sus hijos y más fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. David E. is 45 years old and married to Digna Roman, who is 43. They have three children together, 2 boys and one girl. For a long time, the client was an employee at a sawmill. Later, he decided to start his own micro-enterprise. Aided by a small amount of savings, he bought wood furniture from the area to sell at the larger furniture stores located in other cities. The loan would be invested into the purchase of furniture that is on sale, given he has many orders. His plans for the future include buying a truck in order to transport his goods in larger quantities. He hopes for a country with better opportunities for his children, and for more sources of work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture.

loans.name: Ehena

texts.en: Mrs. Ehena H. is 42 years old and is married with six children. She is very industrious and a good client of HSPFI, who has been assisting her from the start of her business until now. Ehena ventures into different kinds of businesses. Aside from her grocery store, she also has a food vending stall, where she sells different types of viand and grilled chicken parts. With her savings from HSPFI, she is able to handle the demands of her customers, both at the store and at the food vending stall, with help from her husband. Ehena believes that she could maximize her income if she could get additional capital for her businesses. Hence she requests a loan of PHP 11,000. She extends her thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more stocks to retail

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Naa

texts.en:
Naa Y., 39, has been a widow for four years. She has two children, one son and a daughter. According to her, the girl is in senior high school while the boy is in primary school. Naa lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works very hard to provide for the children. Naa is a caterer and takes orders from customers and also cooks to sell as well. She bakes bread and other pastries and supplies to retailers. Naa procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. Naa has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. Naa is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of flour.

loans.name: Mohammad Dahood

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is M. Dahood the son of M. H.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with five children.

He works in the Afghan army and the salary he takes monthly is not enough for both household expenses and house repairs. So he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase the required materials to repair his house.

He would like to thank both AFS and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair his house

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 68 years old. Consolacion is married and has seven adult children. Consolacion operates a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., to the local community. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Consolacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Consolacion from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to supplement the family's needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Masitula's Group

texts.en:
Masitula N. is 45 years old. She has been a market vendor in Owino market for 24 years and sells tomatoes, onions, and green pepper. She is happy that the good care she gives to her customers has kept them with her all this while plus attracting more. She hopes to have all her children have an educated life so that they can be better off than her in future. She is a mother of eight children, aged between 21 and 10 years old.

She is the leader of the Kisakye group in Rubaga. She hopes to expand her business with loans. She wants to buy more tomatoes, onions, and green pepper once given the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, and green pepper for her business.

loans.name: Agua Clara Group

texts.es:
Foto: De izquierda a derecha : Juana L. A., Ivania del Carmen Ñamendy González, Leida María Velásquez V. y Lisbeth del Socorro Martínez F..

Doña Juana L. A.  Doña Florentina vende tortillas que ella misma elabora y destaza cerdo los fines de semana, elabora comidas con la carne del cerdo como: nacatamales, fritos y chicharrones.El crédito lo utiliza en comprar maíz, cerdos en pie, hojas para el empaque de nacatamamles. Ella es conocida en su barrio por la actividad que realiza.
Es madre de tres hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio, desde muy pequeños han aprendido de su madre, van a la escuela de la comunidad.Doña Juana sueña con mejorar el lugar donde trabaja y que sus hijos estudien la secundaria.

Doña Ivana del Carmen Ñamendy es una joven madre de un niño pequeño, es una mujer trabajadora, tiene una pulpería pequeña en su casa y atiende los quehaceres del hogar. Con más de dos años de experiencia en este negocio ella sueña con verlo crecer más y tener algún día una miscelanea. Expresa que cuando su hijo crezca ella pueda ofrecerle un mejor nivel de vida que el que ella tiene ahora. El crédito lo utiliza para comprar granos, leches, detergente, pan, etc.

Doña  Leida María Velásquez V.  es la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ella va a invertir su financiamiento en comprar perecederos como frutas, carnes, granos, etc.  Está pensando en ofrecer frutas y verduras en su casa. Es madre de un niño en edad escolar.
Ella es casada, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, pero ella le gusta tener su negocio para tener su propio ingreso y así comprarse ropa que a ella le gusta y comprarle a su hijo. 


Doña Lisbeth del Socorro Martínez tiene un pequeño taller de elaboración de sandalias de mujer, ella tiene tres trabajadores, dirige el taller y hace las labores de la casa. Es madre de tres hijos que le ayudan en el taller, son adolescentes y están aprendiendo el oficio, además estudian en la escuela cerca de su vivienda. Su esposo trabaja como comerciante independiente y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Sueña con tener un taller más completo, con el financiamiento compró materiales como pega, cuero, suelas, etc.

El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
In photo, from left to right: Juana L. A., Ivania del Carmen Ñamendy González, Leida María Velásquez V., and Lisbeth del Socorro Martínez F.. Doña Juana L. A. makes and sells tortillas and butchers hogs on the weekend. She prepares meals made with pork such as nacatamales (steamed corncakes), fritos (fried pork), and chicharrones (pork rinds). She will use the loan to buy corn, live pigs, and leaves for wrapping the nacatamamles. She is well-known in her neighborhood for her work. She is the mother of three children who help her with her business. They've learned from their mother from a very young age and attend the community school. Doña Juana dreams of improving the space where she works and of sending her children to high school. Doña Ivana del Carmen Ñamendy is the young mother of a small boy. She is a hardworking woman who has a grocery store in her home and tends to her household tasks. She's been in the business more than two years and dreams of watching it grow more, and of one day having a general store. She says that when her son grows up she will be able to offer him a better life than the one she has now. She will use the loan to buy grains, milk, detergent, bread, etc. Doña Leida María Velásquez V. is the coordinator of the group. She has been selling food for three years. She will invest her loan in buying perishables such as fruits, meats, grains, etc. She is considering selling fruits and vegetables from her house. She has a school-age son. She is married. Her huband helps her with household expenses, but she likes having a business so she can have her own income and buy herself clothing she likes, and buy things for her son. Doña Lisbeth del Socorro Martínez has a small workshop where she makes women's sandals. She has three employees, and manages the workshop and takes care of her home. Her three children help her in the workshop. they are adolescents and are learning the trade, as well as studying in a nearby school. Her husband works as an independent salesman and helps her with household expenses. She dreams of having a more complete workshop. She has used the loan to buy supplies like glue, leather, soles, etc. The groups expects to make their payments on time. The loan will give them great satisfaction and the opportunity to work.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cobbling supplies, and grains and perishables

loans.name: Diana Kelly

texts.es:
La señora DIANA KELLY A. C. vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to secundaria , tiene 1 hijo de 2 años quien depende económicamente de ella.
DIANA se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa y también algunos fines de semana vende en el mercado mayorista.
Con su primer crédito de 300 compró frutas y verduras al por mayor y las vendió en su casa y en el mercado mayorista.
El crédito de 500 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios, más frutas y verduras y también en productos alimenticios como arroz, tallarines, papas, utensilios de utensilios y mesas para poder vender platos típicos de la zona elaborados por ella como: tallarín con papa y en las noches salchipapa y salchipollo.
 DIANA, sueña con tener una tienda de productos alimenticios en su casa.
texts.en:
Diana Kelly A. C. lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mar and Cielo II Community Bank. This entrepreneur attended high school up to the fifth year. She has a two year old child who is economically dependent upon her. Diana sells fruit and vegetables in her home. Also, on some week ends she sells in the wholesale market. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bough fruit and vegetables wholesale and sold them in her house and at the wholesale market. The loan for 500 will be used to buy food products, more fruit, and vegetables. She will also buy food products like rice, noodles, potatoes, utensils, and tables to be able to sell dishes that are typical to her region such as noodles with potato. In the evenings she will sell meat and potatoes (salchipapa) and chicken and potatoes (salchipollo). Diana dreams of having a food store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products:  fruit and vegetables, also rice, potatoes, noodles, utensils, and tables

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry Cabrilllos is a CEVI client who has invested in planting rice to raise his family. He has received five loans with CEVI and wishes to take other loans to help support his rice farm, which he inherited from his parents.

He would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy rice seeds and herbicides and to pay the labor fees of other farmers who helped prepare the land. 

He said he likes the services of CEVI. He likes the interest rate because it is very low so that all borrowers can afford it.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Peanut butter making and vending is the business chosen by Cristina.  She lives in Calao East, Santiago City with her children.  She is 43 years old and married to Ronald.  The couple wanted to double their income from their peanut butter business thus they aim to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital.

Cristina hopes to give her family a prosperous living thus she is really doing her best to become productive in her manufacturing business. She hopes to give her children a better future by managing well her business and through her patient and hard working. She also hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her with financial request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita B. is the tailor in the village of Bhakepati. She opened her tailoring shop six years ago. Before starting her own business, she did six months of tailoring for a tailoring business. She makes school uniforms for boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta salwar, blouses, ladies’ long dresses, makshi, and other such clothes. Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of 25,000 rupees to buy materials like cotton cloth for her tailoring work.

Mrs. B. lives with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Her sons are studying in grades 5 and 9 and her daughters are studying in grades 2 and 7.

loans.use: To buy materials like cotton cloth

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus R. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He is married and has one son. Elbrus has a good reputation. He is a very good family man, so he loves his family and wants a good future for them. Elbrus began a small grocery store four years ago with his savings. He was assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Elbrus is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 48-year-old trader. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.  For lack of adequate working capital, Grace buys only a few stocks of lace materials at a time, and sells them through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the desired level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her child with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of lace materials and textile

loans.name: Enea R.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 years old Enea M. from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 4 and 14. Enea has been running a clothing business since 2002. Her business is to buy clothes at wholesale and resell them at retail. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Enea currently earns about $380 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of her business. Enea thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana S. is 34 years old and she lives in Kapan with her school-aged son. Liana is an economist and before that she worked as a shop assistant for some years.

Three months ago Liana organized a mixed-product trade in a rented place and she has approximately 85,000 AMD in income from her business. Liana’s shop, where she sells food, household goods and clothes, is open on weekdays.

Liana seeks a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a New Year’s assortment for her shop: candy, juice, citruses and sausages.

loans.use: To buy a New Year’s assortment for her shop

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy T. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 36 years old. Juvy is married and has 4 young children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish, shrimp and crabs in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and for daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn B., 30, is a farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Her parents taught her everything she knows about planting rice and maintaining a good and quality harvest. Her farm is earning very well, but she admitted that she still needs additional capital to grow her business more. She joined the loan program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She likes the program very much, that is why she is still a member of the CEVI cluster association. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs and supplies. In this way, she believes she will be able to obtain a greater harvest and income for her family.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to five children, who are all currently in school. Elizabeth lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

She is a trader of tomatoes. Elizabeth procures the tomatoes from nearby farming communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She sometimes treks to other towns to sell. Elizabeth has been in business for 15 years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying and selling seafood products and local cereals

loans.name: Juan Grabiel

texts.es:
El sr. Juan R. Q. de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos también tienen una nieta la cual ellos cuidan diariamente ellos viven en el Caserio de Pinillas - Ocucaje.
El sr. Trabaja desde hace 10 años en el transporte anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa actualmente trabaja en un carro alquilado siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una muy responsable.
El sr. Trabaja diariamente desde las 6.30am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años
El goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que es una persona bien trabajadora.
El desea el financiamiento para poder poner en regla sus documentos como lo es su brevete y otros documentos que le son necesario para su trabajo diario.
El sueño de los sres es poder lograr que el ultimo de sus hijos sea profesional por eso estan constantemente trabajando.
texts.en:
Juan R. Q. is 39, and he lives in his own house with his wife and their children. He also has a granddaughter that they take care of everyday. They live in the village of Pinillas – Ocucaje. He has been working in transportation for ten years. He previously worked for a business. He currently works in a rented car. He has always been characterized as being very responsible. He works every day from 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 pm for a collective, and he has been driving along the route between Ica and Ocucaje for the past five years. He enjoys good references from his neighbors who say that he is a very hard-worker. He wants the loan to be able to put his documents, like his driver’s license and other documents that are necessary for his daily work, in order. His dream is to be able to have the last of his children become a professional. That is why he is constantly working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fixed assets

loans.name: Maria Gertrudiz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza arquitectónica de su Centro Histórico, la belleza natural del  Parque Nacional Cajas, los cuatro ríos que bañan la urbe cuencana, su gente y su cultura son su carta de presentaión y se ha convertido en uno de los lugares mas visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

La señora  María Pérez es socia  activa del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas  que son un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a salir adelante con su familia a  base de trabajo en equipo y sobre todo cultivando  el sentimiento de amistad que hay entre todas.

María trabaja como consultora de belelza de los productos YANBAL, lleva ya 15 años trabajando en esta actividad y nos comenta que por el momento las ventas están bajas y casi ya no tiene ganancia, pero gracias a su clientela fiel espera que todo mejore, además nos manifiesta que es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal pues ya  lleva 12 años y fue la señora María Ortega quien la incentivó para formar parte de este hermoso grupo y acceder a los créditos que otorga la Fundación, desde entonces los prestamos solicitados ha invertido en su negocio para incrementar poco a poco mercaderia para su exigente clientela.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 69 años y vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca con su esposo taxista de profesión, su último hijo de tres que tubo, los dos primeros ya son cadados y viven independientes y una nieta de 18 años ya que sus padres se encuentran en el exterior  y envian dinero para su educación y manutención,  la casa en la que habitan es el fruto del esfuerzo conyugal de su juventud.

Con el nuevo crédito solicitado comprará labiales, perfumes,cremas, tratamientos, bisuteria, etc.  Yanbal para abstecer los pedidos de sus clientes. Su gran sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Progresistas communal bank was founded in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for it’s architectural beauty in the Historical Center, the natural beauty of Cajas National Park, the four rivers that bath the capital city Cuenca, it’s people and it’s culture which are it’s best introduction. It has become one of the places most visited by national and foreign tourists. Mrs. María Pérez is an active member of the Mujeres Progresistas communal bank. It’s a group of enterprising women prepared to get ahead for their families through team work and cultivating above all the friendly feeling there is among all. María works as a beauty consultant for YANBAL products. She has already been working in this for 15 years. She mentioned to us that the sales are low at the moment and she has almost no profit. But thanks to her faithful clientele she hopes everything improves. She also told us that she is one of the founding members of the communal bank. She has been in it for 12 years. It was Mrs. María Ortega who encouraged her to become part of this beautiful group and gain access to the loans granted by the Foundation. Since then she has invested the loans she applied for in her business to increase stock little by little for her demanding clientele. She is 69 years old and lives outside the city of Cuenca with her husband who is a taxi driver, the last of three children she has and an 18-year-old granddaughter since her parents are living abroad. They send money for her education and board. The house they live in is the fruit of their efforts in their youth as a married couple. With the new loan she applied for she will buy lip sticks, perfumed creams, treatments, costume jewelry, etc. and Yanbal to fill her customers’ orders. Her big dream is to count on good health in order to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Lip sticks, creams, treatments, perfumes, costume jewelry and more cosmetics from the Yanbal line.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
D. Ali is a very courageous man who is able to handle tough jobs like raising livestock and farming. He's the father of two adult children and with his son (who we see in the photo) is responsible for supporting their family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, Ali has been able to get ahead by buying animals to breed on his property. His main goal now is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ali comes to IMON International for a loan to buy more animals to breed.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding

loans.name: Zamindii

texts.en: Zamindii is 53 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for 30 years. Currently, he operates a carpentry business with his wife in his town. In his business, he manufactures wooden products and his wife, Oyunchimeg, paints them as well as makes other small works for their business. They started their business with working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~ 140 USD). After years of successful operations, he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 2,000,000 tugrugs (~ 1407 USD) today. Zamindii is a very hard-working person who has good communication skills. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand my business and to purchase new equipment for my business.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 705 USD) loan to purchase necessary materials including timber and paints for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Doris Tatiana

texts.es: Doris Tatiana tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 3 hijos, todos están a su cargo. La señora Maria  tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos y otros artículos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años. Porque su mama quería ingresos adicionales que reemplazaran la escasez de trabajo. Al poco tiempo, la pulpería la empezó a administrar Doris y ahora es propiamente de ella, quien la administra y quien invierte para mantenerla. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan. Su sueño es llegar a instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.
texts.en:
Doris Tatiana is 35 years old and a single mother with 3 children, all in her care. She operates a small general store from her home, in which she sells basic grains and other articles. She began this business some 5 years ago because her mother needed additional income to take the place of scarce work. Soon, Doris began to administer the store and, now, it belongs to her. Doris runs it and invests in order to maintain it. Her loan will be invested in buying, principally, basic grains, snacks, natural drinks and bread. Doris' dream is to be able to install a distribution center in the municipality where she lives, since at present there is none.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INVENTORY FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Lwala Ajok Margaret Group

texts.en: A. Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman of 40, widowed with seven children, three of whom are in school. She also has two dependents. She deals in stone quarrying and has been in this business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase firewood for burning rocks and to pay wages. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for burning rocks and to pay wages

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old and married with four children between 1½ and 20 years old. Three of her children are currently attending school.

Alice is a farmer in Kitale town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for one year and has only one employee. Her main product is eggs which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from a kiosk (small shop) which she operates in the same area. Her main challenge is diseases which attack the chickens abruptly and costs a lot of money to treat. The high costs of poultry feeds is also a challenge to her.

Alice has requested this KES 30,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. The extra income generated from this loan will assist her in educating her children. In the next five years, she hopes to have purchased a pick-up which will assist her in supplying eggs to the market.

Alice says "The duration of cheque processing needs to be shortened and products diversified."

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Hipolita se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche  comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
 

Vive en la  comunidad  de Umalso de la Provincia  Omasuyos  del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  cuatro   horas de la ciudad de La Paz, en su casita propia junto a sus dos hijos menores y su esposo, el cual se dedica también al mismo trabajo.


El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Hipolita raises cattle, whose milk she sells at the "PIL Andina" (Andean Industrial Milk Plant). She lives in the community of Umalso, in Omasuyos Province, in the department of La Paz. Her community is located four hours from the city of La Paz. She lives in her own house with her two young children and her husband, who does the same work as her. This loan is intended to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase their milk production and therefore their income. This is Hipolita's first loan with IMPRO. An evaluation was done to qualify her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, in order to increase milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase plates and irons

loans.name: Efiaza

texts.en:
Efiaza U. is currently in the business of selling fruits such as oranges, guavas and pineapples at the market and is requesting a loan to stock pears, avocadoes and jackfruit to sell.  Efiaza is 41 years old and married to a police officer. She has 5 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock pears, avocadoes and jackfruit to sell

loans.name: Raeesa

texts.en:
Raeesa, age 45, lives in Yadgar a district of Lahore, Pakistan. This district is famous for bus stands.  Raeesa owns a small house there which she and her husband built with love and care. Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years ago, a tremendous loss for her. She totally lost herself in the memories of him. Her husband was the only breadwinner of their family but now Raeesa’s three sons have started managing the financial expenses of family. Her elder son sells copper wires which are good conductors of electricity and heat. This has become the family business as his two brothers also help with the business. In this way they generate income for the family. They earn approximately 30,000 Pakistan Rupees each month. 

Raeesa is a housewife. She spends her time in taking care of her children and doing household chores. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her sons. With the loan amount they will buy the copper wires in large quantity and fulfill the orders of their customers. 

Raeesa is a second year member of Asasah.  She successfully repaid her first loan and has shown good credit behavior.

loans.use: To buy copper wire for selling.

loans.name: Shakhin

texts.ru:
Shakhin G. 29 let. On ne jenat i jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Shakhin uje 6 let rabotayet zubnim vrachem. Eqo otec vse vremya xotel chto bi eqo sin stal vrachem i poetomu on s detstva uchil eqo svoyey rabote. 

Shakhin  zakonchiv shkolu i posle postupil v medecinskiy kolledj. Okonchıv Kolledj spustya nekatoreye vremya Shakhin nachal rabotat  zubnim vrachem. Seychas Shakhin nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit novuyu aparaturu dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Shakhin G. is twenty-nine-years-old. He is unmarried and lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He has been a dentist for six years. His father had always wanted his son to become a doctor so he taught him his profession since he was a child. Shakhin started school after he graduated medical school. Once he finished college, after a while he started working as a dentist. Now he needs a loan for 2000 AZN to buy new equipment to advance his business.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Mrs. Thav Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for ten people who live in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. They each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Thav C. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. She is a 38-year-old widow with a child who is ten years old. 

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family; she also works as a farm laborer. Her problE. is that her field is ready to be plowed but she does not have the money to support the business. So, to enable production of the rice crop, Mrs. Thav C. is seeking a loan to rent a plowing machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To rent a plowing machine to plow her field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir nace hace dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es del Barrio San Luis, en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el ciclo anterior ya que dos de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente y con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen. 
Actualmente la presidenta del comite es la señora Benicia, quien se dedica  a la confeccion de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.
Ella tiene su taller de costura en su casa y coonstatemente es visitada por sus clientes quienes le solicitan sus servicion, y ella confecciona las prendas de acuerdo a los modelos que solicitan sus clientes.
Esta actividad para ella es muy importante ya obtiene buen ingreso para su familia, pero nos comentó que es muy sacrificado ya que trabaja mucho por su vista por que actualmente ya debe utilizar anteojos para todas las cosas.
Pero desea seguir trabajando en su profesion para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios para la confecciones ya que  ella ofrece telas de calidad a sus clientes, ademas debe comprar otros como, cierres, botones, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Porvenir” (The Future) committee was born two years ago thanks to the intervention and support of another committee active in the same area. The committee is in the San Luis neighborhood and during these two years of intense work has grown both socially and economically. They are well known in the area for being very hard working women. They went through a very difficult test last cycle because two of the members were unable to meet their weekly payments. Their loan responsibilities were taken over by the group and they committed to raise up the group they belong to successfully once again. The current group President is Benicia who manufactures clothing for women, men and children. She has her workshop in her home and is constantly sought out by customers who need service. She makes items of clothing according to the styles the customers request. This activity is very important for her because she earns good family income. However, she comments that it is very hard work and damaging to her eyesight; she already has to wear eyeglasses for everything. She wants to continue working in her profession, however, to continue to help her family. She is asking for the loan to buy sewing supplies for her items since she offers quality fabrics to her customers. She also has to buy other supplies like zippers, buttons and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a borrower from Hebron, married and a mother of 9 children, her husband is an employee of a very low salary, therefore Fatima wanted to help her husband and start a business to help covering household expenses, she started with the small amount of money she had and a loan from FATEN to buy sheep and raise it in the backyard of her house. 

After the forth loan from FATEN Fatima sensed the changes of family conditions to the better. Fatima came to FATEN and took a $2000 loan to purchase more sheep and increase the returns.

Fatima and her husband are receiving the loan in FATEN’s office in the picture above

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 27 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Andrea vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Norma alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de Norma es la agricultura, ganadería y también se dedica a la venta de lácteos. Norma para trabajar la tierra tiene un pequeño tractor que sirve para ayudar a la siembra de sus productos.   

Norma desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Norma con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para el mantenimiento de su tractor y comprara llantas.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma is 27 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  Currently she works in the Compone community in the district and province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.  The Compone community is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. The majority of its inhabitants farm crops and livestock.  Norma divides her time between her household chores and her business activities.  Norma's main economic activity is crop farming, livestock farming and selling dairy products.  Norma has a small tractor which she has for working the land.  It helps her to sow her products.

Norma has been a member of the “San Isidro de Compone” community bank in Cusco, Peru for a long time.  She hopes to receive this next loan for 2,000 nuevos soles and will use it to have maintenance work done on her tractor and to purchase tires.

Norberta is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: For maintenance work to her tractor and to purchase tires

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 33 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, él vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 6 y 5 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de él.
Este negocio inicio hace 4 años que le surgió la idea de invertir sus ahorros en una tienda que ofreciera a sus vecinos todos los productos necesarios para el hogar; lo atiende de 7:00am a 6:00pm, actualmente necesita invertir en su negocio y solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta básica y que le es demandado a diario por los clientes como azúcar, frijoles, maíz, esto le ayudara a mantener satisfechos a los clientes y al mismo tiempo no perderá de vender al contrario podrá aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño de don Jorge es  poseer  un negocio grande que sea capaz de atender a muchos clientes, ofrecer de toda clase de mercadería y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old and lives in Santa Elena, Department of Usulutan.  He sells basic staples and lives with his wife and two daughters, ages 6 and 5, who are economically dependent on him.

This business started 4 years ago with the idea of investing their savings in a store that would offer their neighbors all the necessary products for their homes.  The store is open from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM.  Jorge now needs to invest in his business and is requesting a loan to buy basic food products as his customers demand sugar, beans, and corn on a daily basis.  Increasing supplies will help keep his customers satisfied and at the same time may increase his income.

Jorge's dream is to own a big business that is able to serve many customers and offer all kinds of goods, to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, oil and corn.

loans.name: Everlove Abena Ewusiewah

texts.en: Everlove Abena Ewusiewah M. is married and has a child. Everlove is a hairdresser in Abura. She also sells cosmetics by moving from one area to another. Her husband is an auto mechanic. She uses her income to assist her husband in educating and feeding the family. Everlove will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Everlove plans to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Olivier Fabrice

texts.fr:
OLIVIER FABRICE B.


Coiffeur homme, âgé de 29ans célibataire 2 enfants en bas âges qui a commencé avec cette activité depuis 2003.

Son but était après le premier prêt de renforcer  son activité en achetant  les accessoires de coiffures tels que : 2 tondeuses électriques, 1 paquet des peignes, des paires de ciseaux, des lames de rasoirs et des produits cosmétiques.

Pour le prochain prêt, il va améliorer son lieu d’activité et veut  ouvrir un autre salon  pour faire générer plus de revenus.

Pour garantir les conditions de vie de sa famille, il veut construire une maison pour eux.
texts.en: Olivier Fabrice B. is 29-years old, unmarried with 2 young children, and a barber who started his business in 2003.  His goal after the first loan was to strengthen his business by buying hair salon accessories such as 2 electric clippers, 1 package of combs, a few pairs of scissors, razor blades and cosmetics.  For the next loan, he is going to improve his place of business and wants to open another hair salon to earn more income.  To ensure the living conditions of his family, he wants to build a house for them.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 electric clippers, razors, and cosmetics.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido al buen trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería para poder ampliar su bodega, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 40 year old mother.  She lives with her children in the Lambayeque district, an area with a lot of commercial activity.  It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her home.  She sells diverse daily consumption products, basic needs products, and groceries to her customers.  The business is very well received due to the good service provided and the quality of the products she sells.  The income she gets from this business activity is to help her husband support her family.

Maria wishes to increase her business.  She will do this by getting more merchandise in order to be able to expand her grocery store, increase sales, and get more income.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This will help her obtain her objective.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to be able to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon, 57, is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He is married and has five adult children. Three of his children are currently attending school. Zablon is a retired primary school teacher and depends on his pension to provide the basic needs for his family.  He has also been in the farming business for over twenty years and employs four farmhands. His farm produces maize, tea, and vegetables, which he sells to the local market. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this investment will help in the education of his children. His primary challenges have been the lack of a steady market for milk and poor weather conditions that affect his production. However, he hopes that he will overcome the challenges and expand his dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven C., 25, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. C. raises ducks and grows rice, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 9 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen Y. is from Gango, Ozamis City. She is 48 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Helen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair a vehicle to enable her to offer a better service. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
