*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle for transportation services

loans.name: Khuth

texts.en: Khuth S. resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells coconuts, earning an income of USD 15 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is employed at the provincial prison, earning an income of USD 3.1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 45 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more coconuts to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lenkoko Ologolimot

texts.en:
Lenkoko is 30 years old, married and a father of three children. He farms on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, and he plans to use it to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand farming.

Lenkoko's dream is provide better lives to his children. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for six years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Benard is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 9 and 2.

He has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a power saw. The extra income he will earn by hiring the power saw to the local market will help in paying school fees for his children. His main challenges in farming have been diseases and lack of enough animal feeds, which affects his production.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw

loans.name: Señor Del Calvario De Calca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR  DEL CALVARIO DE CALCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marco Alejandro; el tiene 60 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, piedras, arena entre otros mas, él socio es profesor cesante y decidió invertir su dinero en este negocio el cual le esta yendo muy bien y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, él socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra  de materiales de construcción para así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, compra y venta de ropa para niños, venta de chicha de jora y una tienda de agroveterianaria.

El socio se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These people belong to the "SEÑOR  DEL CALVARIO DE CALCA” community bank which is located in Calca, in Calca district, in Cusco department.

Marco Alejandro is a member of this group.  He is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling construction supplies such as bricks, cement, stones, sand and other products.  He used to be a teacher and decided to invest his money in this business which is going very well.  He works together with his wife.  He is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get ahead in life for his family's sake.

Marco Alejandro is requesting this loan to buy construction supplies so that he has a greater variety of products to offer his customers.

The other members of this group have businesses which include: running a grocery store, buying and selling children's clothes, selling 'chicha de jora' (a traditional, corn-based drink), and running a store selling agricultural and veterinary products.  Marco Alejandro feels happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies so that he has a greater variety of products to offer his customers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba G. is married and has three children.  She buys fish from the market, smokes them at her house, and sells them near Abura.  She has been doing this for 7 years. Her husband works in construction.  Aba uses her income to supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.use: purchase fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 20 años de edad que vive en su casa propia, cuenta  con los servicios de agua y luz; ubicada en el  zona rural del caserío de Yencala a unos 30 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales y agricultura.

Desde hace varios años José labora en la compra, crianza y venta de animales (aves de corral como pavos, gallinas y patos), su corral lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus aves de corral se venden rápido en los mercados que los ofrece por estar bien alimetadas y criadas con alimentos balanceados,  lo cual le permite a José aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo José a solicitado un préstamo  de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para seguir comprando animales (aves de corral) para criarlos y venderlos al por mayor y menor en los distintos mercados la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, también lo va utilizar para comprar alimentos balanceados para poder darles de comer bien a sus animales y  seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse mas conicido en los distintos mercados que vende por tener un producto sano y de calidad.

José a pesar de ser un padre jóven es muy responsable y conocido por los comerciantes de la zona de los distintos mercados por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y con muchas ganas de  mejorar en la vida y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 20 year old head of household who lives in his own home, which has water and electricity services.  It is located in the rural area of the town of Yencala, about 30 minutes from the department of Lambayeque.  This area is characterized by the work its inhabitants do with agriculture and livestock.  

For a few years, José has worked buying, raising, and selling animals (poultry such as turkeys, chickens, and ducks).  His corral is located in the outside part of his house for more security and comfort.  His poultry sells quickly at the market because they are well-fed and raised with balanced feed, which allows José to increase his income to cover the daily necessities of his household.

José has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to continue purchasing animals (poultry) to raise and sell them at wholesale and retail in the markets in the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  He will also use the money to purchase balanced feed to be able to feed his animals well, and continue increasing his sales and make himself more well-known in the different markets for having quality, healthy products.  

In spite of being a young parent, José is very responsible and is known by the businesses in his area for being an honest, hardworking man who wants to improve his live and get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and animal feed.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika es una mujer de 35 años casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 10 años;   en el barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde habita con su familia, ella es muy conocida por vender víveres, refrescos y dulcería en general, negocio que inició hace 5 años con la venta de obleas, arequipes  en un vitrina que le regaló su tía;  como gradualmente   empezaron a incrementarse los pedidos,  su negocio  se fue ampliando y hoy está un poco más estable pero con muy poco capital de trabajo, su principal mercado son las amas de casa, jóvenes y  niños  y  Erika se propone  incrementar sus ventas; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará  en mayor volumen arroz, aceite, granos enlatados, y ganará descuentos, reducirá los gastos que generan la frecuencia de compra que en la actualidad es de dos días.  Su sueño más adelante es ampliar su negocio diversificando la oferta de productos, para  ella dedicarse a administrarlo teniendo  empleados que generen sus propios ingresos. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital con el que cuenta y con este primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo iniciará su camino dirigido a aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Erika, 35, is a married woman.  She has two children who are 9 and 10 years of age.  She lives in Barranquilla’s San Roque neighborhood with her family.  She is well known for selling foodstuffs, soft drinks and sweets in general.  She started the business five years ago selling “obleas” and “arequipes” (wafers and caramel) in a display case her aunt gave her.  Gradually her orders increases and her business grew.  Today, it’s a bit more stable but with very little working capital.  Her principal market is housewives, adolescents and children.  Erika intends to increase her sales and this is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy large volumes of rice, oil and canned grains to qualify for discounts while also reducing costs associated with frequent purchases which currently are every two days.

Her dream for the future is to enlarge the business diversifying her stock merchandise so that she can run it with employees who will generate their own incomes.

Her greatest challenge is the little capital she can count on and this first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will start her on the road towards an increase in working capital.

loans.use: to buy large volumes of rice, oil and canned grains to qualify for discounts.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged 47, is married to Alice, and the couple are blessed with four children aged 27, 25, 17 and four.  John has been welding for nine years, while Alice is a farmer. His business earns him a monthly income of KES 11,000.

This is John’s fifth loan cycle from KADET LTD; he has managed to pay back his previous loans in good time. With this loan he intends to buy an automatic, modern welding machine.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children, and hopes to buy more welding materials like gate metals, windows, etc. in the future.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening a restaurant business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos (1 independiente).  Estudió  hasta 1ro de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su crédito anterior fue de  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovinos y alpacas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez corderos y tres alpacas, dice que los compra y los engorda por un mes para luego venderlos a mejor precio.
En sus ratos libres se dedica al tejido de chompas, media, bordados y accesorios, esta actividad le genera algunas ganancias.
Trabaja sola en el negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y generar mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la capacitación.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the “Santa Rosa de San José” community bank located in the Mañazo district of both the province and department of Puno. She is 54 years old, is married and has four children (one is independent). She has completed the first year of secondary school education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos [Manuela Ramos Movement] for three loan cycles. Her previous loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles. She invested the loan in her business of buying and selling livestock such as sheep and alpacas.

With this new loan for 1,500.00 nuevos soles she will buy ten lambs and three alpacas. She says that she buys them and fattens them up for a month to later sell them at a better price.

In her free time she knits sweaters, stockings, embroidered pieces and accessories. This activity makes her some extra income. She works alone in the business as her husband works in a mine. 

Her dream is to improve her business and generate more income. She likes the savings and training provided by the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy ten lambs and three alpacas.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly, a 47-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past six years, she has operated a shop that sells snacks, canned goods and beverages.  Having become a member of HSPFI this year, Beverly is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 37-year-old dairy farmer.  She is married and blessed with three children who are in school.  Eunice also own a retail shop which she has been operating for over five years.  Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve her business.

Eunice hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: 11.2 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hiếu works in agriculture where she raises poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Hiếu is 33 years old and married with one child. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11.2 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Hiếu lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Hiếu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiếu has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiếu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hiếu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattler to raise and sell

loans.name: Rodrigo Sebastian

texts.es:
El Joven Rodrigo tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene aun hijos y vive en la ciudad de Villarrica. Cuenta con un Taller de Tapizados, donde fabrica y repara sofás, Asientos para Automóviles y Butacas para Cotillón. Este  taller lo heredó de su padre que aún con su larga edad, sigue apoyando y supervisando los trabajos terminados, para que posteriormente sean comercializados o entregados a los clientes.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, tiene muchas ansias y proyectos, le gusta su oficio y quiere seguir aprendiendo cada día más y más. Agradece a su padre por todo el apoyo que este le da, ya que el es un gran apoyo para Rodrigo. Quiere, algún día poder tener un local grande donde ofrecer todos los muebles que tapiza. Rodrigo sueña formar una familia y con este pequeño negocio poder solventar los gastos y traspasar esta profesión a sus hijos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros y cuerínas que son los elementos esenciales para su trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la gran oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodrigo is 33 years, single, and does not have any children yet. He lives in the city of Villarrica. He has an apholstery shop where he makes and repairs sofas, car seats, and armchairs for Cotillón. He inherited this shop from his father who in spite of his old age continues working on and improving the finished works. They are then sold or returned to the clients. 
He describes himself as hardworking and enterprising. He has a lot of drive and projects. He enjoys his job and wants to learn more and more everyday. He thanks his dad for all the support he gives him since it is a great support for him. One day he would like to have a large enough shop to offer all of the furniture he upholsters. Rodrigo dreams of forming a family and with this small business to pay off costs and pass on this job to his children. 
He is requesting this loan to buy leather and imitation leather which an essential material for his job. He is thankful for the great opportunity this foundation is offering.

loans.use: buy leather and imitation leather for his shop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married. Mary Jane is 37 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Missamis Occidental.

Mary Jane sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP for this business.

Mary Jane has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to invest in more retail and to earn twice the profit of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Renatha is in her mid 30s, married and has two children, one of whom attends school. She has been running a charcoal business for one year.  She works from 7 a.m to 4.30 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Renatha is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to  be able to build her own house.

Renatha will share this loan with her loan group Kinole, which has a total of 18 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар житель района города Турсунзаде. Он женат. Ему 26 лет. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в средней школе. Она преподаватель. Сам Зафар предоставляет услугу. Он развозит людей по маршруту Турсунзаде-Душанбе. В этой области он уже пять лет. Кредит берет для установки газового оборудования и покупки баллонов.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the Tursun-zoda district.  He is 26 years old, married and has four children.  His wife works at a secondary school.  She is a teacher.  Zafar provides a service.  He transports people along the Tursun-zoda - Dushanbe route.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to install gas equipment and purchase gas containers.

loans.use: to install gas equipment and buy gas containers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old. He is married to Caroline, who runs a kiosk in order to add some income to the family. He has four school-going children.

He has been in business for six years, and right now, his monthly income from the business is 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is borrowing a loan of KES 5,000 to purchase more goats for sale. This is his first loan, and his dreams and hopes are to buy a plot of land and construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven D. 24 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos, D. los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad D. vida. El y su esposa trabajan 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora D. L. ciudad que se encuentra a varios kilómetros lo que les lleva más tiempo. Al Joven Andrés es un beneficio por que es L. forma que paga su casa vía nomina, ya que es muy importante tener al corriente ya que será el patrimonio que le dará a sus pequeños. Pero para el, no es suficiente depender del ingreso D. L. maquiladora por tal motivo hace 4 años trabajo con su papa como ayudante D. soldador, para luego instalar su negocio en su propia casa y ser propietario D. esta manera el obtendría mayores ingresos. Aparte el quiere poner un negocio D. abarrotes en su casa en L. que atendería su esposa para que se queD. al cuidado D. sus pequeños. Para esto necesita comprar lácteos, refrescos, botanas, comida D. lata, sopas, jabón y mas.
texts.en: Andrés is a young man who is 24 years old.  He is married and has two children who he would like to offer a better quality of life.  He and his wife work 10 hours a day in a cross-border assembly plant in the town.  It is several kilometers away which adds time to their working day.  It is a benefit to young Andrés because he pays for his home through his wages.  It is very important for him to keep up to date with this as his home constitutes the assets that he will leave to his little ones.  However, for Andrés it is not enough to depend on the income from the assembly plant so, four years ago, he started working with his dad as an assistant welder.  He then set up his business in his own home and would make more income as the owner.  In addition, he would like to set up a grocery store in his home which his wife will work in so that she can also look after their children.  For this reason, he needs to buy dairy products, soft drinks, snacks, canned food, soups, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start a grocery store business

loans.name: Celiflora Inocencia

texts.es:
La señora celiflora cuenta con 45 años de edad, está casada con el señor Inocencio, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Alejandro, marina y Alberto, de los cuales solo 2 estudian, la mayor esta cursando el primer año de secundaria y el menor esta en sexto año de primaria, ya que el mas grande esta casado y tiene su propia familia, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, desde hacen 20 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar en algo a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, también para así gozar de una muy buena economía, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: aceite, sal, azúcar, refrescos, leche, jabón, papel higiénico, etc. Y así contar con un mejor surtido de productos.
Uno de los sueños que tiene doña celiflora es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, y brindar un excelente servicio, para así contar con un  mayor número de clientes, y hacerse de más y mejores ingresos.
Dice que este es el mejor apoyo que habían podido darle, ya que gracias  a esto, ahora goza de una mejor calidad de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Celiflora is 45 years old, and she is married to Inocencio with whom she has 3 children, Alejandro, Marina and Alberto. Two of them are in school, with the older one in his first year of secondary school and the younger in the 6th grade of primary school. Her  eldest child is married and has his own family.

She has had a grocery store for 20 years. She says that she decided to begin this business because she wanted to find a way of helping her husband, and her children with their studies, in order for them to have a better future.

In order to take advantage of the economy she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as: oil, salt, sugar, drinks, milk, soap, toilet paper and other items, so she will have a better supply of products.

One of the dreams that Celiflora has is to grow her business, and to provide an excellent service, and so with a larger number of clients, she would have more and better income.

She says that this is the best help that they could give her, because thanks to this, she now enjoys a better quality of life and a good business.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, sugar, drinks, milk, soap, toilet paper and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Jacinta Kagwiria

texts.en: Jacinta is married and has 3 children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years old. She describes herself as honest and ambitious. Jacinta has operated a farm for 10 years, selling vegetables. Her business is located in a shopping center. Jacinta's biggest business challenge is the increased cost of farm seeds. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy farm seeds. Her business goal is to cultivate the other parts of her land in order to increase her vegetable production within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy farming seeds.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Mauricio a sus 22 años de edad, es un emprendedor quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de fabricación y venta de traperos y escobas en su barrio el Playón ubicado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín. Este oficio el señor Mauricio lo aprendió de su padre quien trabaja en una empresa relacionada con esta actividad. El señor Mauricio requiere de la compra de una maquina ribeteadora y una cortadora y materia prima tal como telas y palos de madera, esto con el fin de poder iniciar su negocio y generar sus propios ingresos para poder estudiar y cumplir su sueño de tener su propia empresa y en ella generar varios empleos directos.
texts.en: Señor Mauricio at the age of 22 years is an entrepreneur who wants to start his own business manufacturing and selling mops and brooms in his neighbourhood called El Playón, located to the north of the city of Medellin. Señor Mauricio learned this trade from his father who works in a company related to this business. Señor Mauricio needs to buy a trimming machine and cutting machine as well as raw materials such as cloth and wooden poles, with a view to starting his own business and generating his own income so that he can study and achieve his dream of having his own company and generating more jobs.

loans.use: to buy a trimming machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Mrs. Hok is a resident of the Baray district. She earns a living by cultivating rice crops, as well as raising piglets in a wooden piggery in her backyard. She has a common law relationship with her husband and is blessed with two single children, one of whom is a student. Through her pig fattening business, Mrs. Hok is able to earn an average of $2.00 per day to support her family. She also depends on income from her husband who transports and sells firewood from place to place. 

In order to increase rice production, Mrs. Hok wants to expand her farmland. However, her capital is insufficient. Thus, she is now requesting funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase two plots of farmland. Her goal is to improve her farming business and make a comfortable living for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two plots of farmland

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old, and she is married to Alfredo, a father who works out of the country. Julie is committed to providing for her children’s needs by running her family store in the village of Rizal in Cauayan city. Julie has been in business for three years.

At present, she is generating an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. She is grateful that her business is doing well, and she wants to expand it. To make this possible, she has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan from Kiva to buy more products such as canned goods, noodles, bakery bread, and other kitchen ingredients to sell at her store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 12 years and also earns an income from a restaurant and e-loading. Concepcion has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items such as soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan.
Concepcion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children. 

Virginia has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms, repairs dresses, makes curtains and pillow cases.  She has had this business for 25 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib1, 2, 3, Sous Groupe 4

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté1, 2, 3, sous groupe 4 est   un regroupement  de 7 membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe  de  7 femmes regroupées dans le meme secteur d’activité de la couture et de  commerce de tissus et  divers autres produits. Elles   sont représentées par madame  Aissatou  qui représente la personne habillée en   vert sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de tissus  et produits divers. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plusieurs années dans son activité. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle à  19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de produits cosmétiques  puisqu’elle a l’intention de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise. Son objectif principal est de  renforcer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Al Ouma Liberté 1, 2, 3, Sous Group 4 is a grouping of seven members who all belong to the same association which is a national solidarity group. This group of seven women are in the same business sector of sewing, fabric, and various other products. Aissatou, the person dressed in green in the photo, represents the women. For more than ten years she has been very involved in the fabric business and of various other products. She capitalizes on her experience of several years in her business and begins her day from 10 in the morning in order to return home by 7 in the evening. She seeks a planned loan to buy fabric and cosmetics since she intends to diversify the products that she sells. Her main objective is to reinforce her commerce activity.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other various products to sell.

loans.name: 5 Faces Group

texts.fr: "5 FACES" est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont issus de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, Amavi Marcelline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Bertin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Amavi Marcelline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Amavi Marcelline assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Amavi Marcelline vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et divers (savons, savons en poudre, etc.) à son domicile. Amavi Marcelline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Amavi Marcelline et les autres membres du groupe "5 FACES" sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et divers (savons).

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells jikos, sufurias, plastic containers and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sufurias, jikos and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sufurias, jikos and other items.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is 28 yrs old and single.This is the only business of its kind in Gaitheri trading centre and its services are in demand by the community. This clinic has been in operation for 5 years and members from the community have trust in her and really appreciate her services.

loans.use: She wants to stock the new malaria drug which is abit expensive but very effective.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida sells fresh tomatoes in her village. She is a good sales pesron and is attracting lots of customers. Vida needs a cpaital of $850 from KIVA to improve her tomato sales business. She has graduated as trainee from the TEACH lending skills programme of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Mr. M. has been a merchant all his life. Today, he has a small grocery store. He lives with his grandson, who helps him with the business. "We share responsibilities. It's a great help to me that he stays with me. I want to improve my business, to buy merchandise and furniture to accomodate it. I am asking for $1,000.00."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise and furniture to accomodate it

texts.en: Mrs. B. is 46 years old and married. Her husband, 50 years old, is a fisherman, and she sells dried fish, a delicacy in Vietnam. They live in a coastal village in Nghe An province, the upper middle of Vietnam. They have 5 children: 2 sons and 3 daughters, between 14 and 25. Having 5 children is financially very hard and that's why she joined TYM. With the TYM loans it's possible for her to buy more materials and fish for her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Señor Jose M. lives in Carapegua. He is married to Señora Ana Caballero, and they have 4 children. Two of them are police officers, one is a math teacher and the youngest is going to college. Señora Ana is a housewife, and Señor Jose is a travelling salesman who sells handcrafts. He has been able to put his children through college doing this job.

Even with these difficult times they went through, Jose has been able to provide for his family. His sales are great, and there is a high demand for the products he sells which are all types of blankets, bedding, clothes such as pants, etc. Aside from his sales, Jose is also a security guard at the local university. He is a security guard during the week, and he's a salesman during the weekend.

His friends and neighbors respect him for his hard work and dedication. Jose wishes to borrow $600 to purchase more merchandise such as blankets, pants and shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José M., vive en Carapeguá, está casado con la señora Ana Caballero y tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son oficiales de policía, una es profesora de matemáticas y la última sigue estudiando en la universidad. Su esposa es ama de casa y el señor José es vendedor ambulante de artesanías; con este trabajo ha logrado hacer estudiar a sus hijos que hoy día ya son profesionales. A pesar de las diferentes dificultades que pasaron durante estos tiempos, José ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Sus ventas son muy buenas, y hay bastante demanda de los productos que ofrece, entre ellos podemos citar frazadas, mantas, cubre camas, pantalones, etc. Además de sus ventas, José, ha conseguido un trabajo como guardia de seguridad en una universidad local, por lo que entre semana trabaja como guardia y sus ventas las realiza los fines de semana. Sus amigos y vecinos lo respetan y admiran mucho por su gran espíritu emprendedor. José desea un crédito de $ 600 para invertirlos en la compra de más mercaderías como frazadas, pantalones y camisas para la venta.

loans.use: To purchase woollen blankets, shirts and pants

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru:
For many years, Rahmon and his wife have been teaching in a secondary school. Unfortunately, schoolteacher’s pay is not enough to sustain a family. Therefore, a few years ago, Rahmon S.’s family started a business. At first, they sold clothing and shoes for women. Gradually expanding the business, Rahmon also opened a wholesale food store. Rahmon’s younger daughters help their father to sell. Rahmon has been a MicroInvest client for 5 years. MicroInvest loans helped Rahmon considerably expand his business. With this loan Rahmon plans to purchase Fall clothing collection.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмон и его жена работают преподавателями в средней школе. Стаж их работы в школе уже много лет. Заработка преподавателя не хватает на семейные расходы и поэтому семья Солиева Рахмона уже несколько лет занимается бизнесом. Начинали бизнес с продажи женской одежды и обуви. Постепенно расширились и открыли еще одну торговую точку по продаже продуктов питания. Реализация продуктов питания идет оптом. Рахмону помогают и его младшие дочери. С Микроинвест он сотрудничает уже 5-ый год. С помощью займов он значительно расширил свой бизнес. Новый займ собирается потратить на осенний ассортимент одежды.

loans.use: To purchase autumn assortment of clothing

loans.name: Augustina Villar

texts.en:
Augustina is an active and hard-working businesswoman. She is 34 years old and has three children, a girl and two boys, ages 14, 12 and 11, respectively, all of whom attend a private school. Her husband works in the town council.

Augustina dedicates herself to the sales of natural medicines. She operates the business in her house, and on the weekends she offers the products door-to-door in the neighborhood. She says that business is very profitable, as she makes a weekly profit of $125.

Augustina hopes she can earn more in order to supply other necessities for her children. She has applied for a loan to buy a larger amount of natural medicines so that she can increase her sales volume. She trusts that if she keeps on working as hard as she is now, before long she will be able to rent a small site where she can sell the medicines.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of natural medicines to increase sales volume

loans.name: Julia Eulalia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia works selling vegetables such as yuca (cassava), chayotes (a kind of summer squash), tomatoes, cabbage, etc. She has been working on this business for 15 years, having started with a capital of C$500.00 which she had saved with the idea of starting her own business.

Mrs. Julia started selling in the market of la Estacion (the station), with a small volume of sales. Then she moved to the market la Terminal in the second street, which is the produce section. Before having this business, she worked as a cleaning lady, but she decided to change businesses because her income as a maid was not enough to sustain her family, which consists of 3 school-age children.

Ceprodel has given her a hand, financially speaking, during the past three years, with a total of 18 loans, which she has paid in full and in time. With this help she has been able to improve her business, and more importantly, she has been able to offer her children the opportunity to study so that in the future they can be well-prepared and get out of this very difficult financial situation in which they have found themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al cual se dedica la señora Julia es a la venta de verduras tales como yuca, challotes, tomates, repollos, etc. Tiene 15 años de tener el negocio iniciando con un capital de C$500.00 producto de ahorros propios que ella hacia con la idea de iniciar su digno negocio.

La señora Julia inicia vendiendo en el mercado de la Estación con pocos volúmenes de venta para luego trasladarse al mercado la Terminal en la segunda calle que es el sector de las verduras, antes de este negocio trabajaba como domestica pero decidió cambiar de negocio ya que no le generaba los suficientes ingresos para mantener su familia que consta de 3 hijos todos en etapa escolar.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace tres años con 18 créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma por lo que ha mejorado su negocio y sobre todo ha podido brindarle los estudios a sus hijos para que en un futuro puedan ser personas muy preparadas y salir de la difícil situación económica en la que se han encontrado.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de Mercaderia)

loans.name: Sukriyah

texts.en: Sukriyah, 38, is the mother of 2 children. She is a farmer who earns $53 a month, while her husband, B., sells waste (salvaged) materials and earns $64 a month. She is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Blas

texts.en:
Blas V. is married with three children. All of his children are young, two in school, and the eldest works with him in his convenience store. The convenience store added an auto service element and now brings in more income than ever. His wife Lourdes De Las is an optometrist and she helps bring in a lot of income.

Blas V. is asking for a loan today to help increase the amount of goods in his convenience store. His plan is to continue increasing the size of his store so that he may continue to increase his income. Blas wants to make sure that all three children will continue on to the university level and secure good jobs for their futures.

loans.use: To buy yerba, sugar, meta, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Husna's Kizuiani Group

texts.en:
Husna is a married woman with a 3 year old child. Husna is a food and fish seller that started her business in 2000. She works selling from 7am to 5pm everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in local alcohol sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. sells frozen meat. She is married and has 2 children. The business of meat selling is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales to increase her income.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more meat for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Pham Thi Ngoc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi Ngoc A., 22 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2006. Her husband is a truck-driver. Their 2 children are still very small. The first loan of 200USD, which was used towards Mrs. A.'s store, was a success. Thus, Mrs. A. is more confident and continue to take loans and invest in her store. Now each month she earns about 250USD from the store. With the increasing income, Mrs. A. has more ability to take care of her children. Her husband also helps her with the repayments whenever she encounters difficulty in business. This time she wants to borrow 575USD to buy candy and other goods to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Ngọc A., 22 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chồng chị làm nghề lái xe, 2 con trai của A. chị đều còn nhỏ. Sau năm đầu vay vốn 200USD đầu tư vào bán hàng tạp hóa có hiệu quả, chị A. tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư cho dự án này. Đến nay thu nhập hàng tháng của chị từ việc bán hàng khoảng 250USD. Kinh tế phát triển, chị A. có điều kiện chăm sóc cho các con của mình hơn. Chồng chị cũng luôn hỗ trợ vợ mỗi khi chị gặp khó khăn nên việc vay vốn của chị A. rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua bánh kẹo bán.

loans.use: Buy confectionary

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Buntha Em, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children, three sons and two daughters. Four of the children attend a local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sophan and her husband have been silk weavers since 1990, a skill they learned from their parents and a neighbor. They sell their finished product to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sophan is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving.

loans.name: Pilly

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Pilly N.. She is married and has two children aged 3 and 7. In 2000, Pilly established her grocery business. Pilly requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $87. In the future, Pilly plans to incease the quantity and range of her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica K. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through Diploma in Business Studies. Veronica sells corn, yams, groundnuts, and other items at Abura, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a driver. Veronica uses her income to pay her children's school fees and the family's utility bills.

Veronica will use the loan to purchase beans, groundnuts, corn, and yams for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: Purchase beans, groundnuts, corn, and yams for sale.

loans.name: Joyce I.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Joyce M..  She is not married and has one child, aged 1. In 2003, Joyce established her crops business. Joyce has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema has been selling fish in Dodoma, Tanzania for five years. She is now hoping to take out a loan so that she may expand her business by selling a greater quantity of fish. If she is able to increase her profits from her current monthly income of approximately $70, she will put the additional profits back into her business so that it may continue to grow.

Rehema is 44 years old, married, and has four children ages 3, 8, 10, and 13. In addition to her own 4 children, she also cares for 7 dependents. Rehema will share this loan with her fellow group members, Mary and Dausi.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en: Mrs. Sarita M. lives in Tangal, Lalitpur with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Manish, is a plumber. Her older son is in grade 9 and younger son in grade 2.  Mrs. Shrestha is a grocery shopkeeper in Tangal. She opened her grocery store 6 years ago to improve her family's standard of living because her husband's income is not sufficient. Mrs. M. sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as maize, rice, and noodles. She requests a $400 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy S., 34, and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Khiev, 41, who live along National Road Number One about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have no children. Her father resides with them.

Chanthy has been growing rice for ten years and selling locally-purchased vegetables for five years at a market in Phnom Penh, assisted by her husband. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizer for farming and to expand her vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming and to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер  ему 31 год ,женат имеет троих детей , проживает в Гафуровском районе , посёлке Хамробод.
он работает в колхозе,а в выходные дни занимается уходом за скотом.Когда его нет за скотом присматривает его жена.Сейчас у него одна корова и 10 баранов.Он хочет получив кредит закупить пару баранов.В их районе жизнь продвигается благодаря купле продаже скота. Алишер благодарен что есть такая возможность взяв кредит , увеличить свой скот.
texts.en:
Alisher is 31 years old, married and has three children. He lives in the Gafur region, in the Hamrobod village. Alisher works at the farming co-op and on weekends raises his own livestock. While he is at work during the week his wife takes care of the animals. Currently they own one cow and 10 rams. Alisher would like to take out this loan to purchase two more rams. In his region of Tajikistan most money is made by buying and selling cattle and Alisher is grateful to have this opportunity to take out a loan in order to increase his own herd.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Туйчиева Назира живет в городе Турсун-Заде.Возраст 25 лет , не замужем и имеет 2 детей. Занимается производством сундуков. кредит планирует получить для закупки жести и досок . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Этот бизнес помогает ей обеспечивать своих двоих детей.
texts.en:
Nazira T. lives in Tursunzade. She a 25-year-old single mother of two children. She makes traditional dower-chests and is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase tin and wood, and to make a living for herself and her two children. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tin and wood

loans.name: Seferina

texts.es:
La Sra. Seferina García D. C. desD. hace años se dedica al servicio D. venta D. comida, en un pequeño kiosco ubicado en una zona residencial D. La Paz trabajo con el que conseguía ingreso para su familia, ella llega a Emprender en calidad D. Garante D. su ahijada quien le alquilo dicho kiosco, con el paso del tiempo la ahijada se va sin dejar rastro D. su existencia y es así como la  Sra. Seferina García se hace cargo D. esta deuda.
Es así como esta señora muestra inicialmente una gran voluntad D. pago y responsabilidad junto a su Esposo quien la colabora incondicionalmente, ese fué el motivo por el cual ingresa al microcrédito, felizmente para ella y su familia con buena fortuna, ya que actualmente la Sra. se encuentra en su Tercera secuencia D. crédito y con la actividad D. venta D. comida en su pequeño kiosco.
texts.en:
Seferina García D. C. has been selling food for many years from a small kiosk in a residential neighbourhood of La Paz, work which brought income for her family. She came to Emprender as a guarantor to her goddaughter who rented her the kiosk. With time, her goddaughter left without a trace, leaving Seferina García with this debt. This is how this woman showed from the beginning a great will to pay and sense of responsibility together with her husband who supports her unconditionally. And so she was introduced to microloans; happily for herself and her family she is now on her third loan cycle and selling food from her little kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him V., 34, is married and lives with three of her children in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$4 each day. Two of her children are in school and one is too young to attend. Him V. is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase fertilizer, fishing nets and a motorbike. With the fishing nets, her husband can go fishing sometimes; the family will use the motorbike for transportation to reduce their daily expenses. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets, fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Irma R. a tenido ya cuatro créditos con FVP y a demostrado se una clienta puntual y responsable con sus pagos. Actualmente desea el apoyo nuevamente para lo colocación de un portón y los acabados del exterior de la casa. 
Doña Gloria Irma es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres pequeños hijos, para los cuales quiere la seguridad.
texts.en:
Gloria Irma R. has already had four loans through FVP, and has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and responsible client with her repayments. Now she needs this support again to install a gate and finish the exterior of her house. Gloria Irma is a single mother with three small children in her care, and she wants to keep them secure.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install gate and finish exterior of house

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas P. is a pig grower. She is 53 years old and has six children. She is already a widow. Presently, she is a barangay (village) captain in her village. She has been raising pigs for 10 years already. "Because of it, I was able to send my children to school and provide their other needs," she said.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (the first Filipino MFI partner to go active with Kiva). She will use the loan to buy pig feed. The loan will help her grow her piggery business to support her children more.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and have their own business. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, la señora María T. se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado el cual la lleva a cabo en su propia localidad alimentando su hato ganadero con el propósito de sacarle el máximo provecho para mantener a su familia.

Hoy en día requiere la compra de una vaca parida para su respectiva crianza y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera salir adelante en su actividad y garantizar el bienestar a su amada familia que depende de él.
texts.en:
In the area of Nagarote in the city of León, señora María T. raises livestock, which she does in a location she owns. She feeds her herd with the goal of getting the most benefit out of it to support her family. Today she needs to buy a calved cow to raise, and this is why she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a credit. In this way, she will get ahead and guarantee the well-being of her beloved family that depends on her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calved cow

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia F. is a 29-year-old married mother of three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are in primary school. She lives with her family in a house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Emilia's husband is a teacher by profession, and Emilia is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies most of it to retailers in her community. She also sells it on a table top in the market square. Emilia procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Dormaa. She has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel T. is from the town of Panaon, Misamis, Occidental. She is 37 years old. Hazel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hazel owns and operates a farm business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Hazel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Hazel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Brono

texts.en: Brono M. is currently in the business of selling water and soda and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and to buy more soda to sell at her shop. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. Brono is 43 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and to buy more soda to sell in her shop

loans.name: Manuela Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Yolanda R. es una dama con mucha experiencia en la elaboración de bebidas naturales las que prepara a diario en la ciudad de León para venderlas a sus clientes que le compran.

Ella es muy visitada porque elabora deliciosos refrescos de todo tipo tales como naranja, cebada, cacao, frutas, entre otros. De igual forma ella vende gaseosas en su localidad. Sin embargo, para seguir adelante en el negocio ella requiere de la inversión para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los refrescos y para esto ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para continuar con su negocio y generar ingresos para su mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Manuela Yolanda R. is an experienced businesswoman who sells natural beverages she prepares daily for her customers in the city of León.

She is very popular because she produces different types of flavored drinks, such as orange, barley, chocolate, mixed fruit, and others. She also sells sodas from her vending location. In order to move her business forward, she needs to purchase ingredients used in making her flavored beverages. She has requested a loan from CEPRODEL in order to continue her business and generate earnings for own living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making flavored beverages

loans.name: Severino

texts.es: Severino tiene 60 años, es casado y padre de 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos viven fuera y el de 14 años vive con él en la casa de su cuñada. El labrado de la tierra y el cuidado de sus cultivos es la actividad que lo llena de mucha satisfacción, por más de 40 años viene dedicándose íntegramente en lograr buenas cosechas, cuyos frutos envía directamente al mercado principal de la ciudad de Tarma, denominado “El Mayorista”. Él vende cada saco de 60 kilos en 70 ú 80 soles y este precio ha sido muy alentador, generándoles muy buenas ganancias, las cuales lo motivan a seguir trabajando. Severina cuenta con valioso apoyo de su esposa después del medio día, pero en los días de cosecha esta pareja trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana de igual a igual, ya que tienen anhelos de comprar la casa donde viven, por ello se han propuesto en trabajar arduamente hasta conseguirlo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que renueva su compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas para seguir trabajando con créditos posteriormente junto al resto de los integrantes de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio y estima. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Severino is 60 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. Of his children, 3 live away from home, while his 14-year-old lives with Severino in his sister-in-law's house. Working the land and cultivating crops is Severino's life's work, and it fills him with great satisfaction. For more than 40 years he has worked entirely on achieving good harvests, sending his fruits directly to the main market in the city of Tarma, which is called "El Mayorista". He sells each 60 kilo sack of fruit for 70 or 80 soles. This price has been very encouraging to him, generating very good earnings, which motivate him to continue working. Severino relies on his wife's valuable help in the afternoons, but during harvest time the two of them work side by side from 7 in the morning onward. They are eager to buy the house in which they live, and are resolved to work arduously until they can do so. This is Severino's fifth loan with MFP, for which he has renewed his commitments to make each of his payments on time, so that he, together with the other members of his communal bank, may continue to rely on the loans to assist them in their work. He has much gratitude and great respect for his communal bank. He intends to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen T. V., age 37, is a widow and has a young child. To make a living she is engaged in the business of selling vegetables (bean sprouts) at a market in the city, earning approximately US$8 per day. This amount is the primary source of income for the family. The family income is also assisted by her child who is currently employed in a local garment factory with an income of US$2 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, V. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, V. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase more vegetables and a motorbike she will use to purchase vegetable to sell.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business and more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 50 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Khoder has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1994. Khoder requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Khoder has requested a loan. 
Khoder is special in his work because he likes his work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He first started his business due to financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Santos Marta

texts.es: Santos Marta D. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Vive con su hija Yamileth de 12 años de edad estudiante y su esposo Don Jose que trabaja como albañil donde sus ingresos no son muy estables, ya que no siempre hay trabajo para él. Santos se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para luego venderlos con sus vecinos , el crédito que solicita Santos es para compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar la producción de tamales para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para elaborar tamales

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una socia colaboradora y dinámica, vive en el caserío de Roaboya que se encuentra ubicado a  doce horas de navegación del puerto de la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 56 años y es madre de doce hijos, todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, bebidas y verduras pues ella lleva estos productos a vender en el caserío donde vive, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la misma actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” desde hace un año y medio, el primer préstamo que obtuvo le permitió invertir en pollos para luego venderlos, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que le permitirá comprar productos para llevar a su tienda de abarrotes. La meta de María es aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su esposo.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de productos de abarrotes.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is separated from his spouse, but has custody of their two children who attend school. He is requesting a loan of $400 to expand his business premise. This will allow him to carry more stock to sell to his customers. In the future, he plans to diversify his income by entering the transport business. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To expand business premise and carry more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Samuel Joaquim

texts.pt:
Samuel Joaquim S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, capital de Moçambique, tem 51 anos de idade, pai de 9 filhos de idades entre 18 a 28 anos de idade 2 destes vão a escola. Fez 4ª classe do antigo sistema de Educação, não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no Distrito de Boane, e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Saiu da cidade da Matola para Boane afim de fixar um estabelecimento farmacêutico e tendo mais tarde decido mudar a sua residência para este local. É negociante e dono do seu negócio há mais de 20 anos e conta com 4 trabalhadores. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt a 5.000.00mt que aplica no sustento da família, pagamento dos trabalhadores e ainda poupa algum no banco comercial (BIM e BCI).

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga e decidiu solicitar o seu 1º empréstimo. O presente credita é o 3º no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (100 sacos de cimento) para produzir blocos da sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.500.00mt os dois, ambos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e aumentar a oferta de serviços do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Samuel Joaquim S. was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name, which is the capital of Mozambique. He is 51 and is the father of 9 children whose ages range from 18 to 28. Two of them go to school. He studied through the 4th grade of the old school system and didn't continue because of his parents' lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family in the district of Boane. He doesn't support anyone besides his immediate family. He left Matola for Boane to start a pharmacy business and later decided to move his home to this location. He has owned his own business for 20 years and has 4 employees. He makes a monthly income of 4,000 to 5,000 meticais and uses it to support his family, pay his workers, and save some in a commercial bank (BIM or BCI). He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend and decided to request his first loan. This is his third credit and it is for 15,000 meticais. He will use it to purchase construcion materials (100 bags of cement) to produce bricks for his home. His previous loans were both for 8,500 meticais and both were used for the same activity. In the future he hopes to request more loans to finish his home and to expand the services he offers at his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace G. is from the village of Argayoso, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 21 years old. Mary Grace is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vitolina

texts.en:
Vitolina F. is 46 and married with 7 children (ages 12 - 29).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Vitolina has many years of experience in this business.  Vitolina needs a loan of WST $1350 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Vitolina joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Vitolina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vitolina F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela, vive en la avenida Florida de la zona Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres.

Trabaja en una empresa de servicios como cajera, en una de las zonas céntricas de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de medicamentos y operación de una de sus hermanas menores la cual se encuentra muy delicada de salud y debe ser operada con urgencia.

Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito, además del carácter social del mismo.
texts.en:
Pamela lives on Florida Avenue in the Munaypata area of the city of La Paz. She is single, and she lives in her parents’ house. She works as a cashier for a service business in one of the central areas of the city. The loan is to buy medicine and pay for an operation for one of her younger sisters. Her sister is in very delicate health, and she urgently needs the operation. This is her third loan with Impro. The completed evaluation and her good character qualify her for the loan

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine and pay for her sister's opreration

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “santa María” esta representado por el señor Darwin y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando junto a nuestra empresa por un segundo ciclo demostrando siempre responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos. La gran mayoría D. los socios se dedica al comercio D. productos como comida abarrotes, frutas, productos electrodomésticos y a negocios como la panadería y venta D. refrigerios por ejemplo el señora Dawin se dedica al transporte público D. pasajeros desD. las seis D. la mañana a hasta las once D. la noche para hacer la renta del día y poder mantener a sus tres niños y a su esposa la cual se dedica a tejer y vender mantas y ropa a pedido para poder ayudar un poco a su esposo que trabaja duramente todo el día para mejorar la calidad D. vida para su familia.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo se pueD. decir que es alto ya que muchas D. las socias se ven en la necesidad D. llevar sus venta a las áreas periféricas debido a la fuerte competencia ene el mercado aquellos que realizan su venta en su domicilio no tienen otra mas que esperar a que los clientes vengan a efectuar el movimiento del día en el caso D. la señora María Luisa que venD. comida tiene sus pensionistas y no tiene mucho conflicto para efectuar su ingreso diario. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, mercadería, herramientas y materiales por ejemplo el señor Darwin efectuara la compra D. repuestos para su vehículo debido a que los muelles ya les están fallando y necesita del dinero para cambiarlos, la señora María Luisa desea efectuar unos cambios a los muebles D. su pensión para darles mayor comodidad a sus clientes que son los que generan el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. su familia. La mayor expectativa que tienen los socios es hacer crecer sus negocios D. manera que no les falte nada a sus familias y puedan darles una mayor comodidad en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Maria" is represented by Darwin, and is maD. up of 15 members who are working with our foundation in their 2nd loan cycle, demonstrating, as always, responsibility and compliance in their payments. A great majority of the members sell products, such as groceries, fruit, electric appliances, snacks, and some have businesses, such as a bakery. For example, Darwin works in public passenger transportation from 6 in the morning until 11 at night so that he can make a daily income and support his 3 children and his wife. His wife weaves blankets and sells them on order so that she can help her husband a little, who works very hard every day to improve the quality of life for his family. As far as the competitive environment, one might say that it is very strong, since many of the members find it necessary to take their sales to outlying areas due to the strong competition in the market. Those who sell from their homes must wait for their customers to come to get their businesses moving. In the case of Maria Luisa, who sells food, she has her boarders and does not have much trouble making her daily income. This loan will be used to buy supplies, merchandise, tools and materials. For example, Darwin will buy spare parts for his vehicle, since his springs are failing and he needs money to change them. Maria Luisa wants to make some changes to the furniture in her boarding-house, to proviD. better comfort for her customers, who are the ones that generate the income necessary to support her family.
