The main expectation of the members is to make their businesses grow so that their families do not lack for anything and so that they can give their families greater comfort in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy supplies, merchandise, tools and materials

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao E. and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Auk (pictured together), were married in 1988 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are construction workers, their daughter is a garment-factory worker and another son attends school. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Mao has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 1989. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is requesting a loan of $300 to build a fence for his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house

loans.name: Rosalie's Group

texts.en:
Rosalie D. is from the village of San Andres. She is 44 years old. Rosalie is the leader of a 7-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosalie D.'s Group.

Rosalie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Rosalie's fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a businesswoman and she loves doing business. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is widowed with 4 children. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, a 62-year-old resident of Oyo State, Nigeria, is the married father of six children and is very happy in his business of raising pigs to sell and operating a poultry farm. Hoping to make his businesses more sustainable, Emmanuel is requesting a loan of 50,000 to purchase more pig feed. He says ‘THANK YOU’ to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more pig feed

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Fidel (37), que es agricultor, y de sus 2 pequeños hijos.

Desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar diversidad de frutas, en la actualidad siembra cítricos y plátanos. Aunque es un trabajo algo complicado porque se necesita paciencia y dedicación, sabe que su recompensa será una fructífera cosecha.
Sus productos los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes le ofrecen buenos precios por su mercadería, así puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 
Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca reconocida y también obtiene buenas ganancias por este trabajo, está muy satisfecha con ambos negocios porque puede trabajar tranquilamente sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos. 
Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y poner en marcha otro negocio, pero aun no decido de qué tipo será.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Yeni tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes y plantas de frutos cítricos para asegurar la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Yeni is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Fidel (age 37), who is a farmer, and their two small children.

At a very young age, Yeni learned how to grow different fruits. She currently grows citrus fruits and bananas. Even though her work is complicated because of the patience and dedication that is required, she knows that she will be rewarded with a fruitful harvest. Her products are sold to the wholesale merchants who offer good prices for her merchandise. This allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. At the same time, Yeni sells beauty products of a well-known brand and also earns good income from this work. She is very satisfied with both of her businesses because they allow her to work peacefully without having to neglect her children. Being an enterprising woman, Yeni has plans to produce fruit in greater quantity and also start up another business, but she hasn’t decided what type it will be.

This is her second loan with MFP. Yeni is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of fertilizers and citrus fruit plants for the next crop season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma B. is a married businesswoman. This entrepreneur runs a café business in Vingunguti ward, Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells a variety of cooked and fried food as well as soft drinks. She purchases her business goods from the food shops and market at Buguruni and Kariakoo city market business center. She is able to provide for her family's daily needs from her business income, including paying her children's school fees. Fatuma is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 TZS to buy more business goods to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Hanat

texts.en:
Hanat S., 36, lives with his wife and 11year old daughter. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). They have been living together in their current home for 20 years. His daughter, Kumis, attends a local primary school. His wife is a nurse in a local hospital. 

During the day, Hanat operates a truck transportation business. His truck is Russian and his business requires lot of fuel but the truck operates without any problems. Besides his transportation business, he also operates a carpentry business during the summer. He builds houses which take three months to complete. Hanat earns 400,000 – 800,000 MNT for per house that he builds. He is an honest and industrious person. 

Hanat would like to create his own carpentry workshop in the future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to transport stones from the countryside in order to resell them in Ulgii soum.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for his truck

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Señor David  vive en casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
El Señor David es empleado en una empresa comercial y su esposa realiza labores de casa, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el terminado de una habitación que se encuentra en media construcción.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
David lives in his own house in the Las Lomas neighborhood located in the western part of La Paz with his wife and two daughters. He is an employee of a commercial firm and his wife works as a domestic employee; their combined income supports the family. He will use the requested funds to finish building a room which is only half done so far. This is his second loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted yielded a positive score so he may have access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LAS AZUCENAS LA RAZON DEL NOMBRE ES POR QUE EN CASA  DE UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES HAY ESAS FLORES. EL GRUPO  ESTA UBICADO EN LA LOCALIDAD DE JULIAN GRAJALES MUNICIPIO DE COPAINALA ESTADO DE CHIAPAS, MEXICO. CONOCIDO TAMBIEN COMO “SAN ANTONIO”. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES SEÑORAS QUE SE CONOCEN DESDE HACE CUARENTA AÑOS.
LA SEÑORA FREDY ES REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO  LAS AZUCENAS, TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTUDIO HASTA EL TERCER GRADO DE SECUNDARIA. ESTA CASADA CON EL SEÑOR ROFINO FARELO SANCHEZ Y TINE EN TOTAL SIETE HIJOS LOS CUALES CINCO TIENE EN SU PODER: MAGDIEL DE 20 AÑOS, ESDRA DE 17, LIA ANILU DE 14 AÑOS Y CURSA EL TERCERO DE SECUNDARIA, DAVID, CON 12 AÑOS  EN SEXTO DE PRIMARIA, YEIDER DE 10 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PANES DESDE HACE 20 AÑOS ANTERIORMENTE TRABAJABA CON SU MAMA LA SEÑORA RAQUEL V. G. QUIEN LA APOYABA PARA REALIZAR DICHA ACTIVIDAD, AHORA SOLO ELLA SE DEDICA A ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD.  SOLICITO EL PRETAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE INGREDIENTE COMO SON: HARINA, HUEVO, ACEITE, LEVADURA, ROYAL, CANELA, MARGARINA Y LECHE, Y ASI PODER CONTINUAR CON SU AVTIVIDAD, Y APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, PARA QUE JUNTOS PUEDAN SACAR ADELANTE  A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS PARA QUE CADA UNO TENGA MEJOR FUTURO DE VIDA.
 FREDY FORMO ESTE GRUPO CON SU MAMA LA SEÑORA RAQUEL V. GOMES QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA COMO SON: PANTALONES, PLAYERAS, BLUSAS, CAMISAS ENTRE OTROS. ASÍ MISMO LA OTRA INTEGRANETE DEL GRUPO ES ROMETILDE HERNANDEZ H. EN LA VENTA DE ANTOJITOS COMO SON GORDITAS, TOSTADAS, EMPANADAS ENTRE OTROS.
texts.en:
This supportive group is called Las Azucenas (The Lillies). The reason for this name is because these flowers grow in one of the member's homes. The group is situated in the Julian Grajales locality, Copainala municipality in Chiapas state, Mexico. It's also known as 'San Antonio'. The group is made up of 3 ladies who have known each other for 40 years. Senora Fredy is Las Azucenas' representative. She is 40 years old, and studied until the third grade of secondary school. Fredy is married to Rofino Farelo Sanchez and in total they have 7 children, 5 of which are under their care: Magdiel (20), Esdra (17), Lia Anilu (14), David (21), who is in the third grade of secondary school, and Yeider (10) who is in the sixth grade of primary school. Fredy has worked selling bread for 20 years. Before this she worked with her mother, Raquel V. G., whom she supported doing the same activity. Now only Fredy makes bread. She is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, yeast, royal, cinnamon, margarine and milk, to continue her activities and to support her husband with the household costs, so together they can move forward and allow their children to study so each one has a better future in life. Fredy started this group with her mother, Raquel V. G., who works selling clothes such as pants, t-shirts, blouses and shirts, among others. The other member of the group is Rometilde Hernandez Hernandez who sells snacks such as gorditas, tostadas and empanadas, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread such as: flour, eggs, sugar, oil, royal, cinnamon and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing different kinds of watches.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa P. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Elsa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal and  home products to community members. Elsa has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with a six-month-old son. He has been operating his poultry business for over one year. He sells wholesale and retail to restaurant operators and butcher shops. In addition, he operates a goat-meat business (buying and selling goats). 

With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to expand his poultry business by purchasing twenty broiler chicken for breeding. Joseph faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes that, in the future, he will open another branch. His main aim of working with Yehu is to get financial assistance to improve his business. He lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Joseph cites his greatest monthly expense as household items.

loans.use: to purchase twenty broiler chickens

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna M.
Ruzanna resides in the village of Voghji in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with a 22-year-old daughter and a 26-year-old son.  She has a high school education with technical training as a mechanic.  She has been working in cattle breeding and growing vegetables for the past 20 years.  She is planning to expand her cattle breeding business by purchasing additional cattle with a loan.  She already has customers willing to purchase her new cattle.  With the loan she expects to increase the family income by 20% and will use some of the proceeds for repairing the family home.  She is a hard working woman with a good reputation in Voghji.  Ruzanna has many family and friends living near the family farm.  Even though many villagers are engaged in similar businesses, Ruzanna’s excellent relations with her clients enable her to always sell her products.

loans.use: additional calves

loans.name: Elizabeth Aoko

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a forty-two-year-old mother of nine children, and she is married to Mr. O., who is a mechanic. She has been in the business of selling charcoal for ten years now and is the main supplier in her town. She says she makes a good profit out of the business and she has been able to educate three of her children using the profits from the business, and now they are employed doing different jobs.

With this third loan, Elizabeth plans to buy additional bags of charcoal so as to have enough stock to continue supplying her clients. Her future plan is to own a big store and become a wholesale supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to resell

loans.name: Pan Sellers Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Pan Sellers” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each of them. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu C. (right) is the leader of this group. The 55-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for 30 years now and she sells dishes (pans), rubber bowls, buckets, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy dishes, rubber bowls, buckets, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in small city in Pakistan called Pakpattan. It is located in Punjab and is known for its sugar production. Perveen lives with her family in a two-room brick house. She has given birth to two daughters, 12-year-old Shaista and 8-year-old Sania, who are attending school in 5th and 2nd class respectively. 

Perveen is an active lady, operating a milk business from home and also selling shawls (a cloth worn over the shoulders and upper body) in her area to earn extra income for her family. Her husband, M. A., has a small piece of land and grows wheat on it. After cultivating the wheat, he sells it to different wheat sellers and earns good profit on it. He has been in this business for the past eight years. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy seeds, fertilizer, etc., for growing wheat and getting the maximum output from his land. Perveen is confident that her husband will get good production from his land using the loan money. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client, paying her installments on time and never missing any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for growing wheat

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah M. lives in the Makerere neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the last year, she has made a living selling charcoal. She works every day of the week, selling from her home, and has applied for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her main challenges include transporting charcoal from the town Luwero to her home in Makerere. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a delivery van to help with transportation, and earn enough money to send her children to college. Hadjah owns her home and has access to electricity and water. Her biggest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: Germán Antonio tiene 24 años, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. Se gana la vida trabajando en la venta de ropa desde hace más de 3 años de experiencia. Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante. El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Pues cada día se esfuerza más para realizarlo. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes ya que su negocio ha crecido y tiene una mayor demanda, Esta acción le permitirá otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para hacerles progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en: Germán Antonio, 24, has a young son.  He has operated a business selling clothing for more than 3 years.  He has always tried to give his family a better quality of life and the business has allowed him a means to do so.  He now wants to make some improvements to his house and he works hard every day to see the project through.  He will use this loan to buy merchandise--trousers, shirts, skirts and suits--to resell because his business has grown and he has to meet demand.  The loan will allow his to deliver a better quality of life to his family.  German's greatest hope is to go on working so that he can reach his goals.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Afif

texts.ar:
عفيف في عمر 51 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع الدجاج له في المهنة حوالي 20 سنة متزوج وله 2 اولاد  يحب عائلته ويلقى منها الدعم الدائم
متطور يحب عمله ويطوره باستمرار من خلال معرفته لمحيطه العملي لكن ما ينقص لزيادة البضائع والمعدات هو الماال لذلك هو يطلب قرض من المجموعة 
بهدف شراء بضائع جديدة ومكنة للدجاج ليس لديه رأس مال كافي ليطور المصلحة له زبائن يقصدونه لانه معروف  بالاتقان والنظافة في العمل
texts.en: Afif is a 51-year-old husband and father-of-two who loves his family and in turn receives considerable support from them. For the past two decades, Afif has been working at a poultry shop, where many customers come to give their patronage because of his reputation for quality products and keeping a clean shop. He also uses his tight relationship with his customers to continually develop his circle of clients. Nevertheless, Afif lacks sufficient capital to expand his business, and hence would like to turn to Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase a poultry processor and other commodities for his shop.

loans.use: Purchase poultry processor and other commodities for poultry shop

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariza; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurant que junto con su hermana sacan adelante este negocio, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panetones para vender en el restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariza is a member of the Communal Bank “Liderando Las Palmeras” (Leading the Palms) which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Mariza divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food. She has a restaurant that she has successfully managed with her sister. Mariza works from 9am until 6pm. She wants to expand and improve her restaurant business, so she is requesting a loan to buy panettones to sell in her restaurant.

Mariza is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase panettone (Christmas bread) to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase goods for the store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. She has been farming for six years now and employs one farmhand. Her main products are milk, vegetables and bananas which are sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through the Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Then, her family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help her in paying school fees for her children. Her major challenges have been diseases and lack of enough animal feed.

Alice is 24 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando H. is from the village of Samonte. He is 36 years old. Rolando is married and has an infant. To make a living, Rolando raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rolando has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Rolando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolando is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Rolando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce B. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 30 years old and the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Joyce B.'s Group.

Joyce is married and has 2 very young children. She owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Joyce has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every harvest season or after four months.

In 2010, Joyce joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Joyce is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Joyce from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek P., 32, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. P. sells vegetables and pumpkins, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 7 on the other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., age 61, operates a family member's general store in the village of Sta. Filomena, where she lives. Rosita has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. She and her husband have five adult children. 

In 2007, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase feed for her pigs. 

Rosita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to offer for sale in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S., 41, and her husband, 38, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Mekong River. They always take the fish they have caught to sell in the busy market. If they have some fish left over, they will turn them into dried fish or fish paste.This couple can earn a profit from this business of $10 each day to help support their family.  

Math S. says that she and her husband can transport their fish by using their existing motorbike, but now it has broken down. The couple wishes to buy a new one but they don’t have enough money to do that. In order to deal with this problem, Math S. is applying for a loan to buy a used  motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to buy a used to motorbike to replace the broken one

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 38 years old and married, with four children. All four children are in school, and Leonor works very hard to provide for them. 

Leonor runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items like sardines, candies, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. Leonor has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, shampoo etc. 

In the future, Leonor would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
For the past four years, Abena G. has been selling gari and kenkey in her village Mfuom, near Abura town in the Central Region.  Gari is a Ghanaian staple painstakingly made from cassava and can be eaten in a variety of ways. Kenkey is another staple made from fermented cassava and corn dough. 

Abena is married and has six children.  Her sale of gari and kenkey supplements her husband’s income as a farmer. She helps pay the cost of sending their children to school – mainly school uniforms and books, and also some of the utilities bills. 

In order to save up for higher education fees for her children, Abena needs to increase her earnings. To do so, she plans to expand her business with her loan from Kiva. With it she will purchase more cassava, corn, and other ingredients to prepare more food for sale. Part of the anticipated extra earnings will be put back into the business to grow it further and the rest will be saved for her family’s future.

loans.use: buy cassava, corn and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo es un padre de 46 años de edad que tiene 3 hijos a cargo y vive en el distrito de   Olmos (Lambayeque), un distrito conocido por la gran actividad agrícola y ganadera que se desarrolla en él.

Evaristo trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20 años, algo que lo ha vuelto un experto en esté ámbito. Actualmente Evaristo cosecha limón para comercializarlo en el mercado de Olmos, un lugar donde Evaristo tiene su clientela ya establecida.

Para mejorar la calidad de sus limones, Evaristo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de urea y otros insumos necesarios para la cosecha de su producto.

Evaristo pretende expandir su clientela y no sólo ser conocido en el mercado de Olmos. Él quiere mejorar su calidad de vida por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Evaristo, 46 years old, has three children and lives in the region of Olmos (Lambayeque), which is known for its farming and livestock.

Evaristo has worked as a farmer for 20 years, and has become an expert in the field. He currently grows limes and sells them in the Olmos market, where he has a customer base already established.

Evaristo has requested a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to improve the quality of his limes. He will use the money to buy urea and other products he needs for his crop.

Evaristo would like to expand his customer base beyond the Olmos market. He wants his children to have a better life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and other supplies for his lime crop.

loans.name: Estilita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Estilita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Estilita's past four loans from NWTF have helped sustain her business, and she is now requesting a loan of PHP 12000 to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Estilita hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and acquire a vegetable stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchace additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group B

texts.en:
50 year old Teo has been involved in a liquor store business for an amazing 20 years. What is this smiling lady's secret? That is a question many may be prompted to ask. Many people in her place of origin in Mukono hold this happily married mother of 4 in very high regard because she has blazed an unprecedented trail in many respects by surviving this long in this highly competitive business. Her success has come with lots of hard work and determination. Many people have followed her example and have started their own businesses. 

Teo was encouraged by her husband to get established in this business. Weekly she says her sales profits are 80,000 shillings  and  with this Kiva loan she is going to purchase more jerrycans of crude liquor from different local distillers around Mukono. Teo believes that with more sales, she will be able to effectively consolidate her business profits.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans of crude liquor to resell

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén desde muy joven ha trabajado con su tío en una carnicería y ha aprendido esta actividad y disfruta de ella, es por esto que desde hace varios años él decide tener su propio negocio que no solo es carnicería sino también frutera y legumbrería.

Este negocio le ha permitido mantener a su familia que es su mamá y su hijo, Rubén quiere que su negocio crezca y poder tener más adelante su propio local y para que sus ingresos se incrementen y así le pueda mejorar la calidad de vida a su hijo necesita tener un buen surtido para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubén had worked with his uncle since he was very young in a butcher shop.  He has learned this occupation and enjoys it.  Because of this several years ago he decided to have his own business that’s not just a butcher shop but also a fruit and vegetables store.

This business has made it possible for him to support his family which consists of his mother and his son.  Rubén needs his business to grow and to have a locale of his own later on and so that his income will rise and he can provide his son with a better quality of life he needs to have more varied stock for his business.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Maria Olga tiene 19 años, es soltera vive con la madre no tiene hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene 2 cerdos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Quito.

Le gusta ver television, escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Maria Olga is 19 years old and lives with her mother in the Guaranda District, in Bolivar Province. She is singles and does not have children. 

The members of the solidarity group V.R.C. BELLAVISTA live in the community of Papauco Pucara in the Guaranda District, only 15 minutes away from the San Jose Cooperative. The solidarity group is composed of 11 members who work in agriculture, raising animals and other activities. 

Maria grows potatoes, wheat, and corn and also has 2 pigs. She buys supplies in the Guaranda market and sells her goods at a larger market in the same city. 

Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies and feed for her animals. The loan will help her economically, to meet her basic needs and it will help her face challenges like crop disease. Her dream is to buy a house in Quito. She likes to watch tv and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals.

loans.name: 11 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hương has a retail business selling general food and household commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain her general store.

Hương is 40 years old and she is single with no children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11 Điện Biên solidarity group. Hương lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain a general store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old, married and has four children in school.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has been operating his business for four years. He is also employed. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business and improved his family’s standard of living.

Samuel hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice, baking flour, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy rice, baking flour, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: 11.3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Tứ is 60 years old and married with three children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Tứ is the leader of a five-member group known as the 11.3 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group. For the past 10 years, she has run a wine-making business. The main business hardship that Tứ faces is the lack of capital.

Tứ is requesting a loan to purchase materials and ingredients to make wine and invest in her business. This will be Tứ’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Tứ hopes for her business to do well, her family to be healthy and happy, and for children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase material to make wine

loans.name: Luchando A Lograr Group

texts.es:
El comité Luchando a lograr es de la ciudad de Lambaré, es uno de los comités más antiguos de la Fundación, el grupo ha tenido importantes avances, aprendieron a trabajar en grupo, a ayudar a las socias del comité, y a ser responsables con los créditos que han recibido. Las señoras integrantes del comité se destacan por el sacrificio y las ganas de progresar.
La señora Diana se dedica a la venta de comestibles, sus comidas son muy apreciadas ya que tiene muchos clientes, comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana a elaborar los alimentos que va a prepara. Todo lo que ella hace es por el bien de su familia, es decir, se esfuerza al máximo para obtener mayores ingresos y de esa forma poder darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, verduras, condimentos y demás ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de loa alimentos que vende. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Luchando a Lograr is from the city of Lambaré. It is one of the oldest communal banks of the Fundación. The group has made important advances: they learned to work as a group, to help the members of the communal bank, and to be responsible with the loans they have received. The female members of the communal bank stand out due to their sacrifice and desire to progress.

Diana makes a living selling food and her meals are very valued as she has many customers. She says that she wakes up very early in the morning to prepare the food that she is going to make. Everything she does is for the good of her family. That's to say that she makes the maximum effort to obtain a higher income and this way be able to give them a better standard of living.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, seasonings, and the rest of the necessary ingredients to make the food she sells. She is grateful for the Fundación and the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, and vegetables for the dishes she sells

loans.name: Tubehoneza Group

texts.fr:
Godelieve  est une commerçante  âgée de 30 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Bukirasazi en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires  (bananes et haricots) depuis 12 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est mariee et mere de 5 enfants dont 3étudient.
 Le crédit de Kiva de 140000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires(bananes et haricots) dans le but de realiser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “TUBEHONEZA”
texts.en:
Godelieve, age 30, is a merchant who lives in Bukirasazi, Gitega Province. She's been selling food products (bananas and beans) for 12 years. She's also a cultivator. She attended elementary school up to the sixth year. She's married and the mother of five children, out of whom three attend school.

Her share of the Kiva loan amounts to 140000 BIF, and will enable her to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas and beans, in order to turn a healthy profit. She's a member of the community group TUBEHONEZA.

loans.use: to buy and resell large quantities of bananas and beans

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for 14 years. She started with 600,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the different tastes of her customers and her visions are a bigger textile shop and educating her children. Jackline needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Ayawa  est une femme  âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur avec trois enfants en charge.
Ayawa  travaille comme revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités, des articles scolaires et de la boisson depuis 09ans. Elle vend dans un quartier de la place après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Ayawa  a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaires, des articles scolaires et des boissons.
texts.en:
Ayawa is 32 years old and married to a retailer. She is responsible for 3 children. 
 
For 9 years Ayawa has been working as a retailer of basic products, school supplies, and drinks. She buys her items at the Grand Market in Lomé and then sells them in a local neighborhood. 

Ayawa is asking for a third loan from WAGES so that she can buy food products, school supplies, and drinks.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products, school supplies, and drinks.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 23 years old and married. His spouse is Phyllis who is just a housewife. They are blessed with two children who are seven and two years old. 

He owns a food store in Murkurai trading center where he buys and sells cereals. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000. He has applied for his first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD and hopes to use the money to purchase more cereals for his store.  

The profits will be used to pay school fees for his children and to purchase more cereals for his business. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
E. is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

E. is in the agricultural business with a livestock retail business in the Philippines. E. requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

E. has been buying and selling livestock for three years now, and she has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, E. would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Brisa Group

texts.es: las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Maribel va a comprar con su credito carne de cerdo y utencilios para su carniceria, la serora patricia va a compra Topperware por mayoreo, las demas integrantes sigen en su negocio con su actividad que tienen. La señora Demetria Cristina tiene 46 años de edad ella es casada tiene 3 hijos 2 hombres y una mujer, solo estudia el niño más pequeño en la primaria los otros dos ya son mayores, ella tiene su negocio una cocina económica vende guisados, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar verduras, carnes, azúcar, refrescos para elaborar la comida, su negocio es importante porque obtiene beneficios para su casa, a ella le gusta atender a sus clientes que son choferes, transportistas y trabajadores de oficina, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su negocio y obtener ingresos para beneficio de su persona y su casa, sus sueños y esperanzas son estar mejor con la familia y que sus hijos se superen y estén bien de salud. Ella está feliz con este préstamo le dan la oportunidad de surtir su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos, que dios los cuide y que nos sigan ayudando con sus préstamos”.
texts.en:
The new group members are Maribel who will use the loan to buy pork and utensils for her butcher shop and Patricia who will buy Tupperware at wholesale.  The rest of the members continue with their same business and activities.

Demetria Cristina, 46, is married and has three children: two boys and one girl.  Only the youngest is still in elementary school; the rest are all older.  She has her business selling inexpensive meals.  She requested her loan to buy vegetables, meats, sugar and soft-drinks to prepare her dishes.  Her business is important because she obtains benefits for her household.  She enjoys taking care of her customers who are truck drivers, taxi drivers, and office personnel.  She feels proud to have her business and to obtain income for herself personally and for her family.  Her dreams and hopes are to be in a better family relationship and that her children improve themselves and are in good health. She is happy with this loan which gives her the opportunity to stock her business.  

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “thank you very much for the loans.  May God keep you and please continue helping us with your loans.”

loans.use: to buy chilies, green tomatoes, red tomatoes, vegetables, meats, sugar and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Isabel Paula

texts.es: Isabel empezó su negocio en el año 2008 dedicándose a la venta de bebidas como emolientes, cebada, raspadilla. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y 7 días a la semana, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio Ica Perú. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y económicamente independiente.  Anteriormente Isabel ha obtenido un crédito. Con el préstamo de 1,000.00 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Isabel puede comprar  insumos para su negocio  de bebidas, ya que se acerca la temporada de verano. También su crédito permitirá  a Isabel al pensar en el futuro y sueña con terminar de construir su casa propia ya que Isabel es una mujer luchadora emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y pagará cumplidamente sus cuotas.
texts.en: Isabel started her business in 2008, selling beverages such as soothing teas, barley drinks, and shaved ice. She works 6 hours every day, 7 days a week. Her business is located in her own residence in Ica Peru. She has her children's help. They are grown and financially independent. Isabel took out a loan previously. With the 1,000.00 soles she will receive thanks to Kiva, Isabel can buy materials for her beverage business, since summertime is approaching. The loan will also allow Isabel to think about the future. She dreams of finishing construction on her own house. Isabel is a fighter who really wants to get ahead. Her loan promotor thinks she is an excellent client and she will make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beverage business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane works at the local school as a teacher. Unfortunately a teacher's salary is too low to sustain her four children, thus Gayane is also engaged in agriculture. She has been successfully managing the business for many years and has expanded it. Before the winter Gayane has a problem feeding her cattle. So she has applied for a loan to purchase forage. With the help of this loan Gayane will take care of the cattle properly, which will allow her to maintain her current number of the cattle. Gayane will keep getting enough income and will sustain her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Luis Wilhelm

texts.es:
Luis sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luis sigue dedicándose a promover eventos culturales y sociales. Luis también sigue con el pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de comida.  Actualmente,  Luis ha creado una página web donde se brinda servicios de radio y tv. (www.voce.pe)
En esta oportunidad Luis requiere el préstamo para seguir implementando la pagina web.    

Luis se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luis continues participating in the Chaska communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. He continues promoting cultural and social events and also involved in the small family business that consists of food sales. Currently Luis has ceated a web page where he offers his radio and tv services (www.voce.pe).  This time Luis needs a loan to continue running his web page.

Luis is grateful for the opportunity provided him through this loan and promises to comply with the scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to continue running his web page.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is a 25-year-old married woman with three children -- two of them are in school. She has a six-year business of selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan. Loice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедджон успешный студент 3-го курса юридического факультета Славянского университета. Ему 20 лет. Он активный и целеустремленный парень. Отец и мать пенсионеры занимаются домохозяйством. Умедджон запрашивает займ для оплаты за обучение университета. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Он хочет чтобы вы помогли ему окончить университет с высокими баллами.
texts.en: Umedjon is a successful third-year judicial department student of the Slavic University.  He is 20 years old.  He is an active and goal-oriented young man.  His father and mother are retirees and involved in household work.  Umedjon is requesting this loan to pay for university education.  He relies on your help and kindness.  He wants you to help him to graduate from the university with high marks.

loans.use: to pay for university education

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is from the village of San Antonio. He lives there with his wife and  children. Jerry grows early crops, rice and corn. He has a large plot of land. He has been growing agricultural crops for 25 years. 

Jerry plans to invest the loan from Kiva  to buy seed and fertilizer at P 20,000 to keep his business accurate. Jerry gladly channels the financial means towards development of his business. He seeks to develop further and has a promising potential for this.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a motorvehicle to transport agricultural produce for sell

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.en: Eufracio is a 52-year-old married man with six young children  from Ormoc City, Leyte. Eufracio is a tricycle driver for three years now.  This is how he provide for his family. He is asking a loan so he can buy his own new tricycle.  With this, he will not pay for the rental of other people’s tricycle, thus earning his family a better income. Eufracio hopes of making their business profitable and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new tricycle

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is a 40 year-old native of Guayaquil who has two children and a living wife. His wife is a mannequin maker, and “Lucho” used to work in a factory. Left without work, Luis had to learn how to sell fish to continue providing for his family. For 7 years Sr. A. has worked as a fish salesman in a local market. He arrives at 4:00 am every day to buy his fresh products in the grand market, and thanks to the help of his wife, they have been able to make improvements on their home from mud and raw materials to cement. Don Luis needs this loan to be able to buy a refrigerator to keep his fish fresh throughout the day.

loans.use: Buy refigerator to keep catch of the day fresh

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson has four children--two whom are adults and two young ones. He has received training from the Kenya Dairy Board and Land’O’Lakes in the handling and processing of milk products. His business involves buying raw milk from farmers about 75 Km from Malaba town and transporting it to Malaba, where it is pasteurized and distributed to customers.

Currently he is able only to handle 500 litres of milk while his facility is able to process at least 1200 litres. This is his first loan with PEMCI and he intends to use the funds to increase his raw-milk handling capacity. Danson sells milk within Malaba town and as far as into neighboring Uganda. The demand for milk is high as this region does not produce milk.

His objective is to turn his facility into a mini-plant and to diversify into milk products such as yoghurt. He employs four other people in the dairy, in addition to his wife and himself. This project has the potential for growth and is worthy of the support of Kiva and its partners.

loans.use: Increase milk stock.

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 33 years old, and her husband is 34. They have 2 children, a 12 yr old daughter and a 5 yr old son. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes tools for agriculture. She collects recyclables and sells them at her shop. The shop gives her a profit of $7.50 per day and the profit is mainly used for the education of her children. She wants a new loan to buy more recyclables to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more recyclables for her shop

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
Maria Paz is a divorcée and has one son and one daughter, 27 and 25 years old, respectively. They are already married. Maria lives alone and to cover her living expenses, she started her own business six years ago, selling shoes in the area of San Nicolás de los Garza in Nuevo León. Due to her good sales skills, she has managed to rapidly increase the number of her customer and to grow her business. Now she also sells natural products and has very good results with those as well.

Maria is an entrepreneurial woman with a large appetite and ambition to move forward. Now, she just needs a loan of $925 which will be used to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices to meet her clients’ demands. She promises to repay this loan in 6 months. With your help, Maria can grow her business and sincerely thanks you for your generosity and opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Paz es divorciada, tiene un hijo y una hija, de 27 y 25 años respectivamente, ellos ya están casados. Maria vive sola y para poder cubrir sus gastos inició su propio negocio hace seis años con la venta de zapatos en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León, gracias a su gusto por las ventas ha logrado incrementar sus clientes rápidamente y hacer crecer su negocio, ahora también ha incorporado la venta de productos naturales obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Maria es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos y adquirirlos a precio de mayoreo, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria puede hacer crecer su negocio y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad y la oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Rokia

texts.en: Rokia Koné has lived with her mother for all her life, until she passed away a few months ago. Rokia now lives with her fiancé in Treichville in the south of Abidjan. She has been selling vegetables in the market there for 15 years. Her fiancé helps her financially and Rokia wants to expand and develop her business in order to become more independent. She will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk so she can resell them to school and restaurant during the upcoming year. Ms. Koné will pay off the loan over a 15 month period.

loans.use: Koné Rokia will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Khoeun was married in 1978 and has three children, one son and two daughters. She has been in the business of selling fish since 1983. Her husband is a fisherman. He gives the fish he catches to his wife to sell in the market.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to purchase a wooden boat, boat motor and fishing net for her husband to expand the fishing activity.

loans.use: Purchasing a wooden boat, boat motor and fishing net .

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
Juanita worked most of her life in agriculture, she grew up in cotton-picking area and most of her family has worked in the same business. She is also a single mother, this is why she used her savings to start selling toys and little items on the street in different areas of the country.

Do to the effort and high risk she was incurring on these trips, she decide to stay working on a Market at Terminal de Leon, here she has her items for show in the second street of the market, where she pays daily for someone to store her inventory.

With Ceprodel she has been working for about a year and she has shown great use of the credit she got and excellent repayment history. They have granted her 7 loans and they all have been completely paid back and on time. These loans helped her increase sales; she uses this income to grow her business and to contribute to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Juanita, la mayor parte de su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo del campo, por habitar en una zona altamente algodonera y tradicionalmente su familia se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Además es madre soltera el cual inicia con sus ahorro otra forma de trabajo siendo esta la venta de juguetes o mercadería de temporada de forma ambulante ofrecidos en diferentes departamentos del país. Por el esfuerzo y el alto riesgo que tenia al realizar estos viajes decide quedarse trabajando en el mercado la Terminal de León, ubicando su mercadería en canastos al aire libre en la segunda calle del mismo mercado, donde paga diariamente bodega para su mercadería .

Con Ceprodel ha estado trabajando desde hace un año y ha demostrado dar buen uso de crédito y mantener su record crediticio excelente, se le han otorgado siete créditos todos cancelados en tiempo y forma por lo que hasta la fecha de hoy en día, la señora Juanita ha superado sus ventas obteniendo mayores ingresos económicos que los ha invertido en su familia y negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Inventory

loans.name: Nayah

texts.en: Nayah, 44, has a husband, A., does not work anymore. So to provide for her family needs she sells snacks, crispy chips, spices, etc. at her food stall, earning $11. She is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her stall. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol owns and is the principal of a primary school in the Altagracia community of Herrera, Santo Domingo. Currently, she receives more than 500 children from the surrounding area who attend class in the school. María explains that not all parents have the means to pay for their children’s education, even though her school is not expensive. She also says that she employs 17 teachers and, every now and then, she needs to get the benches and blackboards repaired.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more school furniture because she thinks that the more comfortable the pupils are, the better they’ll be able to learn.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a school the entrepreneur manages.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 30 years old and single. She owns a small stationery which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am until 6 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items for the business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a secretarial services business

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven R. is 68 years of age and a widow living in Kampong Cham province. She lives with, and is cared for by, one of her daughters, Yon Narem. Yon Narem is 37 years old (pictured here as her mother was unavailable) and farms vegetables, which she sells to the market for about 2 US$ per day. Her other two children are both married and send them some cash each month to help with expenses. Ven R. wants to install water pipes that will help them irrigate their fields; something very rarely done efficiently in Cambodia. This will cost about 100 US$. The remainder of the loan would go towards renting a plot of land nearby on which her daughter will also work.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation system and rent land.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Chávez is 32 years old, has completed her secondary school education and has two young children, who she takes care of very well. She lives in the new part of Cesar Vallejo in the Urbanización La Rinconada in the city of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú.

Luz has moulding premises, where she sells bolts, lights, oils, lubricants etc. She runs her business from a room in her house, which is suitable for selling these products. She started doing this two and a half years ago, thanks to a $100 loan from Manuela Ramos. She invested this money in her small business and thanks to her constant hard work, this is now growing, leading to an improvement in her quality of life. She is a member of Banco Comunal "Las Jadeitas"

With this next loan of $400, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more goods for her business.

Her biggest dream is to expand her business so that she can provide her children with a good education.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 27 years old. She lives with parents in a small village near Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Amal is striving to improve the life of her family, which is heavily dependent upon her. Amal has to leave school at an early age and start selling various fruits and produce. Amal now owns her own produce shop. However, the rapidly rising costs of produce has become a serious problem for small entrepreneurs such as Amal, who do not have the means necessary to cope with rapidly inflating prices. Amal would like a loan of $700 to help continue her business and also repair her store.

loans.use: USD 700 to purchase enough vegetables and fruits and to do some maintenance for her shop that has a leaking ceiling

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, a 36-year-old entrepreneur, is wife and mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on a table in the local market. Sakina says that, through this business, she has managed to send her first child all the way through senior high school. She is requesting this loan to enable her to buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children as they attend school, to give them a future and hope.

Sakina belongs to the community group called “Ebe ba mu Trust Group”. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans

loans.name: Fraxila

texts.es:
For 23 years, Fraxila has sold vegetbales and tubers outside in her neighborhood's market. Every day, she rises at 3AM in order to buy produce at wholesale prices and get everything ready to begin selling from 8AM until 2PM. Previously, Fraxila was dedicated to sewing clothes in her home, however, she decided to leave that job because the selling in the market required a lot of time and effort.

The loans that she has received have been used to fix her home. Now, Fraxila would like to purchase a car and rent it out as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 23 años, Fraxila vende verduras y tubérculos afuera del mercado de su barrio. Ella todos los días se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para salir a comprar por mayor las verduras y dejar todo listo para empezar a vender desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Fraxila antes se dedicaba a coser ropa en su casa, pero decidió dejar esta actividad porque las ventas en el mercado le exige mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para arreglar su casa. A Fraxila le gustaría comprarse un auto y alquilarlo como taxi.

loans.use: To fix the infrastructure of her home.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Saada S. from Mwanza. She is married with one child, aged seven. Saada has been running a maize business since 2006. Client's business is selling maize. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by three employees. Saada currently earns about 200usd from her business. She is requesting a loan of 350usd in order to buy more maize. In the future, she plans to increase the stock quantity. Saada thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Shafika

texts.en: Shafika is a very ambitious woman of 39 years who owns a small shop selling candies and other treats in the Southern Lebanese city of Saida. Shafika has requested a $1000 loan to help her pay for an urgent surgicA. procedure. If there is money left over from the loan, she plans to use it to purchase new inventory for her shop. This will be the third loan Shafika has taken from A. Majmoua. Shafika is very grateful for Kiva and all who give her the chance to have this surgery and improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent surgical procedure

loans.name: Nyanama Twegatte Group

texts.en:
Immaculate N. is the leader of Nyanama Twegatte group. This is the second time she is seeking a loan from Kiva to boost her business selling matooke. She is very grateful for the help rendered to her group.

With time, Immaculate has been able to expand her business to sell a variety of produce to her stall. She plans to use this loan to buy more bunches of matooke, sweet potatoes, cassava, and Irish potatoes for her business in order to earn more profits.

As a widow, she is the bread-winner of the family. But with the profits from her business and part of her savings, she's been able to cater for her children and caretakers.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 38, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. This couple together has two young school-aged children.  Since 2005, she has been selling fish at the market to earn a living and is able to make $5 of profit a day. She often receives fish from her husband, who works as a fisherman. He gives his catch to his wife and the rest he sells to other fish sellers in the market. On average, he makes $4 of profit a day. 
Pen C. spends $50 on food every month, $17 on utilities and $20 on children’s education. 

Pen C. would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband. This will allow her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools.

loans.name: Umoja Charambe Group

texts.en:
Mlokozi M., 36, is married with three children ages 9, 5, and 1. He sells second-hand clothes. He started this business in 2000 and works daily from 8:30 am until 6 pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 80.

This will be Mlokozi’s seventh’s loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of his second-hand clothes business and has repaid the loans successfully. He now hopes for a seventh loan to buy more stock for the same business.

Mlokozi will share this loan with his loan group, Umoja Charambe, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mlokozi is standing 1st from the left.

loans.use: To increase his stock of used clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia K. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a girl and two sons. She says two of her children are in school at the moment. The other one is yet to start school. Lydia’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her family in a rented apartment at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Offinso is a business/farming community. Lydia trades in fresh fish. She procures fresh fish from big cold store operators in the nearby cities at wholesale prices. She sells the fresh fish on a table in the local market square. She distributes mostly to food vendors in her community. Lydia has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She desires to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures. She hopes to help her husband to put up a building of their own.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es una joven de 19 años, muy alegre y conversadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, a los cuales ayuda en los gastos del hogar y aunque es muy joven, ya sabe lo que es trabajar arduamente. Ella vende ropa en el centro de Puno, tiene una tienda alquilada donde ofrece sus novedosos y bellos vestidos, los cuales son muy solicitados por las jovencitas, sobre todo para asistir a sus bailes de promoción del colegio. Lleva dos años en este negocio, en los cuales ha alivianado la carga económica de su familia, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a las jovencitas que viene a comprar vestidos, siempre les dice cual les queda mejor o cual combina con su color de piel, es una buena vendedora y espera tener una tienda más grande donde no solo venda vestidos, si no también ropa casual, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que permanecer mucho tiempo en su tienda sin poder salir. Es el segundo préstamo de Luz con MFP, y a su corta edad sabe que tiene que pagarlo y no fallar en sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que es la más joven y alegre. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita los invertirá en incrementar la mercadería de su tienda y comprar más vestidos.
texts.en:
Luz is a very happy and conservative 19 year old. She lives with her parents, whom she helps with household expenses. Although she is very young, she already knows what it means to work hard. She sells clothing in downtown Puno: she rents a shop where she sells her original, beautiful dresses, which are in high demand among young women, in particular for wearing to school graduation dances. Luz has two years of experience in this business, during which time she has lessened her family's financial burden. The thing she likes most about her job is giving advice to the young women who come to buy dresses. She always tells them which dresses suit them most, or which ones go best with their skin tones. She is a good saleswoman and hopes to have a larger shop where she can sell not only dresses, but also casual clothing. The thing she likes least about her job is having to stay at the shop for long periods of time. This is Luz's second loan with [kiva.org partner] Microfinanzas Prisma and, even at her young age, she already understands she must repay the loan and not fall behind on her payments. She is well liked in her community bank, seeing she is the youngest and happiest member. The 1,000 nuevos soles [about US$ 325] she is requesting will be used to expand the merchandise available in her shop and to purchase more dresses.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of merchandise

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Agé de 35 ans, Mr Kokou A. est un cultivateur et a, à sa charge, six (06) enfants. Il a bénéficié d’un premier crédit pour la culture de la banane qui a été dévastée par les précédentes inondations qu’a connu le Togo lors de la saison pluvieuse passée. Aujourd’hui il souhaite se lancer dans la culture du mais à grande échelle et sollicite pour cela un financement. Le financement de ce projet contribuera largement à changer positivement sa vie et celle de sa famille sur le plan social et économique.
texts.en:
Mr Kokou A., age 35, is a farmer who has 6 children to support. He obtained a first loan for his banana plantation that got destroyed by the floods that occurred in Togo during the latest wet season. He now wishes to start a large-scale corn growing business, which is why he is seeking a loan. Getting this loan will greatly contribute to changing his life, and those of his family, in a positive manner on the social and economic fronts.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn growing

loans.name: Argelia

texts.es: La señora Argelia vive con su esposo el señor Isaidel y tienen una niña; ella tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. nachos con queso, fritos con queso, paletas D. hielo, etc. Y su esposo trabaja para una empresa con un buen ingreso desD. hace una año, el esta apoyando a su esposa en solicitar este crédito para la compra D.  mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Argelia lives with her husband, Isaidel, and they have one daughter. She has a small business selling nachos with cheese, cheese fries, frozen ice pops, etc. Her husband has worked at an enterprise for one year, earning a good income. He is supporting his wife in this loan request, for the purchase of merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Akakpo drah a commencé depuis 2005 le commerce en gros d’eau en sachet« pure water », des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et elle a beaucoup de clientèle. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de bien satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a remboursé. Elle demande un deuxième crédit pour acheter 20 cartons VOLTIC, 100 sachets VOLTIC, 25 cartons VITAL, 100 sachet VITAL, 06 sacs de riz et 05 bidons d’huile. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est fonctionnaire d’état et à 02 enfants qui font  l’école primaire.
texts.en:
A. began a business in 2005 selling, on a wholesale basis, bags of drinking water of the brand «pure water», sacks of rice and jerrycans of oil. This business is going well and she has lots of customers. Her present stock does not permit her to satisfy her customers' needs. She has already had one loan from WAGES and has reimbursed it correctly. She is requesting her second loan to buy 20 cases of VOLTIC, 100 bags of VOLTIC, 25 cases of VITAL, 100 bags of VITAL, 6 sacks of rice, and 5 jerrycans of oil. She is married to a gentleman who is a civil servant and has two children who are in primary school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags of drinking water, VOLTIC, sacks of rice and jerrycans of oil

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito D. Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D.
