 Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo  en la compra de  pollos  de granja para luego venderlo destazado en la misma localidad, en la que lleva trabajando  un año y ve  que le está yendo bien ya que ha tenido una mejor ganancia.
  
     Su inspiración por esta actividad fue  para ayudar a su esposo y así  juntos trabajar para sacar adelante  a sus dos pequeños que viene creciendo.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando para seguir apoyando a su pequeña familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Aurora is married to José Walter, with whom she had two children who are still her responsibility.  She lives in a community in which they celebrate the feast of San José [Saint Joseph] in the month of March.

She requested the loan to invest in buying farm poultry to later sell cut up in the same town.  She has been doing this work for a year and she sees that it's going well for her because she has had better profits.
  
Her inspiration for this work was to help her husband and so work together to get their two growing little ones ahead.

What she most desires is that with this work she can continue working to continue supporting her small family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens and later sell them in the same town.

loans.name: Duong's Group

texts.en:
Duong is a 63-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children.  They are from the Siem Reap province. 

Duong was chosen the leader of this group, consisting of four members.  Duong and her husband are in the same business, fishing.  They have been involved in this business since 2000, and this is their main source of income. Typically, they generate approximately $7.00 per day. 

They work hard and spend most of their time on the boat along the River of Tole Sap, in order to catch as many fish as they can. 

With the loan, Duong will buy fishing materials such as fishing net, lines and hooks.  

She hopes she will make more profit to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, lines and hooks.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 26-year old married man with two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.
He rides a motorcycle and earns income with it. He has been in this business for six years and is challenged by the high fuel prices and the bad weather. He started by riding other peoples' motorcycles and later saved money and bought his own motorcycle. His business dream is to own more motorcycles. Stephen needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 49 years old, is married and comes from Kinuman, Ozamis City. Susan has been farming for 4 years, earning PHP 10,000 a month. In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be Susan's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Miralona

texts.en:
Miralona is 38 years old and married with 4 children.

Miralona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Miralona has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from a meat shop and hog raising.

Miralona aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is from Mayor's Village in Lapasan. She is 31 years old. Delsa is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Delsa operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to the local community. Delsa has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Delsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, vive en Yalaguina municipio de Estelí, tiene 51 años de edad e dedica a la venta de comida, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Ella tiene 20 años con su negocio de venta de comida, el empezó con un capital que su esposo le dio, antes ella trabajaba como enfermera auxiliar hasta que empezó a vender comida para dedicarse por completo al negocio. Tiene como expectativas ampliar su negocio con mas platos de comidas ofreciendo variedad, comprar inventario como empaques, cubiertos , platos , así como mejorar la infraestructura de su comideria. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar ,aceite, vegetales para realizar sus platillos. En lo futro le gustaría comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda para alquilarla y generar otros ingresos pues es una mujer que le gusta el progreso y salir delante de manera honrada.
texts.en:
Pilar lives in Yalaguina, a town in Estelí.  She is 51 years old, and has three children who are all financially independent.  

She has 20 years experience with her business selling food.  She began with some capital that her husband gave her.  Beforehand, she worked as an auxiliary nurse, until she began to sell food and focused completely on her business.

She has as her goals to expand her business with more dishes so that she can offer variety, and to purchase inventory such as packaging, flatware, and dishes, and int his way improve her establishment's infrastructure.

She is requesting the loan to purchase raw ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, and vegetables for making her dishes.  

In the future, she would like to buy some land to build a house which she will be able to rent out and generate additional income, as she is a woman who likes progress and to move ahead in life in an honorable way.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  tiene 51 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la provincia de Guanacaste llamada Guaitil. La economía de la zona de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Miguel se dedica al transporte de personas tanto a domicilio como también al público en general, con  lo cual le ha llevado el sustento diario a su familia , él es muy querido por los vecinos de la comunidad que usan su servicio de transporte.

En estos momentos lo que desea don Miguel es un  préstamo por ¢900,000(novecientos mil colones) ya que necesita comprar  repuestos a  su vehículo , pintarlo y hacerle varios arreglos ya que de este depende el trabajo y  por consiguiente la alimentación de su familia.

Don Miguel  es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A, razón por la cual se siente  muy agradecido por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder seguir trabajando en transporte y de esta manera servir a la comunidad .
texts.en:
Miguel, 51, lives with his family in a community in Guanacaste Province called Guaitil.  The economy of the Guanacaste zone is mainly based on animal husbandry although bee raising and hydroponics are also practiced here.

Miguel provides transportation both door to door and to the public in general; he’s provided daily sustenance for his family this way.  He is very well liked by neighbors in the community who use his transportation service.

At present, Miguel needs a loan for ¢900,000 (nine-hundred thousand) colones because he needs to buy spare parts for his vehicle, to paint it and to do several repairs because he depends on it for work and consequently to feed his family.

Miguel is a member of the Guaitil S.A. communal bank which is why he’s grateful for the opportunities to access credit it provides and to be able to continue working in transportation thus being of service to his community.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny, es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos.
Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comida, es propietaria de un restaurant cebichería, que funciona en su casa y al que se dedica todo el día.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: una congeladora pequeña para poder guardar las carnes, chichas y refrescos.
Teniendo su negocio en su misma casa puede  atender a sus hijos para que asistan al colegio sin ningún problema, trabaja todo el día para que nada les falte a sus hijos, en su negocio tiene una persona que le ayuda en la atención de sus clientes, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo lo que ha conseguido para su familia.  

Nota: en la foto se aprecia un cartel con el nombre de la cebichería ya que es de su propiedad, el letrero es movible.
texts.en:
Jenny’s a member of the “Mujeres De Éxito” (Women of Success) communal bank in Calleria District, Ucayali Deparment.  She’s 36-years-old, separated and has two children.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three cycles.  She sells food.  She owns a ceviche [marinated seafood] restaurant that operates at home and that she dedicates all day to.  She will use her new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy a small refrigerator to store her meats, chicha [corn-based beverage] and soft-drinks.

Having a home-based business allows her to care for her children so that they can continue attending school problem-free.  She works all day so that her children will lack nothing.  She has a person in her business that helps with customer service.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for everything she’s obtained for her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jose Esequiel

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre soltero de 49 años, se dedica al negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza en su ciudad natal, San Martin.
Es una persona que siempre ha luchado para apoyar a sus hermanos y padres, una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio y poder formar una familia. Él éxito y buen desempeño en sus labores se da gracias a que sus padres inculcaron en él muchos valores y trabaja con una ética intachable.
Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio y también adquirir más productos de belleza para tener en stock. De esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y seguirá apoyando a su familia y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is a single man, 49 years old, and works selling groceries and beauty products in his native city, San Martín.  He is a person who has always fought to help his siblings and parents. One of his goals is to grow his business and be able to form his own family.

His success and good performance of his work is thanks to his parents who instilled in him many values and he now has an impeccable work ethic.

Jose is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they offer he will be able to purchase merchandise to stock his business and also buy more beauty products to have in stock.  In this way he will increase his income and continue to support his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and beauty products for his business.

loans.name: Sharia Group

texts.fr: Manegu est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Sharia», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 45 ans, mère 8 enfants dont 5 étudient et 3 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en 3 sacs de maïs. Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Manegu is a merchant, a member of the borrowing group called «Sharia», and a client of Microfinance Institution Hekima. She is married to a civil servant, aged 45, and the mother of eight children, of whom five are in school and three are still little. 

Manegu has been selling foodstuffs in a local market for 10 years. She began her business with funds received from her husband. She intends to buy three sacks of maize for her inventory. She would like to grow her turnover, and feed and educate her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banking system. Please note that some of the women are holding their babies.

loans.use: to add three sacks of maize to her inventory

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 9 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya. She is 43 years old and a married mother of 6 children, often described as a very reliable person. 

Although Rose has been a farmer for 15 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though she is new to the program, Rose wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Rose hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as, even though Rose decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Som At

texts.en:
S. Som At is married and mother of 6 children, who are between 30 and 12 years old. She is not employed but still very busy with taking care of her children and grandchildren. Her husband is a moto-taxi, and brings two of their children to school in the city every morning.

S. Som At moved to this new place with her family only 12 days ago. All of them are still camping until their new house is built. That is why S. Som At contacted CREDIT. She needs a $500 loan to rent the skilled labor force ($250 for 1 week) and purchase the materials (another $250). S. Som At is saving money on the materials because she moved with the remains of her previous house. She already has wood and zinc for the roof.

When the house is finished, S. Som At is planning to start a business in the community. “With my next loan”, she said.

loans.use: Building a new house

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with 3 children in primary school. She started her business with assistance from her husband in 2005. With the loan of $150 from PEMCI she plans to expand her business in order to improve her income base. Through her cereals trading business she is ensuring food security for the local community especially during those times when there is drought and soon after the planting season when food availability is low.

loans.use: Increase on her inventory

loans.name: Zelaikha

texts.en: Zelaikha is 30 years old. She has an electronic flour mill. She gets grain and mills it. Her son is helping her do this by selling the milled flour to the market. She wants get a loan to buy flour and more fuel for generating electricity. She wants to expand her business and make more money and support her family economically.

loans.use: Electronic mill and fuel

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en: Yazgul is a 43-year-old woman with two children.  She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, living in the village of Kurdmakhmudlu.  She has  raised cattle for 7 years and now needs a loan of $950 to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama Mansary is a mother of five children.  She is married to a subsistence farmer whose income is insufficient to meet the family expenses.  At sixty years of age, Adama is still strong.  She runs a business of selling essential food items in the small village of Fadugu in Sierra Leone.   She supplements her husband’s meager income from the farm, especially during the rainy season.  Before Adama’s previous loan, she found it difficult to expand her business as a greater portion of the profit was used for family expenses.  Adama proudly said that with her previous loan, she made good profits and was able to meet all of her children’s school requirements in the last semester.  She is requesting a loan of $175 to be able to purchase her stock at wholesale prices.

loans.use: Expansion of food items for sale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
A few years ago, Irma suffered the loss of her life partner, her husband, which caused her much pain and grief. Since then her only goal was to succeed and secure the wellbeing her four minor children. Currently she owns a small general store in her humble home, in which she offers basic products. Additionally, she sells breakfast in her home's patio. This last activity is very satisfactory because it provides more money to enhance her family's quality of life. Her nearest wish is to expand her small sales stand and to increase the variety of products she carries, with the goal of offering a better service and satisfying the needs of her regular clients. With the money she will obtain after her investment she will be able to improve her beloved children's quality of life even more.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Hace algunos años Irma sufrió la pérdida de su compañero de toda la vida, su esposo, hecho que le causó mucho dolor y aflicción, desde entonces tuvo un único objetivo salir adelante y procurarles bienestar a sus cuatro hijos menores.Actualmente tiene una bodeguita ubicada en su humilde domicilio en el que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de desayunos en el patio de su casa, ésta última labor le genera mucha satisfacción debido a que le genera sumas adicionales de dinero para incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia.El deseo más próximo es ampliar su pequeño espacio de ventas e incrementar mucho más la variedad de sus productos, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus asiduos clientes. Con el dinero que obtenga luego de su inversión podrá acrecentar aún más el nivel de vida de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en: Christabel A. is 60 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a retired government employee, and two of her remaining children (many of her children died of HIV- and Aids-related illness) in Nyamasaria Kisumu Kenya. She normally puts on a gloomy face as she narrates her story. Christabel takes care of 13 grandchildren, orphaned as a result of the HIV epidemic. She was trained as a Community Health Worker in 1988, and now provides home-based care services to six clients (HIV clients). Besides her community work, she runs three different businesses:  a hotel, which was initiated in 1966, a tailoring business, started in 1972, and a coca-cola kiosk, where she has sold coca-cola products since 2004. She requires US $700 to expand her coca-cola kiosk, and purchase products in bulk.

loans.use: Expand her coca-cola kiosks and purchase soft drinks (coke, fanta, sprite, etc)

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en:
Miriam L. has a retail store, a stone quarry, and rears cattle. She will use the loan to increase her stone inventory, buy more stones, purchase another farm, start a brick making business, purchase a calf and buy feed for her cow.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Runyenjes Community Based Distributors Group

texts.en: Runyenjes CBD (community-based distributors) group with 40 registered members was started in 1996 with the mission to distribute contraceptives, provide health education, and go on home visits. Meeting monthly on the hospital grounds, they share their experiences and problems in the field and try to find solutions. They are being helped by the Runyenjes Hospital staff that has provided information about family planning issues and also supplied them with contraceptives. Other partners of the Runyenjes group include the Ministry of Health and numerous other organizations, such as the Chogoria Hospital CBD. In 2001, Kisumu Medical & Education Trust sponsored updates and trainings on a number of key issues, including family planning, the Community Based Abortion Care Project (COBAC), as well as first-aid and home-based care. KMET have been supplying the group with contraceptives as well as Nutriflour which they distribute to the community. The community truly appreciates the services KMET is offering through their partnerships. KMET has also empowered the group's members through its loans. Consequently, Runyenjes group's members have improved their living standards and health status as well as the severity of poverty in the community. The members are motivated and have been able to reach more clients with family planning services. The area where the group provides its services is agriculturally rich, and the main economic activity and source of income is farming. It is the case also for the members of Runyenjes group - 90% of them grow various crops ranging from tea and coffee, to maize and bananas. The produce, especially bananas grown in large amounts, is transported to Nairobi, 200 km away. A lot of money is spent on hiring a truck to transport the produce to the market for sale. The Runyenjes group is therefore asking for a loan of US$5,000 to help them pay for part of the distribution van cost so as to make product distribution easier and less costly.

loans.use: Purchase of a van to help transport farm produce to the market

loans.name: Marina Martina

texts.es:
Señora Marina Martina García Gonzáles is fifty years old. She studied up until the fourth grade of primary school, because her parents didn't have sufficient means. She has three children but only two are stil under her care. She lives in Poblado Menor "Cuyuchugo" of the district of Usquil in La Libertad, Perú.

She is dedicated to buying and selling clothes for gentlemen and ladies like dress coats, sweaters, and pants, which she buys in bulk to sell and obtain a profit. Furthermore, Señora Marina manufactures aprons, skirts, and vests; many of these are orders from clients that she has won over time.

She comes to Chota and San Agustín to offer her products to the residents of La Libertad.

Her business began twenty years ago with fruit sales, travelling through various parts of the Liberteña mountains. Little by little she became known and gained various clients this way, who made clothing requests and so she began to sell those products. After that she began delivering in great quantities, not only clothing orders that she bought, but also clothes that she made.

Señora Marina is a member of the communal bank "San Juan de Miraflores" where she obtained her first loan of 300 Soles. With this money she bought fabric, threads, and oil for her sewing machine.

With the loan of 1700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy fabrics, threads, and a half dozen sweaters and dress coats.

Her great longing is to have a vehicle in which she can transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Marina Martina García Gonzáles tiene 50 años de edad, ella estudió hasta el cuarto grado de primaria porque sus padres no tuvieron mayores posibilidades. Tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo 2 aún están a su cargo. Vive en el Poblado Menor “Cuyuchugo” del Distrito de Usquil de la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para caballeros y damas tales como casacas, chompas y pantalones, los cuales compra al por mayor para venderlos por unidades y así obtener ganancias. Además la señora Marina confecciona mandiles, faldas y vestidos; muchos de éstos son pedidos que le hace su clientela que ha conseguido con el tiempo.

Sus productos los viene ofreciendo por los caseríos de Chota y San Agustín pertenecientes a la provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Su negocio lo inició hace 20 años con la venta de frutas, viajaba por varias partes de la sierra Liberteña. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y de esta manera obtuvo varios clientes quienes le hacían algunos pedidos de ropa y así empezó a vender estos productos. Posteriormente llevaba en mayor cantidad, no solo pedidos de ropa que ella compraba para vender, sino también ropa que ella confeccionaba.

La señora Marina es integrante del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” en donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró telas, hilos y aceite para su maquina de cocer.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00, que cancelará en 4 meses comprará telas, hilos, y media docena de chompas y casacas.

Su mayor anhelo es tener un vehículo en el que pueda trasladar su mercadería.

loans.use: With the loan she wants to buy fabrics, threads, and oil for her sewing machine

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a thirty-five year old mother of four children.  She operates a small undergarments shop in an alley in central Kumasi.  She has been operating this business for two years.  With this loan, she hopes to expand her inventory to include different varieties of clothing.  By increasing her varieties of products, she hopes to increase sales and help her children with educational expenses.  

Veronica is a member of the trust group In Him is Life.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member of the group repays their fair share.  

Veronica is wearing a blue shirt.  Her Sinapi loan officer, Annastasia, is standing next to her.

loans.use: To purchase different varieties of undergarments

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married woman with 1 child, age 7 years old. Lydia is a clothes seller, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for business.

loans.name: Bung

texts.en:
Bung T., age 51, is a widow and resided in Phnom Penh for many years where one of her children, who is married, work as garment factory worker with a salary $80 a month. Another child is a student. After Bung T.’s husband passed, she work very hard to supplement the household. She harvests crops and does farming for one of the villagers. On average, she makes about $4 per day.

Because of the difficulty of meeting daily expenses, Mrs. Bung T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law so he can start a motor-taxi so he can better contribute to the family's support. She will  use the remainder of the loan to purchase wood to repair house. Her house in leaks in the rainy season. She hopes to save enough money so her child can attend the university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to operate motor-taxi.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 35 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Samer distributes TV Satellites and cable to his clientele. His child, who is four years old, will enter school next year and Samer needs $1200 to pay for the registration fees.

Samer has requested a loan before, and has an excellent record of on-time repayment. He is a responsible entrepreneur who works hard to secure his family’s safety and the education of his child.

loans.use: To pay for the education of his child

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is a brave and strong woman. At 47 years of age, she is in charge of supporting her family. She takes great satisfaction in being alongside her 22 year old son who is in school. She supports him so that he can finish his university career. Consuelo sells all kinds of personal articles. When she has an opportunity to acquire merchandise at a low price that will allow to obtain future profits, she does not hesitate to do so. In this occasion she was able to acquire children’s backpacks and women’s purses. She sells her merchandise on the streets of Huancayo. Consuelo is starting another business which will be a fruit juice stand. She wishes to rent a stand and to buy the necessary equipment to make juices. At the present time she needs to increase the sale of her merchandise to obtain greater profits so she can continue on the road to establish her new business. For this reason she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo es una mujer luchadora y valiente, a sus 47 años de vida, está pendiente del sostenimiento de su hogar, tiene la gran satisfacción de estar al lado de su hijo de 22 años que está estudiando, ella lo apoya para que pueda concluir su carrera universitaria. Consuelo vende todo tipo de artículos personales, si tiene la oportunidad de adquirir mercadería a un bajo precio que le permita obtener futuras ganancias, no duda en hacerlo, así como en esta ocasión pudo conseguir mochilas para niños y carteras para dama; vende de manera ambulante en las calles de Huancayo. Consuelo está iniciando otro negocio, que es el de una juguería, desea alquilar un local y comprar lo necesario para la elaboración de jugos. Pero, por el momento necesita incrementar la venta de su mercadería para obtener mejores ganancias y continuar dando pasos para su siguiente negocio. Para ello, solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her business so that with the profits she can open a fruit juice stand.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара родилась 1960 году. Она разведена и у нее 2 детей, они живут в городе Вахдат. На данный момент она занимается продажей продуктов питания и народного потребления. Гулсаре помогает племянник. А бизнес она начала с продаж продуктов питания еще 5 лет назад. Гулсара занимается этой деятельностью в центральном рынке города Вахдат. Большую часть своих товаров она а закупает в торговом центре «Садбарг». С целью расширения ассортимента (конфеты, печенье, рулеты, зубная паста…) и оборота своего бизнеса она хочет получить займ в сумме 1600 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев а в будущем хочет открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Gulsara was born in 1960. She is divorced and has 2 children. They live in the city of Vahdat. Currently, she sells foodstuffs and household goods. Gulsara’s nephew helps her. She started selling food 5 years ago. Gulsara works in the Vahdat central market. She purchases most of her goods from the Sadbarg shopping center. In order to expand her inventory (to include candy, cookies, sweet rolls, tooth-paste, etc.) and keep the money in her business, she wants to take out a loan for 1600 somoni for 12 months. In the future, she wants to open her own shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing different types of sweets

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. joined TYM in 2004. At first she borrowed VND 500,000 to raise livestock. Now, after 4 years with TYM Fund, her family invests most of the loans in animal raising. This business is doing well and brings in a stable annual income. Her husband is a commune electrician; her children are grown-up and have stable jobs. Therefore, with their own income and financial assistance from their children, she and her husband have an income of VND 2.5 million per month. For the next cycle, she is applying for VND 9 million to invest in animal raising.

loans.use: to invest in animal raising

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.en:
Anna has had a shop selling clothing in Dodoma, Tanzania for 4 years. She is now seeking her first loan so that she may buy a greater quantity of clothing in bulk to resell at her shop. She works for 7 hours daily and earns a profit of approximately US$ 70 each month. If her increased inventory results in greater profit, she intends to use the money to pay her child's school fees, get more food for her family, and improve her home.

Anna is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Halima and Shakila.

loans.use: To buy more clothes in bulk to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Lucía Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia H. se dedica a la venta de desayunos y bebidas en un mercado de la cuidad de La Paz, Bolivia, todas las mañanas se traslada desde su domicilio ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia hasta la ciudad de La Paz acompañada de sus hijos, quienes le ayudan en el negocio por las mañanas, porque por las tardes asisten a la escuela, cercana al mercado, la hija mayor se encarga por las mañanas de colaborar a doña Lucía en la venta de cafe y por la tarde asiste a la escuela, al finalizar el dia toda la familia retorna a descansar a su domicilio. Es madre soltera y su trabajo representa el único sustento del hogar, espera que con el microcrédito su negocio pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs Lucia H. sells breakfasts and drinks for a living, in a market located in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Every morning she and her children commute from their home in the city of El Alto, also in Bolivia, to La Paz. Her children only help her with the business in the morning because in the afternoons they go to school, which is near the market. In the mornings, the eldest daughter helps Mrs Lucia sell coffee and in the afternoons, she goes to school. When the day draws to an end, the whole family returns home to rest. Mrs Lucia is a single mother and so her job alone supports the family. She hopes that the micro-loan will allow her business to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara was born in 1985. She lives in Khachmaz region and is single. She has been in the cattle breeding business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy 2 calves to improve her cattle breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Cet homme agé d'une cinquantaine d' années est marié et pére de plusieurs enfants .Son principal activité est la vente de paille d 'arachide  et d'aliment de betail.Avec la fin de d'hivernage la paille d 'arachide  pricipal aliment des chevaux se vend a bon maerché .c'est le moment de renouveller les stocks en vu de preparer de saison seche période de forte demande en paille d' arachide.Aissi le pret sollicité servira à renforcer ses capacités de stockage.
texts.en:
This gentleman, who is around 50, is married and the father of several children. His primary business is selling peanut straw and other livestock fodder. With the end of the rainy season, peanut straw, the principal fodder for horses, goes for a low price. This is the moment to stock up in order to prepare for the dry season, when peanut straw is in great demand. So the requested loan will be used to expand his capacity for warehousing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is fifty years old. She is widowed but has four children to cater for: a boy and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. One of her children is in senior high school; the rest have all completed junior high school but couldn’t continue due to financial constraints, though she had hoped to sponsor them to continue.

Agnes sells a local food called ‘kenkey.’ It is prepared from corn dough. The dough is cooked first and then balled in a plantain leaf. It is boiled again for hours. Kenkey is served hot or cold with stew or ground pepper and fried fish. Agnes procures bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding communities. She supplies to retailers in her community and also sells on a table top in the local market square. She has been in business for over twenty years. Agnes wants a loan to procure bags of maize to produce the kenkey in bulk. She needs to increase her profit to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk, which she will use to make 'kenkey,' a local food

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 25 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Es un gran a aficionado a la música y desde su niñez, aprendió a tocar diversos instrumentos musicales, es por ello que junto sus amistades más cercanas decidió ofrecer el servicio de música en una orquesta a la cual pertenece “Los Hermano B.”, ellos amenizan todos los eventos sociales y fiestas patronales de su localidad, tocando el bajo, que es el instrumento musical con el que acompaña a la orquesta, el cual no es de su propiedad. El sueño de Luis es poder tener su propia banda musical y ser reconocido como un artista. Es la primera oportunidad de Luis en solicitar un préstamo dentro de su banco comunal con MFP, y asume con compromiso pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de un bajo electrónico, para así poder conformar su propia orquesta.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old and lives at home with his parents. He is a fan of music, and since childhood he learned to play various musical instruments, which is why alongside his closest friends he decided to offer music services in an orchestra. He is a member of "Los Hermanos B.,” they liven up any social events and local festivities, by playing bass, which is the musical instrument he uses to accompany the orchestra, which he does not own. Luis’ dream is to have his own band and be recognized as an artist. This is his first opportunity to apply for a loan from his community bank with MFP, and he assumes the commitment of making his payments on time. The money he is requesting is for the purchase of an electric bass, so he can form his own orchestra.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an electric bass

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put a down payment on a motorcycle, buy a sidecar for the motorcycle, and to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal H. is 44 years old and he lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village, in Kandal province. He is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Chen Nary, is employed in a garment factory and earns a little salary. This couple has three children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the others attend the local school.

Visal is requesting a loan to pay for beauty school fees for his first child. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living after his children finish school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: Pay for beauty school for his first child.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
K. Mariam is the leader of Dembe group in Jinja. She is a married woman with a hotel/restaurant business that she has been running for six years. She has four children that are all in school. The family live on top of the restaurant. She is also a farmer and most of the foodstuffs that she prepares in her restaurant come from her garden, hence enabling her to save.

Mariam needs to stock more rice for her restaurant since she doesn’t have a rice plantation at the moment and also to buy more sauce for the same purpose. Getting loans has enabled her to increase her daily income as well as to learn how to manage her business and save.

loans.use: To buy rice and sauce for her restaurant

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, tiene 36 años y  vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas Deys de 9 y Deysi de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Catalina es la venta de combustible, el cual vende ambulatoriamente, desde muy temprano sale a la calle en busca de clientes, quienes no dudan en comprarle debido a los precios cómodos que ofrece, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y generalmente siempre vuelve a su casa con los bidones vacíos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en este negocio y lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en la calle soportando los cambios repentinos del clima, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Más adelante espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender su combustible con mayor comodidad. Catalina se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados planea comprar más combustible e incrementar la cantidad que vende diariamente.
texts.en:
Catalina is a joyful and hardworking woman. She is 36 years old and lives in her own house, along with her 2 daughters, who are 9 and 2 years old. They are the reason for all her hard work. Catalina’s business is fuel sales, which she does as a street vendor. She goes to work very early in the morning in search of customers, who have no doubts about buying from her due to the affordable prices she offers. She is a very persuasive salesperson and almost always returns home with her containers empty. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers. She has been doing this for 10 years and the most difficult part is having to be in the street all day, putting up with sudden changes in the weather. Even so, she knows she has to work very hard to achieve her goals. She hopes eventually to have a store where she can sell her fuel in more comfortable conditions. Catalina is in her second loan from MFP. She is very determined to make her payments on time because she would like to receive future loans. In her communal bank she is a very participative and is supportive of everyone else. With her loan of 1500 PEN she plans to buy more fuel and increase the amount she sells daily.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory of merchandise (fuel)

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат 45 лет, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Старший сын находится на заработках в России.  Саёхат работает в санатории Зумрад, который широко известен как в Таджикистане, так и за его пределами. Работа постоянная и Саёхат занята здесь всю неделю. По выходным дням вместе со своим мужем Саёхат занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота на рынках. Сейчас цены на скот приемлемые и поэтому торговля идет хорошо. Узнав про КИВА Саёхат решила подать заявку на займ и немного расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sayohat is 45 years old; she is married and has 4 children. Her oldest son is earning money in Russia. Sayohat works at the Zumrad sanatorium which is widely known both in Tajikistan and outside its borders. The job is permanent and Sayohat is busy there all week. On the weekends, together with her husband Sayohat purchases and sells small, horned livestock at the markets. Right now, livestock prices are acceptable and this is why sales are going well. Having found out about KIVA, Sayohat decided to apply for a loan and to expand her business a little bit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif was born in 1969. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Khodjali region, and is now settled in Baku city. He is married and has three children. Six years ago he decided to start a business selling juices. Now he needs a loan of 1300 AZN to buy more juice for expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy juices to sell

loans.name: Las Provincianas Group

texts.es: “Las provincianas” son un grupo de 12 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”,  se caracterizan por hablar el idioma aimará (idioma nativo).Teodora Limache explica que inicialmente se reunían en la zona German Busch en una casa alquilada, pero con el pasar del tiempo, se tuvieron que trasladar a el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”. Teodora tiene el negocio de venta de chamarras que lleva a Desaguadero (Frontera con Perú)  y el préstamo que obtiene lo invierte  para comprar chamarras, cuidando que sea de diferentes modelos. Las demás integrantes también tienen diferentes negocios como: venta de calculadoras, mantas, pescado, verduras, chompas y otros.
texts.en:
Las Provincianas is a group of 12 women who attend their meetings at the Alto Lima community center. They share the characteristic of speaking the Aimará language (native language). Teodora Limache explains that they initially met in the German Busch zone in a rented house. But, with the passage of time, they had to move to the Alto Lima community center. Teodora sells jackets that she takes to Desaguadero (on the border with Perú). She will use the loan to buy jackets, and she will be careful so that they are different styles. The rest of the members also have different businesses such as selling calculators, blankets, fish, vegetables, sweaters, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sr. De Malta Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio Avenida Suecia, donD. se conocen bien, el Banco D. Emprendimiento se llama  "SEÑOR D. MALTA" esta conformada como presidenta la señora Gloria S. R., quien es una D. las mas responsables  y serias del grupo, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en plena avenida,con el credito D. Emprender esta surtiendo su venta. La tesorera del grupo es la señora Betty Q. E., quien es una socia antigua D. Emprender, D. buen caracter, conoce muy bien a las socias,  ella tiene un cochecito donD. venD. hamburguesas, salchipapas  en plena avenida juntamente con la sobrina que es como su hija por que se la recogio desD. pequeña y con ella son 5 los hijos que tiene, su venta es a partir D. las 7 D. la noche hasta muy tarD..
texts.en:
Señor D. Malta, an enterprising bank, is comprised of women who live in the same neighborhood of Avenica Suecia. They know each other well. Gloria S. R. is the president. She is one of the most responsible and serious members. She has a grocery story in the central zone. With the loan from Emprender she is stocking her store. Betty Q. E. is the treasurer of the group. She is an old member of Emprender. She is good natured, and she knows the members very well. She has a little food car where she sells hamburgers and “salchipapas” (fast food maD. from fried sausages and fried potatoes) in the central zone. She sells together with her niece, who is like a daughter to her. She took her in when she was small. Counting her niece, she has five children. She sells from seven in the evening until very late.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Rouguyatou

texts.fr: Rouguyatou B. est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter sa capacité de production et faire des bénéfices afin de mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales
texts.en:
Rouguyatou B. is a 33-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six. She is requesting this loan to increase her production capacity and to make a profit for supporting her husband more with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Rishel

texts.en:
Rishel is a high school graduate who used to work as a housemaid after she graduated from high school. She just married a few months ago and is already pregnant. Her husband works as a farm laborer in their village. Hopefully, her business will uplift their living conditions to provide a nice future for their coming children. The couple lives in the village of Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela.

Rishel is engaged in selling rice and vegetables. She does it to help her husband in gaining income for the preparation of having a family. In her daily vending, she generates an income of 200 Philippine pesos (about $4) daily, which is somehow helpful in sustaining their daily needs. Rishel is now requesting a loan of PHP3,000 to be used as additional capital in purchasing vegetables and sacks of rice. She is praying that her business will be supported enough to maintain it and someday expand it.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de l'huile rouge

loans.name: Marta Emilia

texts.es: Marta Emilia A. D. H. resiD. en Soyapango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Marta tiene 38 años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos D. 10 y 14 años D. edad, estudiantes y su esposo Carlos quien es Pastor D. una iglesia evangélica D. la zona D. Soyapango. Marta posee su propio negocio es una venta D. productos personales como perfumes y cremas, también venD. ropa; y si todo esto no fuese poco, Marta ahora ha montado una venta D. pupusas para poder generar mayores ingresos, el crédito que solicita Marta es para surtir su inventario D. productos y comprar harina para aumentar la producción D. sus pupusas.
texts.en:
Marta Emilia A. D. H. lives in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. Marta is 38, and she lives with her husband and two children. The children, ages 10 and 14, go to school. Her husband, Carlos, is a pastor in an evangelical church in the Soyapango region. Marta has her own business selling personal products like perfumes and creams. She also sells clothes. As if all that was not enough, Marta now sells “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) to be able to generate more income. The loan that Marta is asking for is to stock her inventory of products and to buy flour to increase her production of pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business and buy supplies for "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas)

loans.name: Kien

texts.en: The two people who appear in the picture above are Mrs. Kien S. and her husband. Kien S. is a low-income woman and a humble villager living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She owns a few looms, which she uses to weave silk skirts to sell. She also sells her finished shirts to middlemen, who then sell her goods to retailers at nearby markets. Kien S. is married with three children, all three of whom attend school and help in the weaving business when they are not studying. Her husband is a construction foreman. He has an employee who helps him provide his services. Kien S. is taking out a loan for her husband to use as capital so he can buy more construction materials to help facilitate his business.

loans.use: To buy more constructing materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother with a child who is currently in school.

To support her household, Abena sells cereals like beans and groundnuts (peanuts) to her loyal customers in the community market. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities.

Abena says the selling of these products is very lucrative and, with her six years experience, she can increase her market share. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially her child’s education, and business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma D. A. reside en Berlín en el departamento de Usulután. Ana tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y madre tres niños aun menores de edad. El negocio de Ana surgió tras la necesidad de esta joven mujer por sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que no cuenta con el respaldo del padre de los niños, ella ha instalado un negocio en el mercado municipal de Usulután y lleva como nombre “Venta de Ropa Dorita”, el negocio de Ana como su nombre lo dice, es la venta de ropa, que en su mayoría es para niños y niñas, el motivo del crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio con más variedad de ropa no solo para niños, sino también para adolecentes y adultos, así podrá ampliar mas su panorama de comercialización.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma D. A. is a resident of Berlin in the department of Usulután. She is 31 years old and a single mother of three dependent children. Ana started her business so that she could provide for her children since she lacks the support of their father. Her business is called “Venta de Ropa Dorita” and is located in the Usulután municipal market. As the name implies, she sells clothing, mostly for boys and girls.

The loan she requested will be used to restock her business with a wider variety of clothing, not only for children, but also for teenagers and adults. This will allow her to expand her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en: Maria Cristina C. has been married to Francis Aquino for over ten years. Together, they have two sons, who now work abroad. She is a merchant and vendor and owns a food stall and canteen outside her home. She makes sufficient profits to help her cover the household expenses. Maria has been a client of the Foundacion Paraguaya since 2006. She has received loans for the renovation of her home and the purchase of merchandise and has always paid her loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Deisy Marlene

texts.es: Deisy Marlene A. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 10 y 8 años de edad. Deisy se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante por las calles de Colón desde hace más de tres años. Desde muy temprano ella se dispone a vender lo más posible, con el deseo de percibir alguna ganancia lo cual le permita llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Si bien es cierto su esposo también trabaja, esto no da abasto para todos los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas, es por esto que Deisy solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad y diversidad de ropa, y de esta manera poder brindarles más opciones a sus clientes y así mismo captar la atención de nuevas consumidores de su producto.
texts.en:
Deisy Marlene A. M., 28, lives with her life partner and their two daughters, who are 10 and 8 years old, respectively, in Colón, La Libertad department. Daisy has peddled clothes in Colón's streets for the last 3 years. She starts out very early in the morning in order to sell the greatest quantity possible hoping to earn profits to contribute to household expenses. Even though her husband also works, he does not earn enough to cover all the household expenses and their daughters' educational costs. This is the reason why Deisy is requesting funding which will allow her to buy a larger quantity and variety of clothing so that she can offer her customers more options and, at the same time, attract new customers for her product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Isabel Dinora

texts.es: Isabel Dinora F. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y dos nietos los cuales dependen de ella. Isabel posee una venta de tortillas y una tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como: gas propano granos básicos y golosinas. Dinora solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar maíz para la elaboración de más tortillas, ya que cerca de su casa hay una fábrica y los trabajadores de éste lugar van a comprar las tortillas donde ella. Así mismo desee poder surtir la tienda con productos como bebidas enlatadas, gaseosas, pan y otro productos más los cuales le permitirán aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera poder brindarles a sus nietos todo lo necesario, así mismo contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Isabel Dinora A. F. is 41 years old and lives in Arce City, La Libertad with her husband and two of their grandchildren, whom they care for. Isabel owns a tortilla stand and a shop that sells products like propane gas, grain and candy. Isabel will use her loan to buy corn for making tortillas. There's a factory near her house, and the workers like to stop by for tortillas. She also wants to stock her shop with canned drinks, sodas, bread, and anything else that might help her increase her sales. She hopes this loan will help her provide for her grandchildren, and allow her to help her husband with their other household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and perishable goods

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April grows rice for a living. She is 23 years old, married and has three kids. Her oldest child is only 5 years old. She wants her children to have a bright future. She and her husband work hand-in-hand in making the farm productive. When free of farming duties, her husband uses their own motorcycle to transport people around their community. April is thankful for this because it adds income to her household.

April is now requesting to borrow 6,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will definitely be used for farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Emelyn's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Emelyn D. runs a canteen in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Brgy. Pieza, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. Emelyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Emelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Emelyn is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Meltus

texts.en:
Meltus O. is a businessman who plants and sells maize in Musoma Nambale, Busia District. He used to be employed but retired to start this business in 2005 in order to generate income and provide for his wife and their seven children.
Meltus buys his stock twice a year during planting seasons. At 50 years old, Meltus still has lots of energy, but insufficient income to expand his business so as to ensure his economic stability and sustainability. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to increase and improve his business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fish and vegetables sales

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita A. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin province. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rosita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the town of Brgy.Uno, Katipunan. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Helen owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. Helen is just starting this business.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to operate a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Helen is requesting a new loan, her 4th, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake sells shoes and bags to earn a living. She has been in this business for long. She is happy in her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a shoe company in the future. She is 45 years old and she is widow with 2 children. Folake’s children are doing well at school. Life as a widow has been very challenging and she hopes to overcome the challenge.. She is a LAPO client. Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She is requesting for a loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more bags and shoes to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Madame Fati B. is 57 years old and was born in Assoli, Togo. She sells charcoal and firewood out of her home in Lomé. Fati and her husband have five children. He works for the military.

Madame B. has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA to purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell. This is her first time working with WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: 24 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Villa Tejada, recientemente se conformo la Asociación Comunal 24 de Mayo. Su presidenta es Ricarda C. de 39 años, comenta que se dedica a vender ropa de lunes a domingo, en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, ofreciendo a diferentes personas, su horario de ventas es de3 de la tarde a 8 de la noche, necesita el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprando mercadería y ofertar  variadas prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The community association '24 de Mayo' was recently formed in one of Pro Mujer´s community centres in Villa Tejada. Their president is Ricarda C., 39 years of age, who sells clothes 7 days a week in different markets in the city of El Alto. She works from 3 in the afternoon until 8 at night, and needs this loan to increase her working capital to buy merchandise and other items of clothing for her customers. The other members of this association have various businesses in the commercial, production and service industries.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Oscar Jesus

texts.es: El Señor Oscar Jesús es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora cuenta con un trabajo pero también le ayuda a su esposa en el negocio familiar a vender productos naturales, Por eso esta solicitando este préstamo para invertir en su negocio ya que entre los dos lo han hecho crecer y así han mejorado sus condiciones de vida, por tal motivo La Sra. Alejandra Daniela esposa del Sr. Oscar aparece en la fotografía al lado de los productos que manejan para las ventas.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar Jesús is a very hard-working person and entrepreneur. He and his wife work together in the family business selling natural products. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business that they have expanded and consequently, improve their living conditions. Sra. Alejandra Daniela, Sr. Oscar's wife, appears in the photo next to the products that they sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children, all of whom are  at school. She also takes care of her in-laws. She owns a stall in Kalerwe market, selling bananas. 

She plans to use this loan to a buy more bunches of bananas. She buys these bananas from villages of Masaka in south central Uganda. Mary uses public transport to and from Masaka, where she goes for shopping once a week. She has been in this business for 10 years and she also sells furniture to get additional income. 

She receives an average of 30 people and sells both on a retail and wholesale basis. Her customers are the people in the market and nearby communities. She works seven days a week. She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are transportation and seasonality.   

She aspires to see her business grow big and to build her own house. Mary decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital. 

She resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and market dues.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: To make a living, Nelia P. runs a general store selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Bagong Sikat, Alicia, Isabela. Nelia has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver and Efua uses her income to support her husband in providing the needs of the children such as feeding and clothing. She has no educational background.

Efua buys fresh fish and smokes it for sale at Takoradi. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. is married and has a child. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a miner.

Maame operates a provision shop at Takoradi and uses the income she generates from her sales to educate her child with the help of her husband. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Manzura Kazybekova's Group

texts.en:
Sometimes life is not as would be normally expected. Even a highly educated person must have a good sense of luck. In Kyrgyzstan, especially in villages, people have learned to work hard. Most often this work is manual labor. But as is known, any kind of labor is good.

Manzura K. is the leader of this group. She is 31, married and has two young children who go to the nursery school “Ak Kaiyn.” Her husband is a crane operator. Manzura is a first category specialist in sports and works in the House of Culture. In past years she did house repairs. Manzura also breeds livestock to sell. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding. In the near future the family wants to buy a Volkswagen.

Nargiza D. is the treasurer of this group. She is 25, married and is temporarily bringing up her daughter by herself because her husband is working in Russia. By leaving the child in a kindergarten, she has had more time to work at her business of breeding cattle. She has been doing so successfully for four years, yet the family can’t afford major purchases. She needs a loan in order to buy two goats for breeding. Nargiza still cherishes the hope of buying a new house with modern conveniences.

Almazbek S., 25, is a bachelor. He raises money by breeding cattle. Presently he has one cow and eleven goats. He would like a loan to buy two more goats for breeding. Almazbek is planning to marry in the near future.

Eliza D., 22, is married to a private builder. The couple has two small daughters. This young wife raises money by breeding cattle. As a result of hard work, she has three head of livestock. Eliza needs a loan to buy two goats for breeding. She wishes to obtain a car for herself.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 43 years old and is married with five children. She graduated from primary school.

She will use this loan to improve her business by purchasing a table and chair and an embroidery machine. She has a good reputation and is a worthy and trusted borrower.

She is supporting her husband with her good business in order to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and a table and chair

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia C. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by running a vegetable plantation. She lives in Lower Ilian within Barangay Dumarao, a part of Roxas municipality, Palawan province on the island region of MIMAROPA. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard on her vegetable plantation, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP.

Julia is now borrowing 12,500 PHP so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Julia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital for her farm

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, D. 41 años, vive al lado D. su esposo Rubén D. 48 años y D. sus 3 jóvenes hijos, que son mayores D. edad, y juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. DesD. hace 2 años, esta emprendedora mujer instaló en su casa un negocio D. alquiler D. cabinas D. Internet. Empieza su labor desD. las 9 D. la mañana y se prolonga hasta las 10 D. la noche; y esta muy satisfecha pues sus hijos la apoyan en la atención cuando ella debe salir. Aunque el negocio es tranquilo, manifiesta que es algo sacrificado, pues muchas veces sus clientes le piden que deje abierto el local hasta tarD., pero por las buenas ganancias que obtiene, trata D. sacrificarse y continuar trabajando para ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Con el pasar del tiempo ha captado buenos clientes que la visitan seguido, además ha logrado implementar mejor sus cabinas D. Internet. Como siempre planea el futuro ampliar el negocio, asimismo quiere instalar un local D. alquiler D. videojuegos. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luz  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. 2 videojuegos para empezar con el futuro negocio con el que asegura mejorará sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old.  She lives with her 48 year-old husband Rubén and her 3 grown-up children.  They work hard every day to get ahead in life.  Two years ago this entrepreneurial woman set up an Internet café in her house.  She starts working at 9 o'clock in the morning and works until 10 o'clock at night.  She is very happy because her children help to mind the business when she has to go out.  Although the business is relaxed, she says that she has to make sacrifices because very often her customers ask her to stay open until late.  However, because she makes a good income, she tries to make these sacrifices and continues to work in order to help her husband with the constant household expenses.  Over time, she has attracted good customers who keep coming back.  She has also managed to set up her Internet stations better.  In the future, she is planning to expand her business and she also wants to set up a video game rental place.
